analyzed: bhūtam bhavyam bhaviṣyat ca pāṭhasya lakṣaṇam param

analyzed: śālagrāmasya māhātmyam tīrthānām parvatasya ca

analyzed: ṣaṭkarmaṇaḥ ca māhātmyam śakti māhātmyam uttamam
translated: The greatness of the six actions, and the excellent greatness of Shakti.

analyzed: mantrāṇām sādhakānām ca sādhanasya maheśvara
translated: O Mahesvara, of the mantras, the adepts, and the means of attainment,

analyzed: varṣakṛtyasya māhātmyam uparāgasya vai tathā  patra puṣpasya māhātmyam sādhyasya ca tathā eva ca
translated: The greatness of the annual rites, and likewise of the Uparāga,🔽The greatness of leaves and flowers, and likewise of the Sādhya,

analyzed: bali dānasya māhātmyam paśu pakṣi ādikasya ca
translated: The greatness of offering oblations, and of animals, birds, etc.,

analyzed: karmaṇaḥ ca tathā kṛtyam dehasya ca tathā eva ca
translated: The duties of the rite, and likewise of the body,

analyzed: mudrā āsanasya yogasya dhāraṇā adhyayanasya ca
translated: The yoga of mudrā and āsana, and of meditation and study,

analyzed: varṇānām varṇa māhātmyam tathā kartavya karmaṇaḥ
translated: The greatness of the letters and their constituent elements, and likewise of the duties to be performed,

analyzed: devasya vihitasya api dharmma adharmasya tat param
translated: The supreme Dharma and Adharma of even the ordained god,

original: yugānāṃ yugamānasya jyotiḥ śāstrasya vai tathā //
analyzed: yugānām yuga mānasya jyotiḥ śāstrasya vai tathā
translated: The measure of the yugas, and likewise of the science of astrology,

analyzed: kāvya śāstrasya māhātmyam śabdabrahma tatas param
translated: The greatness of the science of poetry, and then the Brahman of sound,

analyzed: dehasya deha yogasya kuṇḍasya yajña karmaṇaḥ
translated: The greatness of the body, the yoga of the body, the sacrificial ladle, and the rite of sacrifice,

analyzed: brahmāṇḍasya ca māhātmyam bhūta bhavya bhaviṣyataḥ
translated: The greatness of the universe, of the past, present and future,

original: dehasya ca tathā tasya paralokasya vai tathā //
analyzed: dehasya ca tathā tasya para lokasya vai tathā
translated: And likewise of that body, and of the world beyond,

original: āyurvedasya māhātmyaṃ ca bhaktānnaktaṃ tataḥ paraṃ /
analyzed: āyurvedasya māhātmyam ca bhaktāt naktam tatas param
translated: The greatness of the science of life, and then the food of devotees at night,

analyzed: kathayamāsa mantrāṇām ācārāṇām tathā eva ca
translated: He spoke of the mantras and the practices.

analyzed: tasyāḥ tat vacanam śrutvā vihaśya jagat īśvaraḥ
translated: Having heard her words, the Lord of the world was pleased.

analyzed: kathayāmāsa tat sarvam praśnānām praśnam uttamam
translated: He told all that, the best answer to the questions.

analyzed: śrī īśvaraḥ uvāca
translated: Lord Shiva said:

original: sādhu devi tvayā pṛṣṭaṃ sādhu lokahitaṃ param /
analyzed: sādhu devi tvayā pṛṣṭam sādhu loka hitam param
translated: Well asked by you, O Goddess, well for the supreme welfare of the world.

analyzed: kathayiṣye su gopyam vai śṛṇuṣva avahitā bhava
translated: I will tell the well-guarded secret, listen attentively.

analyzed: yoga śāstrasya māhātmyam kathayāmi sura priye
translated: O beloved of the gods, I will tell the greatness of the Yoga Shastra.

original: āgamanta vinā yogaṃ na bodhayati mānavaḥ //
analyzed: āgamanta vinā yogam na bodhayati mānavaḥ
translated: Without the Agama, Yoga does not enlighten a man.

analyzed: āgataḥ śiva vaktrebhyaḥ gataḥ ca girijā mukhe
translated: It has come from Shiva's mouth and gone to Parvati's face.

analyzed: mala traya vyapāra tvāt tasmāt āgamaḥ ucyate
translated: Because of the three impurities, it is called Agama.

original: ādau dehaṃ pravakṣyāmi tat śṛṇuṣva yuthāyuthaṃ /
analyzed: ādau deham pravakṣyāmi tat śṛṇuṣva yuthāyutham
translated: First, I will tell about the body, listen to it in order.

original: vinā dehe āgamasya prakāśaḥ kriyate kutaḥ //
analyzed: vinā dehe āgamasya prakāśaḥ kriyate kutas
translated: Without the body, how can the light of the Agama be made?

analyzed: kāraṇam parama brahma kāryyaḥ hi vācaka ātmakaḥ
translated: The supreme Brahman is the cause, and the expressible is the expressed.

analyzed: vācya vācaka mātreṇa tat sarvam vācakam bhavet
translated: By the expressible and the expressed alone, all that becomes expressible.

analyzed: vācā avācena yā yena param brahma anumīyate
translated: By the expressible and the expressed, the supreme Brahman is inferred.

original: vācako hi hariḥ sākṣāt vācyaśca parameśvaraḥ //
analyzed: vācakaḥ hi hariḥ sākṣāt vācyaḥ ca parameśvaraḥ
translated: The expressible is Hari himself, and the expressed is the Supreme Lord.

analyzed: āsīt śakti yutaḥ devaḥ sadāśivaḥ iti śrutaḥ
translated: There was a god known as Sadashiva, endowed with Shakti.
He was pure, eternal, and of the nature of existence, consciousness, and bliss.

original: akṣaraṃ paramaṃ brahma acyutaḥ śuddhanirmalaḥ /🔽guṇatrayātmakaḥ śvetaḥ sṛṣṭimūlamudāhṛtaḥ //
analyzed: akṣaram paramam brahma acyutaḥ śuddha nirmalaḥ  guṇatraya ātmakaḥ śvetaḥ sṛṣṭi mūlam udāhṛtaḥ
translated: He is the imperishable supreme Brahman, the undecaying one, pure and spotless.🔽He is said to be the white one consisting of the three qualities, the origin of creation.

analyzed: sadāśiva iti vikhyātaḥ citsvarūpaḥ iti smṛtaḥ
translated: He is known as Sadashiva and is said to be of the nature of consciousness.
Vishnu, the lord of gods, is said to be of the nature of the Brahman of sound.

analyzed: tasya krīḍā vibhāgena iyam sṛṣṭiḥ vitanyate
translated: This creation is spread out by him as a part of his play.

analyzed: kāle māyā rataḥ saḥ utha saṃsṛjet sacarācaram
translated: Then, engaged in Maya, he creates the moving and unmoving world in time.

original: māyayā saha tasyāpi ahaṃ tatvaṃ manantataḥ /🔽ahaṃ tatvād vikurvāṇaḥ sarvañca sacarācaram //
analyzed: māyayā saha tasya api aham  aham tatvāt vikurvāṇaḥ sarvañca sacarācaram
translated: From him, I, the principle of ego, am born.🔽From the principle of ego, I create the entire moving and unmoving world.

analyzed: ahaṅkāra ātmakam sarvam jagat sthāvara jaṅgamam
translated: The entire world of moving and unmoving beings is of the nature of ego.

analyzed: krīḍayā sakalam viśvam saṃsṛjet jagat īśvaraḥ
translated: The lord of the world creates the entire universe as a play.

analyzed: icchāvatā ibhau utpātya vahavaḥ jajñire purā
translated: In the beginning, many were born from the desire-born beings.

original: vighnāśca jajñire pūrvaṃ dharmakarma tataḥ param //
analyzed: vighnāḥ ca jajñire pūrvam dharma karma tatas param
translated: Obstructions were born first, then Dharma and action.

original: dharmo hi śāstrarūpeṇa yogena jāyate priye /
analyzed: dharmaḥ hi śāstra rūpeṇa yogena jāyate priye
translated: O beloved, Dharma is born through the scriptures and yoga.

original: vighnānāṃ pūjanaṃ tatra tataḥ kuryyād vidhānataḥ //
analyzed: vighnānām pūjanam tatra tatas kuryyāt vidhānataḥ
translated: Then, according to the prescribed method, one should worship the obstacles there.

original: atha artha yogaṃ pravakṣyāmi śṛṇuṣva kamalānane /
analyzed: atha artha yogam pravakṣyāmi śṛṇuṣva kamalānane
translated: Now I will explain the union with wealth, listen, O lotus-faced one.

analyzed: sadāśivāt bhavet icchā kāla yoga samanvitā
translated: From Sadashiva arises the will, endowed with the yoga of time.

analyzed: guṇa kṣobha karī sā tu sarva saṃmoha kāriṇī
translated: It is the agitator of the qualities, and it causes the delusion of all.

analyzed: ādyā parā mahāmāyā nitya aniṣṭa vināśinī
translated: The primordial supreme great illusion, the destroyer of the eternal undesirable,

analyzed: sukha dā śubha dā nityā sarva bhūteṣu saṃsthitā
translated: The giver of happiness, the giver of auspiciousness, the eternal one, abiding in all beings.

analyzed: na māyā yoga yuktena sṛṣṭiḥ eṣā bhavet iti
translated: This creation would not have occurred if it were not united with the yoga of illusion.

original: p / yadā tuṣṭā bhavenmāyā tadā siddhimupālabhet /
analyzed: yadā tuṣṭā bhavet māyā tadā siddhim upālabhet
translated: When illusion becomes satisfied, then one should attain perfection.

analyzed: daivī hi eṣām guṇa mayī sarva bhūta samanvitā
translated: For this is the divine, consisting of the qualities, united with all beings.

analyzed: tasyāḥ krīḍā vibhāgena sṛṣṭiḥ eṣā bhaviṣyati
translated: This creation will occur by the division of her play.

analyzed: yasyām sarvam samudbhūtam yasyām adya api tiṣṭhati
translated: In whom everything has arisen, and in whom it still abides,

original: layameṣyati kālānte tasmai tasyai devyai namo namaḥ /
analyzed: layam eṣyati kāla ante tasmai tasyai devyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: To which it will return at the end of time, salutations again and again to that Goddess.

original: yā brāhmī vaiṣṇavī raudrī devī prajñā śivā tathā //
analyzed: yā brāhmī vaiṣṇavī raudrī devī prajñā śivā tathā
translated: She who is Brahmi, Vaishnavi, Raudri, the Goddess, Wisdom, and Shiva,

original: sarvabhūtasthitā māyā tasmai tasyai devyai namo namaḥ /
analyzed: sarva bhūta sthitā māyā tasmai tasyai devyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: The illusion abiding in all beings, salutations again and again to that Goddess.

analyzed: darpaṇa pratibimbena yathā māyā pradṛśyate
translated: Just as an illusion is seen with a mirror reflection,

original: bahūumithyā yathānityaṃ tathā sṛṣṭiṣu pārvati /🔽māyā secyā sadā nityā māyā pūjyā sadā priyā //
analyzed: yathā anityam tathā sṛṣṭiṣu pārvati  māyā secyā sadā nityā māyā pūjyā sadā priyā
translated: Just as many are false and impermanent, so is creation, O Parvati.

original: māyā stutyā sadā devi vandanīyā punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: māyā stutyā sadā devi vandanīyā punar punar
translated: Maya is always to be watered, Maya is always to be worshipped, Maya is always to be praised, O Goddess, Maya is to be saluted again and again.

analyzed: māyayā tu vinā sṛṣṭeḥ na asti utpatti kāraṇam
translated: Without Maya, there is no cause for the origin of creation.

analyzed: sarvatra sarva bhūteṣu sthāvareṣu careṣu ca
translated: Everywhere, in all beings, in the immobile and the moving,

analyzed: jyotiḥ brahma mayīm devīm lakṣate sacarācaram
translated: The Goddess, who is the light of Brahman, is perceived as the moving and the unmoving.

analyzed: lobha moha kāma krodhāḥ sa guṇā nirguṇā tathā
translated: Greed, delusion, desire, and anger, with qualities and also without qualities,

original: kālayuktā yadā saiva tadā sarvaṃ vidhīyate //
analyzed: kāla yuktā yadā sā eva tadā sarvam vidhīyate
translated: When united with time, then everything is performed.

analyzed: kāla māyā mayī bhūtvā guṇa kṣobham nayet sadā
translated: Having become Maya of time, one should always bring about the agitation of the qualities.

analyzed: kālena prerayet māyām sṛṣṭeḥ utpatti hetave
translated: By time, one should impel Maya for the cause of origination of creation.

original: yā mūlaprakṛtiḥ proktā sā māyā parikīrtitā /
analyzed: yā mūlaprakṛtiḥ proktā sā māyā parikīrtitā
translated: That which is said to be the original Nature is declared to be Maya.

original: yo hyayaṃ sadāśivaḥ proktaḥ sa eva puruṣaḥ paraḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ hi ayam sadāśivaḥ proktaḥ saḥ eva puruṣaḥ paraḥ
translated: That which is said to be Sadasiva is indeed the supreme Purusha.

original: ekaṃ brahma dvidhā bhūtvā sṛṣṭireṣā vidhīyate /
analyzed: ekam brahma dvidhā bhūtvā sṛṣṭiḥ eṣā vidhīyate
translated: This creation is performed by the One Brahman becoming twofold.

original: arddhena puruṣo bhūtvā arddhena vanitā tathā //
analyzed: arddhena puruṣaḥ bhūtvā arddhena vanitā tathā
translated: By half, one becomes a male, and by half, a female.

original: tāvubhau tu samau bhūtvā sṛṣṭivyaktiṃ nayet sudhīḥ /
analyzed: tau ubhau tu samau bhūtvā sṛṣṭi vyaktim nayet sudhīḥ
translated: Both of them being equal, the wise one should lead to the manifestation of creation.

analyzed: yathā sadāśivaḥ proktaḥ tathā māyā prakīrtitā
translated: As Sadashiva is described, so Maya is proclaimed.

original: yathā māyā tathā cārddhā tathā caiva sadāśivaḥ /
analyzed: yathā māyā tathā ca arddhā tathā ca eva sadāśivaḥ
translated: As Maya, so Ardhanari, and so also Sadashiva.

analyzed: yathā gṛhe pradṛśyeta gṛhiṇī gṛhapālayoḥ
translated: As the housewife is seen in the house by the householder,

original: tathā śivasya sā nityā śivānī mūlarūpiṇī /
analyzed: tathā śivasya sā nityā śivānī mūla rūpiṇī
translated: So is that eternal Shiva, the root form of Shiva.

analyzed: gṛhiṇī parihīnasya yathā gṛhapateḥ gatiḥ
translated: As the householder's state is without the housewife,

original: tathā bhavati deveśi tathaiva ca sadāśivaḥ /
analyzed: tathā bhavati deveśi tathā eva ca sadāśivaḥ
translated: So is it, O Goddess of the Lord of Gods, and so also Sadashiva.

original: tasmānmāyā sadā vandyā pujanīyā parāt parā //
analyzed: tasmāt māyā sadā vandyā pujanīyā parāt parā
translated: Therefore, Maya is always to be worshipped, to be revered, supreme over the supreme.

original: brahmā viṣṇuśca rudraśca īśvaro'nye ca ye parāḥ /
analyzed: brahmā viṣṇuḥ ca rudraḥ ca īśvaraḥ anye ca ye parāḥ
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, Rudra, Ishvara, and others who are supreme,

original: sarve te māyayā dehaṃ labhante nātra saṃśayaḥ //
analyzed: sarve te māyayā deham labhante na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: All of them obtain a body through Maya, there is no doubt about this.

original: arcciyo ye yathā bhūmau bhāskarasya gabhastayaḥ /
analyzed: arcciyaḥ ye yathā bhūmau bhāskarasya gabhastayaḥ
translated: As the flames on the ground are the rays of the sun,

original: brahmavastu tathā bhūtvā māyayā vyāpakaṃ mahat //
analyzed: brahma vastu tathā bhūtvā māyayā vyāpakam mahat
translated: So is the great all-pervading Brahma-substance through Maya.

original: na tu brahmātiriktaḥ syāt jagat sthāvarajaṅgamam /
analyzed: na tu brahma atiriktaḥ syāt jagat sthāvara jaṅgamam
translated: But the world with its moving and unmoving beings is not beyond Brahma.

analyzed: māyayā vaśa gāḥ sarve brahma viṣṇu śiva ādayaḥ
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva, and others are all under the control of Maya.

analyzed: na māyā vaśa gāḥ kecid mahākāla vacaḥ yathā
translated: As per the words of Mahakala, no one is under the control of Maya.

analyzed: sarvadā sarva bhāvena māyā sevyā divāniśam
translated: Maya should always be served day and night with all means and all devotion.

analyzed: sthūlam prakāśayet sūkṣmam sthūlam sūkṣma artham āśrayet
translated: The gross should be revealed, the subtle should be based on the gross meaning.

original: na hi sthūlād vinā devi sūkṣmaṃ yāti prakāśanam //
analyzed: na hi sthūlāt vinā devi sūkṣmam yāti prakāśanam
translated: Without the gross, O Goddess, the subtle does not attain revelation.

original: yadihāsthi tadānyatra yannehāsthi na tat kvacit /
analyzed: yat iha asthi tadā anyatra yat na iha asthi na tat kvacid
translated: If it exists here, then elsewhere; what does not exist here does not exist anywhere.

original: āgamasya samo granthaḥ sadā nāsthīha bhūtale //
analyzed: āgamasya samaḥ granthaḥ sadā na asthi iha bhū tale
translated: There is no scripture equal to the Agamas on this earth.

analyzed: kim anyaiḥ asat ālāpaiḥ yatra āyuḥ vyaya tā āmiṣāt
translated: What is the use of other false talks, where life is wasted in vain?

original: nidrayā hriyate devi vyavāyena ca vāyavaḥ //
analyzed: nidrayā hriyate devi vyavāyena ca vāyavaḥ
translated: O Goddess, sleep takes away, and sexual intercourse takes away the vital airs.

analyzed: divā ca arthā iha yā devi kuṭumba bharaṇena ca
translated: O Goddess, by day and night, by the maintenance of the family,

original: sarvatra sarvakāleṣu jāgrat svapnasuṣuptiṣu //🔽vandanīyā sadā stutyā pūjanīyā ca sarvadā /
analyzed: sarvatra sarva kāleṣu jāgrat svapna suṣuptiṣu  vandanīyā sadā stutyā pūjanīyā ca sarvadā
translated: Everywhere, at all times, in waking, dreaming, and deep sleep,🔽She should always be saluted, praised, and worshipped.

original: śrotavyā kīrtitavyā ca māyā nityā nagātmaje //
analyzed: śrotavyā kīrtitavyā ca māyā nityā naga ātmaje
translated: The eternal Maya should always be heard and glorified, O Daughter of the Mountain.

original: yadā māyā bhavet tuṣṭā ādyā saṃvitpradāyinī /
analyzed: yadā māyā bhavet tuṣṭā ādyā saṃvid pradāyinī
translated: When Maya becomes pleased, the primordial bestower of consciousness,

analyzed: hariḥ brahmā śivaḥ sarve labheyuḥ toṣam uttamam
translated: Hari, Brahma, Shiva, and all attain excellent satisfaction.

original: brāhmaṇāḥ kṣatriyā vaiśyāḥ striyaḥ sarvaṃ maheśvari /
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ kṣatriyāḥ vaiśyāḥ striyaḥ sarvam maheśvari
translated: Brahmanas, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, women, all, O Great Goddess,

analyzed: śrotavyā kīrtitavyā ca hareḥ māyā divāniśam
translated: Should hear and glorify Hari's Maya day and night.

analyzed: atha sṛṣṭim pravakṣyāmi sthūla bodhasya hetave
translated: Now I will explain the creation for the sake of gross understanding.

original: sthūle nirjitya cātmānaṃ tadā sūkṣmaṃ viśed dhiyā //
analyzed: sthūle nirjitya ca ātmānam tadā sūkṣmam viśet dhiyā
translated: Having conquered the gross self, then one should enter the subtle with the mind.

original: p / yat tu sūkṣmaṃ maheśāni tatsṛṣṭergocaraṃ na hi /
analyzed: yat tu sūkṣmam maheśāni tat sṛṣṭeḥ gocaram na hi
translated: O Mahesani, that which is subtle is not the domain of creation.

analyzed: anumānena tat bhāvyam tat sarvam śāstra vartmanā
translated: That should be contemplated through inference, all that through the path of scriptures.

original: sūkṣmaṃ yat paramaṃ brahma tat durge gocaram na hi /
analyzed: sūkṣmam yat paramam brahma tat durge gocaram na hi
translated: That which is subtle, the supreme Brahman, is not the domain of Durga.

original: tat tu sarvaṃ samādhau ca tat sarvaṃ śāstravartmanā //
analyzed: tat tu sarvam samādhau ca tat sarvam śāstra vartmanā
translated: But all that is in meditation, all that is through the path of scriptures.

original: sūkṣmaṃ yat paramaṃ brahma ātmanogocaraṃ na hi /
analyzed: sūkṣmam yat paramam brahma ātmanaḥ gocaram na hi
translated: That which is subtle, the supreme Brahman, is not the domain of the self.

original: tat subhāvyaṃ maheśāni tat sarvaṃ śāstravartmanā //
analyzed: tat su bhāvyam maheśāni tat sarvam śāstra vartmanā
translated: That should be well contemplated, O Mahesani, all that is through the path of scriptures.

analyzed: sarveṣām locanam devi buddhi śāstram pracakṣate
translated: The scriptures declare the intellect to be the eye of all, O Goddess.

analyzed: sthira cittena bhaktyā ca asam sarga samanvitaiḥ
translated: With a steady mind, devotion, and association with the unattached,

analyzed: śrotavyam sarvadā śāstram āgamaḥ sarva kālatas
translated: The scriptures should always be heard, the scriptures are the source of all knowledge.

analyzed: śravaṇāt jāyate bhaktiḥ bhaktyā ca eva prapūjayet
translated: From hearing, devotion arises, and through devotion, one should worship.

analyzed: pūjanāt jāyate jñānam jñānāt bhūtāni śodhayet
translated: From worship, knowledge arises, and through knowledge, one should purify the elements.

analyzed: ātmanaḥ śuddhi tām prāpya dṛḍha cittaḥ prajāyate
translated: Having attained purity of the self, one becomes firm-minded.

analyzed: dṛḍha citte samādhiḥ syāt samādheḥ mokṣaḥ ucyate
translated: One with a firm mind attains concentration, and from concentration, liberation is said to be attained.

original: māyāsevāṃ vinā na syāt mukti jñānañca śobhanam //
analyzed: māyā sevām vinā na syāt mukti jñānañca śobhanam
translated: Without resorting to illusion, there would be no liberation and no splendid knowledge.

analyzed: caturvidha vidhānam syāt puru ādiṣu yathākramam
translated: There are four types of methods, in the east and other directions, in order.

original: pṛthivyā yadhādeśe ca sumeruḥ parvataḥ sthitaḥ //
analyzed: pṛthivyāḥ yadhādeśe ca sumeruḥ parvataḥ sthitaḥ
translated: In the direction of the earth, the mountain Sumeru is situated.

analyzed: tat pūrva ādiṣu vijñeyaḥ sarva śāsteṣu ayam vidhiḥ
translated: This method should be known in all scriptures in the east and other directions.

original: ācāro mantra yantrāṇāṃ deśabhede ca sarvataḥ //
analyzed: ācāraḥ mantra yantrāṇām deśa bhede ca sarvatas
translated: The conduct of mantras and yantras should be performed everywhere according to the differences in countries.

analyzed: kartavyam sarva bhāveṣu mahākāla vacaḥ yathā
translated: As stated by Mahakala, it should be done in all things.

original: vidyā vā pāthavāvidyā dvāvete māyayā vṛte //
analyzed: vidyā vā pāthavā avidyā dvau ete māyayā vṛte
translated: Knowledge and ignorance, these two are enveloped by illusion.

original: vidyā tu sarvadā sevyā nāpavidyā kathañcana /
analyzed: vidyā tu sarvadā sevyā na apavidyā kathañcana
translated: Knowledge should always be resorted to, never ignorance.

original: yā vidyā sā mahāmāyā sā tu sevyā sadā budhaiḥ //
analyzed: yā vidyā sā mahāmāyā sā tu sevyā sadā budhaiḥ
translated: That which is knowledge is the great illusion, it should always be resorted to by the wise.

analyzed: avidyā karma bandhaḥ syāt bandhāt jñānam vinaśyati
translated: Ignorance leads to bondage of actions, and from bondage, knowledge is destroyed.

analyzed: jñāna nāśāt bhavet hāniḥ hānau saṃsaraṇam punar
translated: From the destruction of knowledge, there is loss, and in loss, there is wandering in the cycle of birth and death again.

analyzed: saṃsārāt tu bhavet hāni ghoram narakam eva ca
translated: From the cycle of birth and death, there is loss, and only the terrible hell.

analyzed: tasmāt avidyām kutra api na sevet mokṣam icchukaḥ
translated: Therefore, one who desires liberation should never resort to ignorance anywhere.

analyzed: śivaḥ tu dvividhaḥ proktaḥ saguṇaḥ nirguṇaḥ tathā
translated: Shiva is said to be of two kinds: with attributes and without attributes.

analyzed: nirguṇaḥ prakṛteḥ amyaḥ sa guṇaḥ sakala ātmakaḥ
translated: The attributeless one is beyond Prakriti, the one with attributes is the essence of all.

analyzed: sakala ātmakāt iyam sṛṣṭiḥ kathyate brahmaṇā purā
translated: This creation, which is the essence of all, was described by Brahma in the past.

original: saguṇaṃ nirguṇaṃ vāpi kathyate śṛṇu pārvati //
analyzed: sa guṇam nirguṇam vā api kathyate śṛṇu pārvati
translated: Whether with attributes or without attributes, listen, O Parvati.

original: yaduktaṃ brahmaṇā pūrvaṃ yaduktaṃ viṣṇunā purā /
analyzed: yat uktam brahmaṇā pūrvam yat uktam viṣṇunā purā
translated: What was said by Brahma in the past, what was said by Vishnu in the past,

original: sadāśivena yat proktaṃ tat sarvaṃ pravadāmyaham //
analyzed: sadāśivena yat proktam tat sarvam pravadāmi aham
translated: what was said by Sadashiva, I will tell all that.

analyzed: ṛṣibhiḥ tu purā proktam bhāratīm śubha lakṣaṇām
translated: What was said by the sages in the past, the auspicious Bharata,

analyzed: tānte sarvam pravakṣyāmi śṛṇuṣva kamalānane
translated: I will tell all that to you, listen, O lotus-faced one.

original: vācyaṃ hi paramaṃ brahma vācakā akṣarāḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: vācyam hi paramam brahma vācakāḥ akṣarāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The supreme Brahman is indeed the object of speech, the letters are remembered as the means of speech.

analyzed: āśraya āśrayi bhāvena tat sarvam pravadāmi aham
translated: By the relation of the container and the contained, I will tell all that.

analyzed: kṣarati iti kṣaraḥ proktaḥ sarva tantra samanvitaḥ
translated: That which decays is called perishable, endowed with all the scriptures.

analyzed: tat na asti yatra tatra api akṣaraḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: Where that does not exist, there it is also declared to be imperishable.

analyzed: yathā dhātuṣu dehasya utpattiḥ parikīrtitā
translated: Just as the origin of the body in the elements is declared,

original: tatra yat paramaṃ brahma tat sarvaṃ pravadāmyahaṃ //
analyzed: tatra yat paramam brahma tat sarvam pravadāmi aham
translated: there I will tell all that which is the supreme Brahman.

original: sadāśivo bhavedagnistadā ghoṣastataḥ paraḥ /🔽aghoṣaścaiva saṃghoṣo mahāprāṇastataḥ paraḥ //
analyzed: sadāśivaḥ bhavet agniḥ tadā ghoṣaḥ tatas paraḥ  aghoṣaḥ ca eva saṃghoṣaḥ mahāprāṇaḥ tatas paraḥ
translated: Sadasiva would be the fire, then Ghosha, then Parah.🔽Aghosha, Samghosha, Mahapramana, then Mahapramana.

analyzed: mahāprāṇāt sughoṣaḥ ca tasmāt ca eva anāhataḥ
translated: From Mahapramana, Sughosha, and from that, Anahata.

analyzed: anāhatāt haniḥ ca eva tasmāt nādaḥ sureśvari
translated: From Anahata, Dhani, and from that, Nada, O Goddess of the gods.

analyzed: nādāt tava id tadā binduḥ bindum tu śaśi suryyayoḥ
translated: From Nada, then Bindu, and from Bindu, the moon and sun.

original: p / śaivātmikā bhavet sṛṣṭiḥ sṛṣṭireṣā vidhā smṛtā //
analyzed: śaiva ātmikā bhavet sṛṣṭiḥ sṛṣṭiḥ eṣā vidhā smṛtā
translated: The creation would be of the nature of Shiva, this creation is said to be of that kind.

original: sā sṛṣṭiḥ sarvatantreṣu kīrtitā sātvikī śubhā /
analyzed: sā sṛṣṭiḥ sarva tantreṣu kīrtitā sātvikī śubhā
translated: That creation is praised in all scriptures as auspicious and of the sattva quality.

analyzed: atha śaiva ātmikā sṛṣṭiḥ kathyate krama yogataḥ
translated: Now, the creation of the nature of Shiva is described in the order of yoga.

analyzed: śivaḥ śakti yutaḥ sākṣāt sā haṅkāra samanvitaḥ
translated: Shiva is directly united with Shakti, and that is endowed with ego.

original: na hi śaktiṃ vinā devi sṛṣṭireṣā vidhīyate //
analyzed: na hi śaktim vinā devi sṛṣṭiḥ eṣā vidhīyate
translated: Indeed, O Goddess, this creation is not performed without Shakti.

original: kṣetraṃ vinā yathā caiva vījotpattirna dṛśyate /
analyzed: kṣetram vinā yathā ca eva vīja utpattiḥ na dṛśyate
translated: Just as the origin of a seed is not seen without a field,

original: śaktericchā bhaved devi yadā sṛṣṭistadā bhavet //
analyzed: śakteḥ icchā bhavet devi yadā sṛṣṭiḥ tadā bhavet
translated: O Goddess, when there is the desire of Shakti, then creation would occur.

analyzed: darpaṇa pratibimbeṣu pratibimbam maheśvari
translated: In mirror reflections, O Great Goddess,

analyzed: sṛṣṭiḥ utpattiḥ kathyate śṛṇu pārvati
translated: The creation of birth is described. Listen, O Parvati.

original: sṛṣṭistu dvividhā cāsīt mānasī maithunī tathā /
analyzed: sṛṣṭiḥ tu dvividhā ca āsīt mānasī maithunī tathā
translated: The creation was of two kinds: mental and sexual.

analyzed: purā kṛta yuge sṛṣṭiḥ mānasebhūt prajāpateḥ
translated: In the Kṛta age, the creation was mental of the Prajāpati.

analyzed: tena aicchat kāma akarmāṇi vāsudeva parāyaṇā
translated: By him, desiring to perform actions out of love, was devoted to Vāsudeva.

analyzed: tatra krodham abhut viṣṇoḥ rūpa sargaḥ tatas param
translated: There, anger arose from Viṣṇu, and then the creation of form.

original: te tu krodharaśāt sarve jagat kṣayaparāyaṇāḥ /
analyzed: te tu krodha raśāt sarve jagat kṣaya parāyaṇāḥ
translated: All of them, due to the bondage of anger, were intent on the destruction of the world.

analyzed: rajaḥ guṇa ātmikā sṛṣṭiḥ tadā bhavati tat parā
translated: The creation consisting of the quality of rajas then becomes supreme.

analyzed: candra sūrya ātmakaḥ binduḥ nādaḥ ca triguṇa ātmakaḥ
translated: The bindu consisting of the moon and sun, and the nāda consisting of the three qualities,

analyzed: kathitāḥ padmayoninā
translated: The mantras consisting of the moon and sun are said to be of the lotus-born one.

analyzed: binduḥ śiva ātmakaḥ jñeyā nādaḥ ca jagat īśvarī
translated: The bindu should be known as of the nature of Śiva, and the nāda as the goddess of the world.

analyzed: śakteḥ sambhoga mātreṇa bhavet nādaḥ kriyā paraḥ
translated: By the mere enjoyment of Śakti, nāda becomes engaged in action.

analyzed: nādāt bhavet mahābinduḥ sa ca karma parāyaṇaḥ
translated: From nāda, the great bindu arises, which is devoted to action.

analyzed: binduḥ sarva ātmakaḥ sarva śāstreṣu parikīrtitaḥ
translated: The bindu is declared to be of the nature of all in all scriptures.

analyzed: brahmā viṣṇuḥ ca rudraḥ ca trividhā parikīrtitāḥ
translated: Brahmā, Viṣṇu, and Rudra are declared to be of three kinds.

analyzed: rajaḥ satvaḥ tamaḥ ca eva triguṇāḥ sarva sammatāḥ
translated: Rajas, sattva, and tamas are the three qualities, accepted by all.

analyzed: sarveṣu bhūta vargeṣu triguṇāḥ parikīrtitāḥ
translated: The three qualities are declared to be present in all groups of beings.

analyzed: devatā trividhā devi tamaḥ rajaḥ sama tva yuj
translated: The deity is of three kinds, O Goddess, endowed with tamas, rajas, and sattva.

original: teṣāṃ tu lakṣaṇaṃ tat tat paścāt sarvaṃ vadāmyaham /
analyzed: teṣām tu lakṣaṇam tat tat paścāt sarvam vadāmi aham
translated: I shall tell you all their characteristics later on.

analyzed: bindau bhavet mahādevi śabda brahma śiva ātmake
translated: O Great Goddess, in the Bindu, which is the essence of Sound, Brahman, and Shiva,

analyzed: guṇatrayam bhavet bindau siddhayaḥ śubha dāyakāḥ
translated: The three qualities are in the Bindu, and the accomplishments are the givers of auspiciousness.

analyzed: yoga śāstrāṇi tatra eva jāyante kamala ānane
translated: O Lotus-faced one, the Yoga scriptures are born there itself.

original: tattvaśāstrāṇi tat paścāt mokṣaśāstrāṇi tat param /
analyzed: tattva śāstrāṇi tat paścāt mokṣa śāstrāṇi tat param
translated: The Tattva scriptures are after that, and the scriptures on liberation are after that.

original: jñānaśāstrāṇi tat paścāt purāṇāni tataḥ param //
analyzed: jñāna śāstrāṇi tat paścāt purāṇāni tatas param
translated: The scriptures on knowledge are after that, and the Puranas are after that.

analyzed: mahā purāṇa śāstrāṇi pārahaṃsyāni tat param
translated: The great Purana scriptures are after that, and the Parahansa scriptures are after that.

analyzed: dīna aṃśa tatva śāstrāṇi jāyante tad anantaram
translated: The scriptures on the essence of the poor are born after that.

original: brāhmaṇāḥ kṣatriyā vaiśyāḥ sarve bindvātmakāḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ kṣatriyāḥ vaiśyāḥ sarve bindu ātmakāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: Brahmins, Kshatriyas, and Vaishyas are all said to have the nature of Bindu.

analyzed: veda śāstra ādayaḥ sarve sarve bindu ātmakāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: All the Vedas, scriptures, and others are all said to have the nature of Bindu.

analyzed: atha bindoḥ vibhāgena śabdaḥ tu ekaḥ bhavet mahān
translated: Now, by the division of Bindu, there is one great sound.

analyzed: avācām paramam brahma adṛśyan ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: It is the supreme Brahman of the inexpressible, and especially the invisible.

analyzed: śabdabrahma hi tat prāhūḥ sarva āgama viśāradāḥ
translated: Those who are skilled in all the Agamas call it the Brahman of Sound.

original: atha kāmāñca yad vastu jñānena parigīyate //
analyzed: atha kāmān ca yat vastu jñānena parigīyate
translated: Now, the object that is sung about by knowledge, even though it is not desired,

analyzed: śabdabrahmam tat eva āhūḥ sarva tantra viśāradāḥ
translated: The experts in all scriptures call it the Brahman of sound.

analyzed: supta uśyāna avaroha tvāt proktaḥ ūna etādṛśa ūravaḥ
translated: Because it descends from the state of deep sleep, this sound is not like that.

original: śabdakṣetreti tvāṃ prāha sākṣād devaḥ sadāśivaḥ /
analyzed: śabda kṣetra iti tvām prāha sākṣāt devaḥ sadāśivaḥ
translated: The god Sadashiva himself has declared you to be the field of sound.

analyzed: anāhateṣu cakreṣu sa śabdaḥ parikīrttyate
translated: That sound is said to be in the unstruck wheels.

analyzed: anāhatam mahā cakram hṛdaye sarva jantuṣu
translated: The great unstruck wheel is in the heart of all living beings.

analyzed: tatra oṅkāraḥ iti uktaḥ guṇatraya samanvitaḥ
translated: There, it is said to be the syllable Om, endowed with the three qualities.

analyzed: śivaḥ brahmā tathā viṣṇuḥ oṅkāreṣu pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: Shiva, Brahma, and Vishnu are established in the syllable Om.

analyzed: akāraḥ ca bhavet brahmā ukāraḥ saccid ātmakaḥ
translated: The letter A is Brahma, the letter U is the essence of existence and consciousness,

original: makāro rudra ityukta iti varṇasya kalpanā /
analyzed: makāraḥ rudraḥ iti uktaḥ iti varṇasya kalpanā
translated: and the letter M is said to be Rudra - this is the conception of the letter.

original: akāre ca bhaved viṣṇu rukāre ca prajāpatiḥ //
analyzed: akāre ca bhavet viṣṇu rukāre ca prajāpatiḥ
translated: In the letter A is Vishnu, in the letter U is Prajapati,

original: makāre ca bhaved rudra iti vā varṇanirṇayaḥ /
analyzed: makāre ca bhavet rudraḥ iti vā varṇa nirṇayaḥ
translated: and in the letter M is Rudra - this is the determination of the letters.

analyzed: sarva tantreṣu kathitā padmayoninā
translated: Thus, it has been declared in all the scriptures by the Lotus-born One.

original: tasminneva kṣaṇe binduḥ sa bhaved dvividhaḥ priye /
analyzed: tasmin eva kṣaṇe binduḥ sa bhavet dvividhaḥ priye
translated: In that very moment, O beloved, that dot becomes of two kinds.

analyzed: bhakti yukta ātmakaḥ binduḥ iti vedeṣu niścayaḥ
translated: The dot endowed with devotion - this is the conclusion in the Vedas.

original: raudrī vāmā tathā jyeṣṭhā trividhā śaktiruttamā /
analyzed: raudrī vāmā tathā jyeṣṭhā trividhā śaktiḥ uttamā
translated: Raudri, Vama, and Jyeshtha - these are the three excellent powers.

analyzed: raudrī rudra priyā śaktiḥ sadā rudra guṇa anvitā
translated: Raudri is the power dear to Rudra, always endowed with Rudra's qualities.

analyzed: vāmā tu viṣṇu saṃśaktā tad aguṇa anvitā
translated: Vama is associated with Vishnu, and Vaishnava is endowed with her qualities.

original: jyeṣṭhā tu brahmaṇaḥ śaktiḥ sṛṣṭirutpatti lakṣaṇā //
analyzed: jyeṣṭhā tu brahmaṇaḥ śaktiḥ sṛṣṭiḥ utpatti lakṣaṇā
translated: Jyeshtha is the power of Brahma, characterized by creation and origination.

analyzed: rajaḥ guṇa anvitā sṛṣṭiḥ jyeṣṭhā sarva samanvitā
translated: Creation, endowed with the quality of rajas, is Jyeshtha, endowed with everything.

analyzed: tamaḥ guṇa anvitā śaktiḥ vaiṣṇavī sarva sammatā
translated: The power associated with the quality of tamas is Vaishnavi, accepted by all.

original: yā tu raudrī mahāśaktiḥ sā śubhā parikīrtitā /
analyzed: yā tu raudrī mahā śaktiḥ sā śubhā parikīrtitā
translated: The great power Raudri is declared to be auspicious.

original: sāttvikā sā mahāśaktiḥ śivasya vacanaṃ yathā //
analyzed: sāttvikā sā mahā śaktiḥ śivasya vacanam yathā
translated: That great power is of the sattva quality, as stated by Shiva.

analyzed: sadāśivāt param kiñcid śivamerum pracakṣyate
translated: Something higher than Sadashiva is said to be Shiva Meru.

original: tasya śaktirbhaved devi yā śaktistāmasī matā //
analyzed: tasya śaktiḥ bhavet devi yā śaktiḥ tāmasī matā
translated: O Goddess, his power is considered to be the tamas power.

analyzed: sadāśivasya deveśi śaktayaḥ vahūdhāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: O Goddess of the gods, the powers of Sadashiva are remembered in many ways.

original: icchāśaktirjñānaśaktiḥ kriyāśaktistataḥ parā //🔽śivasya vividhā śaktirvimalādyāḥ śubhapradāḥ /
analyzed: icchā śaktiḥ jñāna śaktiḥ kriyā śaktiḥ tatas parā  śivasya vividhā śaktiḥ vimalā ādyāḥ śubha pradāḥ
translated: The powers are will, knowledge, action, and beyond that.🔽Shiva's various powers, beginning with Vimalā, bestow auspiciousness.

original: vimalot karpiṇī jvālā kriyā satyā tataḥ parā //
analyzed: vimalā ut karpiṇī jvālā kriyā satyā tatas parā
translated: Vimalā, Utkṛntanī, Jvālā, Kriyā, Satya, and beyond that.

original: yogā prahvī tathaiśānī ugrāṇī ca punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: yogā prahvī tathā aiśānī ugrāṇī ca punar punar
translated: Yoga, Prahvi, Aishani, Ugrāṇī, again and again.

analyzed: brahmāṇī ādyāḥ śaktayaḥ ca jagat etat carācaram
translated: The powers beginning with Brahmaṇī and the moving and unmoving world.

original: brāhmī māheśvarī caiva kaumārī vaiṣṇavī tathā /
analyzed: brāhmī māheśvarī ca eva kaumārī vaiṣṇavī tathā
translated: Brahmi, Mahesvari, Kaumari, Vaishnavi,

analyzed: vārāhī anantarā indrāṇī cāmuṇḍā kamalā punar
translated: Varahini, Indrani, Chamunda, and Kamala,

original: tato nānāvidhā caiva śaktayo vahūdhā matāḥ /
analyzed: tatas nānāvidhā ca eva śaktayaḥ vahūdhā matāḥ
translated: And then various other kinds of Shakti are considered in many ways.

original: sarvavarṇātmikā śaktiḥ sadā pūrva śivasya ca //
analyzed: sarva varṇa ātmikā śaktiḥ sadā śivasya ca
translated: The Shakti, which is the essence of all castes, has always been of Shiva.

analyzed: bhūtam bhavyam bhaviṣyat ca yat brahmāṇḍa samudbhavam
translated: Whatever has happened, is happening, or will happen in the universe,

analyzed: sarvam śivasya deveśi śaktiḥ sarva samanvitā
translated: All of it is Shiva's Shakti, O Goddess of the gods, endowed with everything.

original: nahi śaktiṃ vinā viśvaṃ kṣaṇamātraṃ pradṛśyate /
analyzed: nahi śaktim vinā viśvam kṣaṇa mātram pradṛśyate
translated: Without Shakti, the universe cannot be seen even for a moment.

analyzed: śaktibhiḥ puritam viśvam sarvam sthāvara jaṅgamam
translated: The entire universe, all that is moving and unmoving, is filled with Shakti.

analyzed: āśraya āśayi bhāvena saṃprāpya adya api tiṣṭhati
translated: Having attained it in the form of the support and the supported, it remains even today.

original: atha bindvātmikā śaktiḥ sā raudrī parikīrtitā //🔽atha nādātmikā śaktiḥ sā jyeṣṭhā parikīrtitā /
analyzed: atha bindu ātmikā śaktiḥ sā raudrī parikīrtitā  atha nāda ātmikā śaktiḥ sā jyeṣṭhā parikīrtitā
translated: Now, the Shakti in the form of the Bindu is declared to be Raudri.🔽Now, the Shakti in the form of Nada is declared to be Jyeshtha.

original: atha vījodbhavā śaktiḥ sā vāmā parikīrtitā //
analyzed: atha vīja udbhavā śaktiḥ sā vāmā parikīrtitā
translated: Now, the Shakti arising from the seed is declared to be Vama.

original: vāmā tu vāmadevasya śaktiḥ sā prakṛtiḥ śubhā /
analyzed: vāmā tu vāmadevasya śaktiḥ sā prakṛtiḥ śubhā
translated: Vama is the auspicious Shakti of Vamadeva, the primordial nature.

analyzed: śabdabrahma iti prāhuḥ sarva veda vidaḥ janāḥ
translated: People who know all the Vedas call it Shabda-Brahma (the Brahman of sound).

original: śabdastu śabdamātraṃ syāt brahmeti paramaṃ padam /
analyzed: śabdaḥ tu śabda mātram syāt brahma iti paramam padam
translated: But sound is mere sound, Brahman is the supreme state.

analyzed: katham śabdena brāhmeṇa ekatvam pratibudhyate
translated: How is oneness realized through the Brahman sound?

analyzed: vācya vācaka śabdena brahma śabdena vā priye
translated: By the sound of the expressed and the expressing, or by the Brahman sound, O beloved.

analyzed: eka tvam uhyate sarvam śabdabrahma tat ucyate
translated: All is understood as one, that is called the Brahman of sound.

original: yathā dhātuṃ vinā devi dehasya dhāraṇaṃ na hi /
analyzed: yathā dhātum vinā devi dehasya dhāraṇam na hi
translated: Just as without the elements, O Goddess, the body cannot be sustained,

original: tathā jīvaṃ vinā devi na dhātuḥ pratibudhyate //
analyzed: tathā jīvam vinā devi na dhātuḥ pratibudhyate
translated: In the same way, O Goddess, without the individual soul, the element is not awakened.

analyzed: ca aikyam yathā deveṣu gīyate
translated: The oneness of the element and the individual soul is sung about in the scriptures,

analyzed: śabdabrahma padāt ekam tathā eva parikīrtyate
translated: In the same way, the Brahman of sound is declared to be one with the word.

analyzed: ekatra deha yogeṣu jīvātmā paramātmanā
translated: In the case of the union of the individual soul with the body,

analyzed: tathā eva sarva tantreṣu śabdabrahma iti kīrtyate
translated: In the same way, in all scriptures, it is declared as the Brahman of sound.

original: na hi brahma vinā śabdaḥ prakāśātmā bhavet svayam /
analyzed: na hi brahma vinā śabdaḥ prakāśa ātmā bhavet svayam
translated: Indeed, without the word, Brahman cannot be self-luminous.

original: śabdabrahmeti tat sarvaṃ bhūtaṃ bhavyaṃ bhaviṣyakam //
analyzed: śabdabrahma iti tat sarvam bhūtam bhavyam bhaviṣyakam
translated: All that exists, will exist, and has existed is the Brahman of sound.

analyzed: prakāśam abhidhīyeta yathā suryyaḥ divāniśam
translated: Just as the sun illuminates day and night,

analyzed: anumānena tat sarvam śabda artham ca dhiyā smaret
translated: One should remember all the meanings of words by inference and intellect.

analyzed: acintyaḥ hi yadā abrahma prakāśaḥ upajāyate
translated: When the inconceivable light of Brahman arises,

analyzed: tadā tasya api śabda artham pratyakṣam upajāyate
translated: Then, the direct perception of the meaning of that word also arises for him.

original: p / tat pratyakṣeṇa tat sarvaṃ tat tadvastuṣu jāyate /
analyzed: tat pratyakṣeṇa tat sarvam tat tad vastuṣu jāyate
translated: By that direct perception, all that arises in those things.

analyzed: atha bindoḥ maheśāni lakṣaṇam parikīrttyate
translated: Now, O Great Goddess, the definition of the Bindu is being stated.

original: rindoḥ prakāśāt sarve vai kālapādādayaḥ kramāt /
analyzed: rindoḥ prakāśāt sarve vai kālapāda ādayaḥ kramāt
translated: From the manifestation of Bindu, all the Kalapadas (parts of time) and others arise in sequence.

analyzed: kālāt bhavet mahābinduḥ binduḥ śakti sat ātmakaḥ
translated: From Kala (time), the Great Bindu arises, the Bindu that is always endowed with Shakti (power).

analyzed: ajāyante jagat sākṣi brahma viṣṇu śiva ādayaḥ
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva and others, the witnesses of the world, are born from it.

original: kāla yogād bhavennādaḥ sa ca sarvaguṇānvitaḥ //
analyzed: kāla yogāt bhavet nādaḥ sa ca sarva guṇa anvitaḥ
translated: From the union with Kala (time), Nada (sound) arises, and that is endowed with all qualities.

analyzed: nādāt bhavet tadā devi kriyā yoga dāyaḥ tu ime
translated: From Nada (sound), O Goddess, these Kriya Yogas (actions and yoga) arise then.

original: nādād bhavet tadā devi pañcāśanmātṛkāḥ kramāt //
analyzed: nādāt bhavet tadā devi pañcāśat mātṛkāḥ kramāt
translated: From Nada (sound), O Goddess, the fifty Mātṛkās (syllables of the alphabet) arise in sequence then.

analyzed: akāra ādi kṣakāra antāḥ svarāḥ tantra samanvitāḥ
translated: The vowels from A to KṢa, along with the Tantras (sacred scriptures),

original: pūrve hrasvāḥ pare dīrghāḥ ṣaṇtāstu tadanantarāḥ //
analyzed: pūrve hrasvāḥ pare dīrghāḥ tad anantarāḥ
translated: The short ones come first, the long ones next, and the Ṣaṇs (visargas) come after that.

original: ṛ ṝ ḷ ḹ tathā saptāḥ sarva tantrasamanvitāḥ /
analyzed: tathā saptāḥ tantra samanvitāḥ
translated: The seven R, Ṛ, ऌ, ॡ, along with all the Tantras (sacred scriptures),

analyzed: sarva tantra samanvitāḥ
translated: The Parśās (consonants) from Ka to Ṁa, along with all the Tantras (sacred scriptures),

analyzed: yāḥ dikṣāntāḥ tu ye varṇāḥ te varṇāḥ tantra sammatāḥ
translated: The letters from Ya to Ṣa, which are the directions, are considered to be the letters in the Tantras (sacred scriptures).

analyzed: dhātavaḥ sarva tantreṣu yad ādi vāntāḥ śubha pradāḥ
translated: The elements beginning with Ya and ending with Va in all Tantras bestow auspiciousness.

analyzed: uṣmāṇaḥ asthi majja ādayaḥ śubhāḥ
translated: The sibilants Ṣa, Ṣa, Sa, and Ha are known to be auspicious for bones, marrow, etc.

analyzed: lakṣau varṇau parātmānau jīvātma parama ātmakau
translated: The two letters La and KṢa represent the individual soul and the supreme soul.

analyzed: makāra antāni tatvāni varṇāni kīrtitāni vai
translated: The principles ending with the letter Ma are declared to be the letters.

original: jīve prāṇe manobuddhau mahadahaṅkārasaṃyute //🔽māditānto mahābhute karṇe tvaci ca cakṣuṣi /🔽jihvā grāṇe vāci pāṇau pāyupāde ca liṅgake //
analyzed: jīve prāṇe manaḥ buddhau mahat ahaṅkāra saṃyute  mā adita antaḥ mahā bhute karṇe tvaci ca cakṣuṣi  jihvā grāṇe vāci pāṇau pāyu pāde ca liṅgake
translated: In the individual soul, life force, mind, intellect, and in the great one and ego,🔽The letters beginning with Ma and ending with Bhu are in the great elements, in the ears, skin, and eyes.🔽In the tongue, nose, speech, hands, anus, feet, and genitals,

analyzed: bhuteṣu ṅādika antasya hṛdaye maṇḍala traya
translated: In the elements, the letters beginning with Ṅa and ending with Ḍa are in the three circles in the heart.

analyzed: ra ādi vā antāni saṃcintā ṣaṣ aṅgāni ca dhātuṣu
translated: The letters beginning with Ra and ending with Va are to be contemplated in the six limbs and the elements.

analyzed: evam saṃcintā varṇāni sṛṣṭeḥ utpatti lakṣaṇam
translated: Thus the letters are contemplated. This is the characteristic of the creation of the origin.

analyzed: deveśi sarva tantreṣu sarvadā
translated: O Goddess of the gods, the Word-Brahman always exists in all Tantras.

analyzed: varṇa ātmanā āvirbhavati padya padmāni bhedataḥ
translated: It manifests in the form of letters, in the form of the lotus of poetry.

original: pañcāśadvarṇabījācyaṃ carācaramidaṃ jagat //🔽devatā brāhmaṇā devi sarvavarṇātmikāḥ smṛtāḥ /
analyzed: pañcāśat varṇa bīja ācyam carācaram idam jagat  devatāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ devi sarva varṇa ātmikāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: This moving and unmoving world is born from the seed of the fifty letters.🔽The deities and Brahmins, O Goddess, are remembered to have the nature of all the social classes.

analyzed: atha bindu dbhavāḥ sarve bhūtātmānaḥ sura asurāḥ
translated: Then all the gods and demons, the souls of all beings, are born from the Bindu.

original: atha bindudbhavaḥ śabdastasmādākāśasambhavaḥ /🔽ākāśāttu bhavet sparśaḥ sparśādvāyoḥ samudbhavaḥ //🔽atha vāyorbhavettejastejasognisamudbhavaḥ /
analyzed: atha bindudbhavaḥ śabdaḥ tasmāt ākāśa sambhavaḥ  ākāśāt tu bhavet sparśaḥ sparśāt vāyoḥ samudbhavaḥ  atha vāyoḥ bhavet tejaḥ tejasā agni samudbhavaḥ
translated: Then arises the sound from the bindu, from that arises space.🔽From space arises touch, from touch arises wind.🔽Then from wind arises fire, from fire arises fire.

analyzed: rasa ugneḥ tu bhavet tasmāt rasāt jala samudbhavaḥ
translated: From fire arises taste, from taste arises water.

analyzed: jalāt bhavet tadā gandhaḥ tasmāt tu pṛthivī smṛtā
translated: From water arises smell, from that is remembered the earth.

analyzed: gandha ādi pañca saṃyuktā guṇāḥ bhumeḥ sureśvari
translated: O Goddess of gods, the earth is endowed with the five qualities beginning with smell.

original: caturguṇaṃ jalaṃ jñeyaṃ vahnervāyorguṇāstrayaḥ /🔽ākāśaśya dvidhāprokto guṇolakṣitalakṣaṇaḥ //
analyzed: caturguṇam jalam jñeyam vahneḥ vāyoḥ guṇāḥ trayaḥ  ākāśaḥ śya dvidhā proktaḥ guṇaḥ lakṣita lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Water should be known to have four qualities, wind has three qualities,🔽Space is said to have two qualities, with the characteristic of being defined by qualities.

analyzed: ākāśāt dviguṇam proktam anilam ca tatas param
translated: Space is said to be twice as much as that, and wind is beyond that.

original: tasmāt tu dviguṇaṃ vahnirvahnestu dviguṇaṃ jalam //
analyzed: tasmāt tu dviguṇam vahniḥ vahneḥ tu dviguṇam jalam
translated: From that, fire is twice as much, and from fire, water is twice as much.

original: jalāt tu dviguṇā pṛthvī samānā vā prakīrtitā /
analyzed: jalāt tu dviguṇā pṛthvī samānā vā prakīrtitā
translated: From water, the earth is said to be twice as much or equal.

analyzed: sa guṇam proktam bhūtam tantra samanvitam
translated: Now, the element with qualities is said to be endowed with the Tantra.

analyzed: pṛthivyām oṣadhiḥ jātā oṣadheḥ annam eva ca
translated: From the earth, herbs are born, and from herbs, food.

analyzed: annāt bhavet tadā devi brahmāṇḍam śaśi suryayoḥ
translated: From food, O Goddess, arises the universe with the moon and sun.

analyzed: śaśi surya ātmakam sarvam carācaram idam jagat
translated: This entire world of moving and unmoving beings is based on the moon and sun.

analyzed: acarāḥ bahudhā devi giri vṛkṣa ādi bhedataḥ
translated: O Goddess, the immobile beings are of many kinds, such as mountains, trees, etc.

original: te sarve tu carājñeyāḥ śaṅkareṇa ca bhāṣitāḥ /
analyzed: te sarve tu cara ajñeyāḥ śaṅkareṇa ca bhāṣitāḥ
translated: All of them should be known as moving, as declared by Shankara.

analyzed: jaṅgamāḥ vividhāḥ santi paśu pakṣi ādi bhedataḥ
translated: There are various kinds of moving beings, such as animals, birds, etc.

analyzed: carāḥ tu trividhāḥ jñeyāḥ sveda aṇḍa ja jarāyu jāḥ
translated: The moving beings are to be known as of three kinds - sweat-born, egg-born, and womb-born.

analyzed: sveda jāḥ śa ādyāḥ aṇḍa jāḥ pannaga ādayaḥ
translated: The sweat-born are insects, worms, etc., the egg-born are serpents, etc.,

analyzed: jarāyu jāḥ ca vahavaḥ sarve vai mānuṣa ādayaḥ
translated: and the womb-born are many, all human beings and others.

analyzed: manuṣyaḥ sarva tantreṣu bhavet iti jarāyu jaḥ
translated: A human being is said to be womb-born in all the scriptures.

analyzed: pañcabhūta ātmakam sarvam kathitam padmayoninā
translated: Everything consisting of the five elements has been declared by the Lotus-born One.

analyzed: pañcabhūtāḥ mahābhūtaiḥ vyāptam sarvam carācaram
translated: O Goddess, the five elements and the great elements pervade everything, moving and unmoving.

analyzed: śabda sparśa rūpa rasa gandhāḥ ca parikīrtitāḥ
translated: Sound, touch, form, taste, and smell are declared.

analyzed: mahābhūtāni deveśi kathitāni manīṣibhiḥ
translated: The great elements are said by the wise to be

analyzed: ākāśaḥ ca tathā vāyuḥ agniḥ āpaḥ tathā dharā
translated: Space, air, fire, water, and earth.

original: bhūtāni kathitānyeva sthūlarūpeṇa pārvati //🔽dehaśca turvidhojñeyo jantorutpatī bhedataḥ /
analyzed: bhūtāni kathitāni eva sthūla rūpeṇa pārvati  dehaḥ ca turvidhaḥ jñeyaḥ jantoḥ utpatī bhedataḥ
translated: The elements have been declared in their gross form, O Parvati.🔽The body of a living being should be known as of four kinds, according to the difference in origin.

analyzed: udbhijjaḥ sveda jaḥ uṇḍokhaḥ caturthaḥ ca jarāyu jaḥ
translated: The four kinds are: the sprout-born, the sweat-born, the egg-born, and the fourth, the womb-born.

analyzed: udbhidya bhumim udgacchuti udbhidaḥ sthāvaraḥ tu saḥ
translated: The immobile one is called Udbhid, which emerges from the earth.

analyzed: nirdiṣṭaḥ skanda viṭapa patra puṣpa phala ādibhiḥ
translated: It is indicated by the branches, leaves, flowers, fruits, etc. of Skanda.

analyzed: pañcabhūta ātmakam sarvam kṣām adhiṣṭhāya jāyate
translated: Everything consisting of the five elements is born by occupying the earth.

original: atāyonyagnipavananabhasāṃ samavāyataḥ //🔽svedajaḥ sidyamānedyobhuvahnyadbhyaḥ prajāyate /🔽ṣukmatkunakīṭyādyāḥ priyādyāḥ kṣaṇabhaṅkurāḥ //
analyzed: atas ayoni agni pavana nabhasām samavāyataḥ  sveda jaḥ prajāyate  ṣukma tkuna kīṭi ādyāḥ priya ādyāḥ kṣaṇa bhaṅkurāḥ
translated: From the combination of fire, air, and space, which are not its source.🔽The sweat-born is born from the earth, fire, and water, which are not its source.🔽Such as worms, insects, etc., which are momentary.

analyzed: śukra śoṇita sambhavāt
translated: The egg-born, having become a ball, is born from semen and blood.

analyzed: kālena bhinnāt purṇā ātmā nirgacchan prakramiṣyate
translated: Emerging in time from the full one, it will proceed.

analyzed: ahi godhā ādayaḥ bheka śiṇḍamāra ādayaḥ ca ye
translated: Such as snakes, lizards, etc., and those such as frogs, tortoises, etc.

analyzed: jarāyu jaḥ grāma gataḥ kriyate sṛṣṭi sambhavaḥ
translated: The womb-born, belonging to the village, is created by the origin of creation.

analyzed: prajāyate caturviṃśa tatta saṃyukta dehavān
translated: And is born with a body endowed with the twenty-four principles.

analyzed: svastānāt ca cyutāt śukrāt bindum ādāya mārutaḥ
translated: And from the semen that has fallen from the testicles, the wind takes up a drop.

original: evaṃ sarvatra deheṣu jāyate ca jarāyujāḥ /
analyzed: evam sarvatra deheṣu jāyate ca jarāyu jāḥ
translated: Thus, the womb-born is born everywhere in the bodies.

analyzed: utpatti sthiti rūpeṇa saṃhāreṇa śivapriye
translated: By the dissolution in the form of origination and sustenance, O beloved of Shiva!

original: brahmāṇī vaiṣṇavī bhutvā tathā raudrī bhavet parā /
analyzed: brahmāṇī vaiṣṇavī tathā raudrī bhavet parā
translated: Brahmani, Vaishnavi, and Rudri become the supreme one.

analyzed: pañcabhūta kalāḥ dedi śṛṇuṣva sarva siddhi dāḥ
translated: The five elements are the arts. Listen, they bestow all accomplishments.

analyzed: śāntātītā tathā śāntiḥ vidyā ca saṃpratiṣṭhitā
translated: Tranquil, beyond, and peace, knowledge, and well-established,

analyzed: nivṛttiḥ eṣā kathitā pañca bhūta kalā priye
translated: This is said to be the cessation, the five elements are the arts, O beloved.

analyzed: utpattiḥ eṣā kathitā tantreṣu parameśvari
translated: This is said to be the origin in the Tantras, O Supreme Goddess.

analyzed: saṃhārāḥ krameṇa eva ākāśa antā prakīrtitāḥ
translated: The dissolutions are in the reverse order, up to space, they are proclaimed.

analyzed: maṇḍalāni eva bhūteṣu parimītāni yat śṛṇu
translated: Listen to the mandalas that are limited in the elements.

analyzed: ākāśa maṇḍalam proktam vartulam sarva sammatam
translated: The sphere of space is said to be round, accepted by all.

analyzed: ṣaṭkoṇa maṇḍalam vāyoḥ trikoṇam tu vibhāvasoḥ
translated: The sphere of air is a hexagon, and the sphere of fire is a triangle.

analyzed: aṣṭa asram varuṇasya api catur asram dharā gatam
translated: The sphere of Varuna is an octagon, and the sphere of earth is a square.

analyzed: tri koṇam tu bhavet vāyoḥ tri koṇam varuṇasya ca
translated: The sphere of air is a triangle, and the sphere of Varuna is also a triangle.

analyzed: iti vā sarva tantreṣu kathitam padmayoninā
translated: Thus it is said in all the Tantras by the Lotus-born One.

original: arddhendusannibhaṃ vṭtaṃ jalasya iti vā priye /
analyzed: arddha indu sannibham vṭtam jalasya iti vā priye
translated: The sphere of water is like a half-moon, O beloved.

analyzed: trikoṇam svastika upetam vahneḥ sarva sukha āvaham
translated: The triangle endowed with a swastika of fire brings all happiness.

original: ṣaḍ bindulāñchitaṃ vṛttaṃ maṇḍalaṃ gaganasya ca /
analyzed: ṣaṣ bindu lāñchitam vṛttam maṇḍalam gaganasya ca
translated: The sphere of space is a circle marked with six drops.

analyzed: śukla varṇam jalasya api gaura varṇam tathā pare
translated: The color of water is white, and the color of the other is fair.

analyzed: bhūtāni sarva bhuteṣu kathitāni manīṣibhiḥ
translated: The elements are said to exist in all beings by the wise.

analyzed: pṛthivyām sarva bhūtāni jāyante sa carācaram
translated: All beings are born on earth, with the moving and unmoving.

original: śrotraṃ tvak locanaṃ jihvā ghrāṇaṃ buddhindriyāṇi ca /
analyzed: śrotram tvac locanam jihvā ghrāṇam buddhi indriyāṇi ca
translated: The ears, skin, eyes, tongue, and nose are the organs of sense.

analyzed: vāc pāṇi pāda pāyu pasthāni karmendriyāṇi ca
translated: Speech, hands, feet, anus, and genitals are the organs of action.

original: vacanādāne ca gatiḥ visargānandakau ca saṃproktāvāgādyārthāḥ /
analyzed: vacana ādāne ca gatiḥ visarga ānandakau ca saṃproktau āc ādya arthāḥ
translated: Speech, taking, movement, excretion, and pleasure are said to be the objects of speech and so on.

analyzed: manaḥ buddhiḥ ahaṅkāram cittam api ca kāraṇam

analyzed: tvadīya pāda yugalam dhyāna yogataḥ

analyzed: mama siddhiḥ bhavet devi yuga ante kamala ānane
translated: O Goddess, may I attain perfection at the end of the age, O lotus-faced one.

analyzed: mahānandam samutpannam yat kṣetre tat anantaram
translated: Great bliss arose, and then in that field,

analyzed: nṛtya gītam purā bhutvā hasta vādyam athā bhavet

analyzed: tatas tasmin kṣaṇe devi śabdabrahma vibhūṣitam
translated: Then at that moment, O Goddess, adorned with the Brahman of sound,

translated: Filled with all the groups of scriptures, endowed with all time,

original: brahmāṇḍasya yathā jīvaṃ viṣṇuṃ sarvaguṇāśayam /🔽tadāhi paṭahaṃ prāpyaṃ tasya rādyamathā bhavet //

analyzed: tatra śabde tadā yātā ādikṣantā surālaye
translated: There, having gone into that sound, beginning with the letter A, in the abode of the gods,

analyzed: pañcāśat varṇa yogena vācya vācaka yogataḥ

analyzed: sarva mantrā mahā mantrā mahā vidyā mahā mahā
translated: All mantras, great mantras, great knowledge, and the greatly great,

translated: Are born with hidden syllables. I will proclaim all that.🔽Your command ending with the long vowels, and then my command ending with the short vowels,

analyzed: tvadīyā ca madīyā ca ka ādi ma antā prakīrtitāḥ
translated: Yours and mine, beginning with K and ending with M, are proclaimed.

analyzed: eṣām madhye makāraḥ tu puruvaḥ parikīrtitaḥ

analyzed: hakṣau varṇau maheśāni jīvātma parama ātmakau
translated: The letters ha and kṣa are the individual soul and the supreme soul, O Maheśānī.

analyzed: śivaḥ sākṣāt sarva tantra samanvitaḥ
translated: The letter ha is Śiva Himself, endowed with all the Tantras.

original: a ā i ī u ū ṛ ṝ ḷ ḹ e ai tataḥ param //
analyzed: a ā i ī u ū ṛ ṝ ḷ ḷ e ai tatas param
translated: A, ā, i, ī, u, ū, ṛ, ṝ, ḷ, ḹ, e, ai, and after that,

analyzed: o au aṃ aḥ svarāḥ proktāḥ sarva tantra samanvitāḥ
translated: o, au, aṃ, aḥ - these are declared to be the vowels, endowed with all the Tantras.

analyzed: vācya vācaka yogena jihvā guṇena sarvatas
translated: By the union of the denoted and the denotative, by the quality of the tongue, in every way,

analyzed: ekaḥ hi paramam bra nānātvena nirūpyate  yathā vahneḥ sphuliṅgāni nānā rūpāṇi dṛśyate

analyzed: yathā chinna ākāram pradṛśyate

analyzed: ekaḥ nālāyate vahniḥ dāru yoge yathā purā
translated: Just as fire does not appear to be long when it is in contact with wood in the past,

analyzed: dīrgha svarasya deveśi devatā bhuvaneśvarī
translated: O Goddess of the Lord of gods, the deity of the long vowel is the Goddess of the world.

analyzed: hrasva svarasya deveśi devatā śaṅkaraḥ svayam
translated: O Goddess of the Lord, the deity of the short vowel is Śaṅkara Himself.

analyzed: kādi kṣāntāḥ hamāḥ proktāḥ sarva tantra samanvitāḥ
translated: The letters from ka to kṣa along with ha are declared to be endowed with all the Tantras.

analyzed: śabda arthāḥ ajmale devi dravya ayogena kathyate
translated: O Goddess, the words and their meanings are described by the union of substances.

analyzed: halāni sarva bījāni kīlakāni svarāṇi ca
translated: All the seeds are the letters, and the vowels are the nails.

analyzed: vinā kīlaiḥ iyam sṛṣṭiḥ na devi sthira tām iyāt
translated: O Goddess, this creation would not have stability without the vowels.

original: na karma labhate devi vināprāṇairyathā tanuḥ /
analyzed: na karma labhate devi vinā prāṇaiḥ yathā tanuḥ
translated: O Goddess, just as the body does not obtain action without the vital airs,

analyzed: tat tat buddhyā nirūpyeta pratyākṣam dṛṣṭi gocaram
translated: it should be determined by that intellect, within the range of direct perception.

original: deśe deśe ca śabdārthāḥ nānārthāḥ parikīrtitāḥ /
analyzed: deśe deśe ca śabda arthāḥ nānā arthāḥ parikīrtitāḥ
translated: And the meanings of words are declared to be of various meanings in different places.

analyzed: a c jha laiḥ sarva dravyāṇām kriyā saṃjñā vidhīyate
translated: The action of all substances is prescribed by the vowels.

analyzed: suṣumnā madhya deśe ca vaikharī nāḍikā smṛtā

analyzed: vāyu rūpā tu sā nāḍī vahū vāyu yogena śabdyate

analyzed: suṣumnā mūladehe tu śabda ud pattiḥ ca hetavaḥ

analyzed: āvirbhavanti varṇāni sparśāḥ ca

analyzed: kādi māntāḥ tathā asparśāḥ ya ādayaḥ vyāpakāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The tangibles beginning with Ka and ending with Ma, and the all-pervading ones are remembered as beginning with Ya.

analyzed: uṣmāṇa śavasāḥ jñeyā sarva tantra samanvitāḥ
translated: The sibilants and the aspirates should be known as endowed with all the Tantras.

analyzed: kāvyaḥ ca varga prabhavaḥ ṭavargasya rudhaḥ smṛtaḥ

analyzed: tavargasya guruḥ suraḥ pavargasya śanaiścaraḥ
translated: The guru of the group of letters from ta to ta is Surya, of the group from pa to pha is Agni, of the group from ya to sa is Vayu, of the group from śa to sa is Soma, of the group from sa to ha is Guru, and of the group from kṣa to na is Śanaiścara.

analyzed: ṣavargasya yathā candraḥ devi sarva artha sādhakaḥ
translated: Of the group from ṣa to sa, O Goddess, is the moon, the fulfiller of all objectives.

analyzed: śavargasya ca bhuvi svaḥ varga adhiṣṭhā bhu devatāḥ
translated: Of the group from sa to ha, the presiding deities of the groups are Bhuvi and Sva.
In the deposition of the groups, one should worship in the body for the attainment of the fruits of all accomplishments.

analyzed: pañca pañca bhavet devi kādi lāntā mayaḥ kramāt
translated: O Goddess, there are five each, in order, belonging to the group from ka to ña, and from ṭa to ṇa.

analyzed: ha kṣma vargasya deveśi nṛsiṃhaḥ sarva sammataḥ

original: ta tha da dha na pa pha ba bha ma tataḥ param //
analyzed: ta tha da dha na pa pha ba bha ma tatas param
translated: Ta, tha, da, dha, na, pa, pha, ba, bha, ma, and after that,

analyzed: ya ra la va śa ṣa sa ha kṣa varṇāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: Ya, ra, la, va, śa, ṣa, sa, and ha are declared to be the letters.

analyzed: a ā e ka ca cha ta pa ṣasāḥ vāyavyāḥ parikīrtitāḥ

Sukshma, Suksmasukshma, Amritajnana, Amritapyanani,

translated: Lower lip, teeth, tongue, and moon disc,

analyzed: akāra ādi kṣakāra antāḥ svarāḥ tatra samanvitā
translated: The vowels from A to Ksha are present there.

analyzed: dakṣa skandheḥ kūrpare ca maṇirandhra iṅguli mūlake

translated: From the heart to the right foot, from the heart to the stomach,

analyzed: hastayoḥ pādayoḥ nyāsyāḥ vidhānena ca pārvati

analyzed: hṛdaya ādi tathā upasthe hṛdaya ādi svam urddhani
translated: From the heart to the genitals, from the heart to one's own head,

translated: In the skin, blood, flesh, fat, bones, marrow, semen,

analyzed: jīvātmā paramatmā ca vinyaset deham ātmani

analyzed: eṣu sthāneṣu deheṣu kalā nyāse niyojayet
translated: In these places and bodies, one should engage in the nyasa of the digits.

translated: All those forms beginning with Nilakantha, which are accepted by all,

analyzed: yathākrame yathāsthāne vinyaset vidhinā āyunā  śrīkaṇṭha ādya sukṣmā ca trimurtiḥ amara īśvarau

analyzed: eka rudraḥ ca kurma eka netra ekaḥ ca tu vānānaḥ

Ajeśa, Sarvasomā, Śa, and Lāṅgula, Dāruka,

analyzed: arddhanārīśvaraḥ ca umākāntaḥ ca āṣāḍhi daṇḍinau
translated: Ardha-nārīśvara, Umākānta, Āṣāḍhi, Daṇḍin,

analyzed: abhrī mīnaḥ ca madhokhyaḥ lohitaḥ ca śikhī punar

analyzed: padmāsanam idam proktam sarva tantra samanvitam

translated: Having properly placed the soles of the feet between the knees,

translated: The two feet should be placed on the ground, with the soles facing upwards.

translated: Having placed the two feet on the ground, with the toes pointing towards the knees,

analyzed: karau nidadhyāt deveśi vajrāsanam udāhṛtam

analyzed: eka pādam adhas kṛtvā vinyasya ūrau tathā itaram

analyzed: ṛju kāyaḥ viśet yogī vīrāsanam udāhṛtam

analyzed: āsanāni vahuni eva santi vedeṣu pārvti

analyzed: piṅgalāyām tyajet vāyum dvātriṃśat tena mātrayā

analyzed: mātrā vṛddhi krameṇa eva japet dvādaśa ṣoḍaśa

analyzed: madhyamam kalpa saṃyuktaḥ bhūmityāgam tatas param

analyzed: uttamasya guṇa avāptiḥ yāvat śīlanam īṣyate

analyzed: indriyāṇām vicaratam viṣa ṣeṣu dvidhā kṛtām

analyzed: valāt āharaṇam tebhyaḥ pratyāhāraḥ samahṛtaḥ

analyzed: aṅguṣṭha gulapha jānu ruḥ manasi liṅga nābhiṣu

analyzed: dhāraṇam prāṇa marutaḥ dhāraṇā parikīrtitā

analyzed: samāhitena manasā ca etasya antara vartinā

analyzed: guda dhava ante tu skandham utsedham dvāṅgulam viduḥ

analyzed: nāḍī antatra samudbhūtāḥ mukhyān tisraḥ samīritāḥ

analyzed: brahmarandhram viduḥ tasyām padma sutra nibham priye

analyzed: ādhāran ca viduḥ tatra sarva tantra samanvitam

analyzed: divyam argmi idam prāhar amṛta ānanda lakṣaṇam

analyzed: jyotiṣām nilayam tat ca kathitam padmayoninā

analyzed: tatra vidyut latā ākārā kuṇḍalī para devatā

analyzed: jīva prāpa ātmikā nityā sarva kṣetreṣu saṃsthitā

analyzed: māraṇa ādim prakūrvīta bhūtānām udaye sudhīḥ

analyzed: vicintya ca ātmānaḥ dehe gatiḥ tasya priye sadā

analyzed: varaṇeḥ udaye kuryāt stambhanam sarva sammatam

analyzed: śāntikam pauṣṭikam toyasya samaye priye

analyzed: māraṇam kurute śatroḥ agneḥ udaya yogataḥ

analyzed: vāyoḥ tu udaye kuryāt stambhanam sarva sammatam

analyzed: atha uccāṭanam kuryāt sarva tantra samanvitam

analyzed: kṣetra ādi nāśanam kuryāt ākāśasya udaye sudhīḥ
translated: The wise one should perform the destruction of the field etc. at the rise of Akasha.

analyzed: āsuryā udayam ārabhya yāvat vai ghaṭikā dvayam
translated: Beginning from the rise of Asura up to the two ghatikas,

original: evaṃ krameṇa vijñāya ṣaṭkarmaṣu vicintayet //🔽ādhāya vāyunakṣatraṃ yogamevaṃ vicintayet /🔽mārutaṃ cintayeddehe dhyānayogena dehikaḥ //
analyzed: evam krameṇa vijñāya ṣaṭkarmaṣu vicintayet  ādhāya vāyu nakṣatram yogam evam vicintayet  mārutam cintayet dehe dhyāna yogena dehikaḥ

analyzed: tadā ghaṇṭā svanaḥ jātaḥ tadā megha svanan tatas
translated: Then the sound of a bell arises, and then the sound of clouds.

analyzed: evam abhyasataḥ tasya na asti śoka ādi doṣa jam
translated: For one who practices in this way, there is no fear arising from grief etc.

analyzed: bhayam tasya bhavet siddhiḥ sarva siddhiḥ anuttamā
translated: For him, there will be success, and the supreme accomplishment of all.

analyzed: nādaḥ bhavet tatas binduḥ candra surya ātmakaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Then sound arises, and the drop is known to be of the nature of the moon and sun.

analyzed: bindum nāda ātmakam kecid vadanti munimattamāḥ
translated: Some of the best sages say that the drop is of the nature of sound.

analyzed: bindu nāda ātmakam sarvam carācaram idam jagat
translated: The entire universe of moving and unmoving beings is of the nature of Bindu and Nada.

analyzed: binduḥ pumān bhavet nādaḥ strī rūpaḥ sarva sammataḥ
translated: Bindu is considered to be the male, and Nada is considered to be the female by all.

analyzed: jagatām kāraṇam nādaḥ kathitaḥ padmayoninā
translated: The Lotus-born One (Brahma) has declared that Nada is the cause of the worlds.

original: binā maithunadharmeṇa na siddhiḥ syāt kathañcana //
analyzed: binā maithuna dharmeṇa na siddhiḥ syāt kathañcana
translated: Without the dharma of sexual intercourse, there can be no accomplishment at all.

analyzed: haṃsau tatra samudbhūtau pum striyau tantra sammatau
translated: The male and female Hamsas (geese) are accepted in the Tantras as having arisen from that.

original: haṃmantre puruṣaḥ proktaḥ sakāraḥ prakṛtiḥ smṛtā //
analyzed: haṃ mantre puruṣaḥ proktaḥ sakāraḥ prakṛtiḥ smṛtā
translated: The male is said to be in the mantra Ham, and the female is remembered as the letter Sa.

original: tavimau sakalaṃ viśvaṃ vyāptau tat kuṇḍakena ca /
analyzed: tau imau sakalam viśvam vyāptau tat kuṇḍakena ca
translated: These two pervade the entire universe, along with the Kunda.

analyzed: tadā tad bhāvam āpnoti tadā saḥ ham iti smṛtaḥ
translated: Then one attains that state, then it is remembered as I am that.

analyzed: saḥ eva paramam brahma kuṭa sthaḥ jagat aṅkuraḥ
translated: That is the supreme Brahman, the unmoving sprout of the universe.

analyzed: sarve devāḥ tathā vedāḥ diś vāta ādi ādaram tathā
translated: All the gods, the Vedas, the directions, the winds, and so on, abide in that.

analyzed: truṭi ādi kāla kalpāḥ ca tat tat devaḥ tad ātmakaḥ
translated: The kalpas (ages) of time beginning with Truti, and the gods of those kalpas, are of the nature of that.

analyzed: yasmin ca praṇayam yānti vināśam jagat īśvari
translated: O Goddess of the universe, in whom they attain love, they attain destruction.

analyzed: yasmin sṛṣṭiḥ sadā udbhūtiḥ yasmin adya api jāyate
translated: In whom creation has always arisen, and is still being born today,

analyzed: saḥ evam paramam brahma soha stāvena jāyate
translated: he is thus the supreme Brahman, and is born as I am that.

analyzed: saha varṇaḥ bindu pātha sakti varṇam
translated: The syllable Om is said to be the color of the sun, the color of the path of the bindu, and the color of the directions.

analyzed: praṇavam sarva tantreṣu kathitam padmayoninā
translated: Om is said to be the seed syllable in all tantras by the Lotus-born One.
The Brahman which is full of supreme bliss, is adorned with the Brahman of sound.

analyzed: ātmanaḥ deha madhye tu sarva tantra ātmakam priye
translated: O Beloved, one should contemplate in the middle of one's own body, which is the essence of all tantras,

analyzed: cintayet vidhinā anena brahma viṣṇu śiva ātmakam
translated: By this method, one should contemplate the Brahman which is of the nature of Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva.

analyzed: jagatām kāraṇam proktam veda mantrasya kāraṇam
translated: It is said to be the cause of the worlds and the cause of the mantras of the Vedas.

analyzed: gāyatrī praṇavam ca eva sarva tantreṣu ayam vidhiḥ
translated: Om and Gayatri are the method in all tantras.

analyzed: gāyatrī praṇavasya atha mantra artham brahmaṇā purā
translated: In ancient times, Brahma spoke the meaning of the mantra of Om and Gayatri,

analyzed: catur vedeṣu śāstreṣu na niṣṭhātaḥ purogataḥ
translated: Which was not found at the beginning in the four Vedas and scriptures.

original: kuṇḍamadho tu kurvīta khanano'pi ca sarvataḥ /

analyzed: sundaram sadṛśam kuryāt yathā dṛṣṭi manoharam

analyzed: catur asram kṛte kṣetre sarvam kuṇḍam

analyzed: hastasya kathitam mānam caturviṃśati ca aṅgulam

analyzed: yava aṣṭakaiḥ aṅgulam syāt sarva tantra samanvitam

analyzed: śata home hasta mātram hasta mātram sahasrake

original: ayute tu dvihastaṃ syād ka /staṃ vā parikalpayet //

analyzed: daśakam yāvat tāvat hastena varddhayet

analyzed: daśa hasta mitam kuṇḍam koṭī home vidhīyate

analyzed: viprāṇām catur asraḥ ca rājñām ca vartula ākṛtiḥ
translated: For Brahmins, it is quadrangular. For kings, it is circular.

analyzed: vaiśyānām arddhacandram hi sarva tantra samanvitam
translated: For Vaishyas, the shape is half-moon, in accordance with all the scriptures.

analyzed: sarveṣām iti
translated: For all, the shape is square - this is accepted by the learned.

analyzed: kuṇḍasya rūpam jānīyāt paramam prātar vapuḥ  prācyām śiraḥ samākhyātam hṛdi dakṣiṇa saumyayoḥ

analyzed: vālukābhiḥ vinirmāya ṣāvat aṅgula mānakam

analyzed: pañcājam navanābham ca sarvatobhadram eva ca

analyzed: laghusarvatam ākhyātam sarva tantra samanvitam

analyzed: catur asram kṛtam kṣetram sama bhāga samanvitam
translated: The square area should be made with equal parts,

analyzed: padmāt vahis bhavet piṭham catur dikṣu vidhānataḥ

analyzed: yena tena prakāreṇa deva pujā vidhānake

analyzed: avaśyam eva kartavyam maṇḍalam vidhinā amunā

analyzed: suvarṇaretasaḥ varṇaḥ śobhanaḥ parikīrtitaḥ

analyzed: atha svaram pravakṣyāmi vahneḥ sarva samṛddhi dam

analyzed: pradakṣiṇaḥ tyakta kampaḥ chatra ābhā śikhinaḥ śikhā

analyzed: śubha dā yajamānasya rājyasya api viśeṣataḥ

analyzed: kṛṣṇa vahni gataḥ vahniḥ sarva nāśam kariṣyati

original: vāyasasvarasaṃyuktaṃ tatrāyuśca vinaśyati //🔽śvarasvarasamo vahniḥ sarvaṃ naśyati tatkṣaṇāt /

analyzed: bhavet vahniḥ sarva nāśam kariṣyati

analyzed: atha cakram pravakṣyāmi sarva tantra samanvitam

original: siddhyādicakraṃ vakṣyāmi śṛṇuṣva kamalānane //🔽caturasraṃ likhet koṣṭhaṃ catuṣkoṣṭhasamanvitam /

analyzed: punar catuṣkam tatra api likhet dhīmān krameṇa tu

analyzed: tathā eva krama yogena cintayet vidhinā tatas

analyzed: dakṣiṇa āvarta yogena krameṇa gaṇayet sudhīḥ

analyzed: su siddhāḥ poṣakāḥ jñeyāḥ avilambam nikṛntati

translated: The syllable kuṭā is said to be a single syllable joined with ja and ha.
