analyzed: sarasvatī sadā pātu jihvāyām śakti rūpiṇī
translated: May the Goddess Saraswati, who is in the form of Shakti, always protect my tongue.

analyzed: aikāra bīja rūpā ca kavace hṛdaye
translated: May the Goddess in the form of the seed syllable Aikara protect me in the armor and the heart.

original: huṃkārabījarūpā ca māyā rūpā maheśvarī /🔽hastāyāḥ pādayornābhau pārśvayoścakṣuṣornasi //
analyzed: huṃkāra bīja rūpā ca māyā rūpā maheśvarī  hastāyāḥ pādayoḥ nābhau pārśvayoḥ cakṣuṣoḥ nasi
translated: May the Goddess Maheswari, who is in the form of the seed syllable Humkara and is Maya,🔽In the hands, feet, navel, sides, eyes, nose,🔽Stomach, buttocks, genitals, two feet,

original: udare ca nitambe ca liṅge guhye padadvaye /🔽hastayoḥ pṛṣṭhavaṃśe ca kakudyaṃśe nitambake //🔽phaṭkāraḥ sarvadā pātu astrarūpā śivapriyā /
analyzed: udare ca nitambe ca liṅge guhye pada dvaye  hastayoḥ pṛṣṭhavaṃśe ca kakudi aṃśe nitambake  phaṭkāraḥ sarvadā pātu astra rūpā śiva priyā
translated: Hands, back, neck, shoulders, hips,🔽May the Goddess in the form of the weapon Phatkara, who is dear to Shiva, always protect me.

original: ḍākinī varṇiṇī rakṣāṃ karotu mama mastake //
analyzed: ḍākinī varṇiṇī rakṣām karotu mama mastake
translated: May the Dakini Varni protect my head.

original: vajravai rocanī pātu sarvāṅge chinnamastakā /🔽oṃkāri sarvadā pātu sarvāṅgeṣvaṅgadevatā //
analyzed: vajra vai rocanī pātu sarva aṅge chinna mastakā  oṃkāri sarvadā pātu sarva aṅgeṣu aṅga devatā
translated: May Vajravarohini protect all my limbs, and Chhinnamasta protect me.🔽May the deity of the limbs always protect all my limbs.

analyzed: piṅgalākṣī sadā pātu sarva aṅgeṣu aṅga devatā
translated: May the deity of the limbs always protect all my limbs.

original: iti vā prapaṭheddevi sarvaśāstre svayaṃ vidhiḥ //
analyzed: iti vā prapaṭhet devi sarva śāstre svayam vidhiḥ
translated: O Goddess, this is the self-ordained ritual in all the scriptures.

original: khaḍgarūpā sadā pātu mūrddhni deśe sadā mama /
analyzed: khaḍga rūpā sadā pātu mūrddhni deśe sadā mama
translated: May the sword-formed (goddess) always protect me on the head.

original: śrīvajrā sarvadā pātu śikhāyāṃ mantrarūpiṇī //🔽pāśarūpā sadā pātu sarvāṅge kavacarūpiṇī /
analyzed: śrī vajrā sarvadā pātu śikhāyām mantra rūpiṇī  pāśa rūpā sadā pātu sarva aṅge kavaca rūpiṇī
translated: May the glorious Vajra always protect me on the topknot, in the form of mantra.🔽May the noose-formed (goddess) always protect all my limbs in the form of armor.

original: aṅkuśā sarvadā netrayoḥ śaśisūryayoḥ //🔽asurakṣayakarī devi sarvāṅge astrarūpiṇī /
analyzed: aṅkuśā sarvadā netrayoḥ śaśi sūryayoḥ  asura kṣaya karī devi sarva aṅge astra rūpiṇī
translated: May the goad always protect my eyes, the moon and the sun.🔽O Goddess, the destroyer of demons, may the weapon-formed (goddess) always protect all my limbs.

original: oṃkarālaḥ sarvadā pātu vikarālaḥ sadāvatu //🔽atikarālaḥ sadā pātu mahākarālaḥ sadāvatu /
analyzed: oṃkarālaḥ sarvadā pātu vikarālaḥ sadā avatu  ati karālaḥ sadā pātu mahā karālaḥ sadā avatu
translated: May the syllable Om always protect, may the terrible one always protect,🔽may the very terrible one always protect, may the extremely terrible one always protect, may the greatly terrible one always protect.

original: oṃ gaṇapatiḥ sadā pātu paramaguruḥ sadāvatu //🔽gururvā sarvadā pātu kṣetrapālaḥ sadāvatu /
analyzed: om gaṇapatiḥ sadā pātu parama guruḥ sadā avatu  guruḥ vā sarvadā pātu kṣetrapālaḥ sadā avatu
translated: May Ganapati always protect, may the supreme guru always protect,🔽may the guru always protect, may the Kshetrapala always protect.

original: ādhāraśaktiḥ sadā pātu kurme'yaṃ sadāvatu //🔽anantaḥ sarvadā pātu hṛtpadmaṃ sarvadāvatu /
analyzed: ādhāra śaktiḥ sadā pātu kurma iyam sadā avatu  anantaḥ sarvadā pātu hṛd padmam sarvadā avatu
translated: May the foundation Shakti always protect, may this tortoise always protect,🔽may Ananta always protect, may the lotus of the heart always protect.

analyzed: varṇa rūpā sadā pātu chinna mastā śiva priyā
translated: May the form of the letter always protect, may Chhinnamasta, beloved of Shiva, always protect.

analyzed: iti kavacam divyam kathitam sura durlabham
translated: Thus the divine Kavacha has been narrated, which is difficult to obtain even for the gods.

original: yatra tatra na vaktavyaṃ gopitavyaṃ prayatnataḥ //
analyzed: yatra tatra na vaktavyam gopitavyam prayatnataḥ
translated: It should not be spoken of anywhere, it should be carefully concealed.

analyzed: gopitaḥ sarva tantreṣu viśvasāre prakāśitam
translated: It is concealed in all the Tantras, revealed in the essence of the universe.

original: prāṇānte'pi na vaktavyaṃ nāśiṣyāya kadācana //🔽p / śaṭhāra bhaktihīnāya krūrāya kavacaṃ priye /
analyzed: prāṇānte api na vaktavyam na a śiṣyāya kadācana  śaṭha āra bhakti hīnāya krūrāya kavacam priye
translated: It should not be spoken even at the cost of one's life, never to a non-disciple.🔽O Beloved, this armor should not be spoken to the deceitful, the faithless, the cruel.

original: na vaktavyaṃ na vaktavyaṃ na vaktavyaṃ kathañcana //
analyzed: na vaktavyam na vaktavyam na vaktavyam kathañcana
translated: It should not be spoken, should not be spoken, should not be spoken at all.

original: re pubhrā / mitrā śṛṇuṣva śaivenoktā purā śrutī /
analyzed: re pubhrā mitrā śṛṇuṣva śaivena uktā purā śrutī
translated: O friend, listen to the Vedic words spoken by Shiva in the past.

analyzed: tasmāt mantram yathāyantram kavacam ca vidhāna vid
translated: Therefore, the mantra and the armor should be given according to the rules by one who knows the procedure.

original: na dātavyaṃ na prakāśyaṃ darśayenna kadācana /
analyzed: na dātavyam na prakāśyam darśayet na kadācana
translated: It should not be given, should not be revealed, should never be shown.

analyzed: māsam ekam paṭhet yaḥ tu kavacam sura durlabham
translated: One who recites this armor, difficult to obtain even by gods, for one month,

original: sa bhavet sundaraḥ sākṣāt kuvera iva cāparaḥ /🔽māsadvayaṃ paṭhedyastu sa bhavet sampadāṃ padaḥ //
analyzed: sa bhavet sundaraḥ sākṣāt kuveraḥ iva ca aparaḥ  māsa dvayam paṭhet yaḥ tu sa bhavet sampadām padaḥ
translated: he will become handsome like another Kubera.🔽One who recites for two months will be the abode of wealth.

original: māsatrayaṃ paṭhedyastu sa bhavennidhibhājanam /🔽māsacaturthe saṃprāpte kavīnāmagraṇīrbhavet //
analyzed: māsa trayam paṭhet yaḥ tu sa bhavet nidhi bhājanam  māsa caturthe saṃprāpte kavīnām agraṇīḥ bhavet
translated: One who recites for three months will become a receptacle of treasure.🔽When the fourth month arrives, he will become the foremost of poets.

original: saṃprāpte pañcame māsi bhavet śaivo nirāmayaḥ /
analyzed: saṃprāpte pañcame māsi bhavet śaivaḥ nirāmayaḥ
translated: When the fifth month arrives, he will become a healthy Shiva devotee.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭhe māse tu saṃprāpte bhavet bhūmi purandaraḥ
translated: When the sixth month arrives, he will become the Indra of the earth.

original: saptame māsi saṃprāpte tvadhanī dhanavān bhavet /
analyzed: saptame māsi saṃprāpte tu adhanī dhanavān bhavet
translated: In the seventh month, one becomes wealthy even if one was poor.

analyzed: aṣṭame māsi saṃprāpte putra prautra anvitaḥ bhavet
translated: In the eighth month, one becomes endowed with sons and grandsons.

original: navame māsi saṃprāpte nirugno bhavati dhruvam /
analyzed: navame māsi saṃprāpte nirugnaḥ bhavati dhruvam
translated: In the ninth month, one certainly becomes free from illness.

analyzed: daśame māsi saṃprāpte sarva vidyeśvaraḥ bhavet
translated: In the tenth month, one becomes the lord of all knowledge.

analyzed: ekādaśe tu saṃprāpte caturvargam labhet naraḥ
translated: In the eleventh, a man obtains the four goals of life.

analyzed: iti viśvasāratantre paradevatāyāḥ ṣaḍakṣaryākavacam samāptam
translated: Thus ends the six-syllabled Kavacha of the supreme deity in the Vishvasara Tantra.

analyzed: evam sañcintya vidhinā tat japan ca samarpayet
translated: Having contemplated thus, one should perform the japa according to the prescribed method and dedicate it.

analyzed: mantreṇa anena deveśi pūjayitvā sureśvarīm
translated: O Goddess of gods, having worshipped the chief of gods with this mantra,

analyzed: gandha puṣpaiḥ ca dhūpaiḥ ca gīta vādya puraḥsaraiḥ
translated: with incense, flowers, lamps, and with singing and instrumental music,

analyzed: pūjayitvā mahāmāyām sa alaṅkāreṇa deśikaḥ
translated: the preceptor should worship the great Maya with all ornaments.

analyzed: oṅkāram pūrvam uccārya guhya ati guhyam uccaret
translated: Having first uttered the syllable Om, one should utter the secret of secrets,

analyzed: goptī padam samuddhṛtya gṛhāṇa pada pūrvakam
translated: having uttered the word Gopta (protector), followed by the word grahana (accept),

original: asmat kṛtaṃ samuddhṛtya tadā japapadaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: asmat kṛtam samuddhṛtya tadā japa padam bhavet
translated: having uttered the words Asmat kritam (done by us), then the word japa (japa) should be uttered.

original: siddhirbhavatu me devi tvat prasādāt tvayi sthitā //
analyzed: siddhiḥ bhavatu me devi tvat prasādāt tvayi sthitā
translated: O Goddess, let there be success for me, established in you by your grace.

analyzed: kathitaḥ devi sadā japa samarpaṇe
translated: O Goddess, this mantra is told for always offering the Japa.

analyzed: tatas kuryāt mantreṇa anena deśikaḥ
translated: Then the preceptor should perform the Yantra creation with this mantra.
Reciting the root mantra, one should utter the fourth case ending.

analyzed: caturvarga phala uddeśam sva gotram ca sureśvari
translated: The purpose of the four goals, one's own lineage, and O Goddess of gods,

original: namo'nantañca tato dadyāt śaṅkareṇa ca bhāṣitam /
analyzed: namaḥ nantam ca tatas dadyāt śaṅkareṇa ca bhāṣitam
translated: one should offer salutations and then the words spoken by Shankara.

original: lakṣamekaṃ japaṃ kuryāt yathāliṅge tathā pādaṃ liṅgasaṃkhyā kṛtā
analyzed: lakṣam ekam japam kuryāt yathā liṅge tathā pādam liṅga saṃkhyā kṛtā
translated: One should perform one lakh Japa, as for the Linga, one-fourth for the Pitha, and the number of Lingas for the Pitha.

analyzed: mayā
translated: This has been done by me.

original: śālagrāme manau yantre pratimā citrakeṣu ca //
analyzed: śālagrāme manau yantre pratimā citrakeṣu ca
translated: In the Shalagrama, in the mind, in the Yantra, in the images, in the various pictures,

analyzed: pustake tri śikhe svarge guru pāda dvayeṣu ca
translated: in the book, in the three-crested one, in heaven, and in the two feet of the Guru,

original: pūjayet payayā bhaktyā śaṅkareṇa ca bhāṣitam //
analyzed: pūjayet payayā bhaktyā śaṅkareṇa ca bhāṣitam
translated: one should worship with devotion, as spoken by Shankara.

analyzed: lakṣam ekam japam kuryāt puraścaraṇa karmaṇi
translated: One should perform one lakh Japa in the act of Purashchana.

original: mahāvidyā viṣaye tu japaṃ lakṣaṃ pramāṇakam //
analyzed: mahāvidyā viṣaye tu japam lakṣam pramāṇakam
translated: In the case of the great knowledge, the Japa is one lakh in number.

analyzed: sarvatra sarva tantreṣu kathitam padmayoninā  madyaiḥ māṃsaiḥ vaiḥ jayantaiḥ saktubhiḥ madhu māṃsakaiḥ
translated: It has been told by the Lotus-born one in all the Tantras everywhere.

analyzed: pūjayet parayā bhaktyā devīm dānava nāśinīm
translated: One should worship the Goddess, the destroyer of demons, with devotion, with liquor, meat, victorious substances, flour, honey, and meat.

original: prāṇapratiṣṭhāṃ sarvatra kṛtvā mantraṃ japet sudhīḥ //
analyzed: prāṇa pratiṣṭhām sarvatra kṛtvā mantram japet sudhīḥ
translated: Having established the life force everywhere, the wise one should recite the mantra.

analyzed: pūjām kṛtvā vidhānena svikāram pratipādayet
translated: Having worshipped in accordance with the rules, one should offer one's own self.

original: nānātvadāmi na śṛṇomi na cintayāmi na smarāmi na bhajami na cāśrarāmi /
analyzed: na śṛṇomi na cintayāmi na smarāmi na bhajami na ca āśrarāmi
translated: I do not hear, I do not think, I do not remember, I do not serve, I do not long for.

original: tyaktvā tvadīyacaraṇā pūjamādareṇa māṃ trāhi devi kṛpayā mayi dehi🔽siddhim /
analyzed: tyaktvā tvadīya caraṇā pūjam ādareṇa mām trāhi devi kṛpayā mayi dehi  siddhim
translated: Having abandoned your feet and worship with respect, O Goddess, please save me with compassion, grant me success.

original: p / ajñānādvā pramādādvā vaiguṇyāt sādhanasya ca /
analyzed: ajñānāt vā pramādāt vā vaiguṇyāt sādhanasya ca
translated: Out of ignorance or carelessness, or due to the incompleteness of the means,

analyzed: yat nyunam atiriktam vā tat sarvam kṣattum arhasi
translated: Whatever is deficient or excessive, you should forgive all that.

analyzed: dravya hīnam kriyā hīnam śraddha bhakti vivarjitam
translated: Deficient in substances, deficient in actions, devoid of faith and devotion,

original: tatsarvaṃ kṛpayā devi kṣamasva tvaṃ dayānidhe //
analyzed: tat sarvam kṛpayā devi kṣamasva tvam dayānidhe
translated: O Goddess, O treasure of compassion, please forgive all that with compassion.

original: yanmayā kriyate karma ṣanmahat svalpameva vā /
analyzed: yat mayā kriyate karma sat mahat su alpam eva vā
translated: Whatever action is performed by me, whether great or small,

analyzed: tat sarvañca jagāt hatri kṣantavyam ayam añjaliḥ
translated: All that, O mother of the universe, should be forgiven, with this folded hands.

analyzed: tadā puṣpa añjalim da tvā jāgrat svapna suṣuptiṣu
translated: Then, having offered a handful of flowers, whether awake, dreaming, or in deep sleep,

original: tatsarvaṃ bhāvavān pūjāhayā hatyai namaḥ śive //
analyzed: tat sarvam bhāvavān pūjā hayā hatyai namaḥ śive
translated: All that, with devotion, I offer for the sake of worship. Salutations to the auspicious one.

original: yanmayā kriyate karma ṣanmahat svalpameva vā /
analyzed: yat mayā kriyate karma sat mahat su alpam eva vā
translated: Whatever action is performed by me, whether great or small,

analyzed: tat sarvam ca jagatdhātri kṣantavyam ayam añjaliḥ
translated: O Mother of the universe, please forgive all of that. I offer this folded hands in supplication.

analyzed: tadā puṣpa añjalim da tvā advaitam ca samuccaret
translated: Then, having offered the flower-filled folded hands, one should recite the non-dualistic [mantra].

analyzed: śrī īśvaraḥ uvāca
translated: Lord Shiva said:

analyzed: advaita bhāvanām vakṣye śṛṇuṣva kamalānane
translated: I will speak of the meditation on non-duality. Listen, O lotus-faced one.

original: yasya vijñānamāteṇa bhavedgaṅgādharaḥ svayam //🔽ahaṃ strī puruṣo'haṃ sadāśivo'haṃ paramaprakṛtyaham /
analyzed: yasya vijñāna māteṇa bhavet gaṅgādharaḥ svayam  aham strī puruṣā ūham sadāśivā ūham parama prakṛti aham
translated: By the knowledge of which one would become the Ganges-bearer himself.🔽I am a woman, I am a man, I am Sadashiva, I am the supreme nature.

analyzed: pavamapuruṣaḥ ūham nādaḥ ūham binduḥ aham kalāḥ ca aham
translated: I am the individual soul, I am the sound, I am the bindu, I am the kalas.

analyzed: śabda brahmā uham kriyā yoga ūham brahmā aham viṣṇuḥ aham saura aham
translated: I am the Brahman of sound, I am the yoga of action, I am Brahma, I am Vishnu, I am Shiva,

analyzed: brāhmā aham vaiṣṇavā ūham śivā aham
translated: I am Brahma, I am Vaishnava, I am Shiva.

analyzed: su roham
translated: I am the various powers, I am the demon, I am the god, I am engaged in utterance.

analyzed: vidyā uham vedāḥ ca aham veda sākṣiṇaḥ ca aham veda kriyā aham karma yogaḥ uham
translated: I am the knowledge, I am the Vedas, I am the witnesses of the Vedas, I am the Vedic rituals, I am the yoga of action,

analyzed: dharma karmā aham
translated: I am the righteous deeds.

original: pitāmahaṃ mātāmaḥaṃ putro'haṃ gururahaṃ ācāryohaṃ āgamo'ham /
analyzed: pitāmaham putraḥ aham guruḥ aham ācāryaḥ aham āgamaḥ aham
translated: I am the grandfather, I am the maternal grandfather, I am the son, I am the guru, I am the teacher, I am the scripture.

analyzed: mahābhāgavatā uham śrībhāgavatā uham śruti śāstrāṇi aham
translated: I am a great devotee of Lord Vishnu, I am a fortunate devotee of Lord Vishnu, I am the Vedas and scriptures,

original: mantrārthā'haṃ stavo'haṃ kavaco'haṃ ahaṃ sahasranāma gāyatryahaṃ
analyzed: mantra arthā aham stavā uham kavacā uham aham sahasra nāma gāyatrī aham
translated: I am the meaning of the mantras, I am the praise, I am the armor, I am the thousand names, I am the Gayatri,

analyzed: bīja ānāham tri akṣa roham pañcāśat varṇa mātṛkā aham
translated: I am the seed syllables, I am the three-syllabled [mantra], I am the fifty-lettered alphabet,

analyzed: pañca mahābhūtāni aham tatvā anāham
translated: I am the five great elements, I am the principles, I am the gross, I am the subtle,

analyzed: kula acalaḥ ca aham prāṇāyāma ādi ṣoḍaśa padārthaḥ ūham ṛṣiḥ ca aham
translated: I am the Kula mountain, I am the sixteen topics beginning with breath control, I am the sage,

original: munayaścāhaṃ lakṣmyahaṃa śriyo'haṃ priyo'haṃ gauryahaṃ preto'haṃ
analyzed: munayaḥ ca aham lakṣmī aham śriyaḥ ham priyaḥ ham gaurī aham pretaḥ ham
translated: I am the sages, I am Lakshmi, I am Shri, I am Priti, I am Gauri, I am Preta,

analyzed: kuṣmāṇḍāḥ ca aham lokapālāḥ ca aham grahāḥ ca aham diggajāḥ ca aham
translated: I am the Kumbhandas, I am the Lokapalas, I am the planets, I am the elephants of the directions,

original: daśadiśo'haṃ ūrddho'haṃ adho'haṃ caturdaśabhuvanānyaham / tat stho'haṃ
analyzed: daśa diśaḥ ham ūrddhaḥ ham adhas ham caturdaśa bhuvanāni aham tat stha ūham
translated: I am the ten directions, I am above, I am below, I am the fourteen worlds, I am that,

analyzed: tat aham saṃprakuryāt
translated: I am that, I should perform it.

analyzed: japet mantram vidhānena saṃkhyām kurvan vidhānataḥ
translated: One should recite the mantra according to the rules, counting according to the rules.

original: na doṣo mānase jāpe ityāha bhagavān hariḥ //
analyzed: na doṣaḥ mānase jāpe iti āha bhagavān hariḥ
translated: There is no fault in mental recitation, says Lord Hari.

original: iti viśvasāratantre pracaṇḍacaṇḍikā vivaraṇe tṛtīyaḥ paṭalaḥ //
analyzed: iti viśvasāratantre pracaṇḍacaṇḍikā vivaraṇe tṛtīyaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Thus ends the third chapter in the commentary on the Vishvasara Tantra on Prachanda Chandrika.

analyzed: atha atas saṃpravakṣyāmi puṇyām vai dakṣiṇā vidhim
translated: Now I shall explain the auspicious rite of Dakshina,

analyzed: sarva siddhi pradam sākṣāt mahāpātaka nāśanam
translated: Which directly bestows all accomplishments and destroys great sins.

analyzed: devaiḥ deva tva viṣaye siddheḥ siddha tva siddhaye
translated: For the attainment of perfection in the state of divinity by the gods, and for the attainment of perfection by the perfected ones,

analyzed: rākṣasaiḥ pannagaiḥ devi manuṣyaiḥ ca mumukṣubhiḥ
translated: By the demons, serpents, and by the desirous humans, O Goddess,

analyzed: śmaśāne ca śūnya āgāre catuṣpathe
translated: In a cremation ground, an empty house, at a crossroad,

original: śavopari citāstho vā śayyāstho maithune rataḥ //
analyzed: śava upari citā sthaḥ vā śayyā sthaḥ maithune rataḥ
translated: On a corpse, on the funeral pyre, or lying in bed, engaged in sexual intercourse,

original: parayonau yoniyante pūjayet paradevatām /🔽yonikuṇḍe raktapuṣpairvilvaiḥ gurusamanvitaiḥ //
analyzed: para yonau pūjayet para devatām  yonikuṇḍe rakta puṣpaiḥ vilvaiḥ guru samanvitaiḥ
translated: In another's womb, one should worship the supreme deity.🔽In the vulva-pit, with red flowers, bilva fruits, and accompanied by the guru,

analyzed: saṃhitā ābhāḥ ca śāstrebhyaḥ sa śāstrebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the Saṃhitās, to the scriptures, to the treatises, again and again.

analyzed: namaskṛtya tantrebhyaḥ praṇamet sadā
translated: Having bowed to the texts on worldly matters, one should always bow to the Tantras.
Having bowed to the Yāmalas, one should always bow to the Moon and the Sun.

analyzed: jīvebhyaḥ sarva bhāvebhyaḥ jaṅgalebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations again and again to the living beings, to all the beings, to the mobile ones.

analyzed: sthāvarebhyaḥ namaskṛtya ṛṣibhyaḥ praṇamet sadā
translated: Having bowed to the immobile ones, one should always bow to the sages.

original: pramāṇādipadārthebhyaḥ śoṣabhyo'pi namo namaḥ //🔽yantrebhyo'śi namaskṛtya yathārthebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: pramāṇa ādi padārthebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ  yantrebhyaḥ ūśi namaskṛtya yathārthebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations again and again to the objects of knowledge and so on, to the Sāṃkhya principles.🔽Having bowed to the Yantras, to the true meanings, salutations again and again.

analyzed: sthāvarebhyaḥ namaskṛtya ṛṣibhyaḥ praṇamet sadā
translated: Having bowed to the immobile ones, one should always bow to the sages.

analyzed: pūjā upakaraṇebhyaḥ ca brāhmaṇebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations again and again to the articles of worship, and to the Brahmins.

original: yoginībhyo namaskṛtya saśaktibhyo namo namaḥ //🔽ratnebhyo'pi namaskṛtya nadībhyaḥ praṇamet sadā /
analyzed: yoginībhyaḥ namaskṛtya sa śaktibhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ  ratnebhyaḥ api namaskṛtya nadībhyaḥ praṇamet sadā
translated: Having bowed to the Yoginīs, to those with power, salutations again and again.🔽Having bowed to the jewels, one should always bow to the rivers.

analyzed: pīṭhebhyaḥ api namaskṛtya mātṛbhyaḥ praṇamet sadā
translated: Having bowed to the sacred seats, one should always bow to the Mothers.

analyzed: sattvebhyaḥ api namaskṛtya indriyebhyaḥ namaḥ sadā
translated: Having bowed to the beings, salutations always to the senses.

analyzed: kṣetrebhyaḥ api namaskṛtya kṣetrapālebhyaḥ eva ca
translated: Having bowed to the fields, and also to the Kṣetrapālas,

original: kulācalebhyo natvā ca pradurbhāvebhya eva ca /
analyzed: kula acalebhyaḥ natvā ca pradurbhāvebhyaḥ eva ca
translated: Having bowed to the Kula mountains and to the manifest ones,

original: uktānuktañca yatkiñcit tebhyo nityaṃ namo namaḥ //
analyzed: ukta anuktam ca yat kiñcid tebhyaḥ nityam namaḥ namaḥ
translated: to those mentioned and those not mentioned, I constantly offer salutations to them all.

analyzed: namāmi satya samkalpām sarva parvata vāsinīm
translated: I bow to the one whose resolve is true, who resides in all mountains,

analyzed: pārvatīn ca namaskṛtya namaḥ nityam naga ātmaje
translated: and to Parvati, I constantly offer salutations, O daughter of the mountain.

analyzed: mātar tadīya śaraṇam nṛpāṇām dhyā nāṣpadaiḥ vāñchita vāñchanīyam
translated: O Mother, those who seek refuge in you, the desired and desirable one through meditation and devotion,

original: teṣāṃ hṛdi sphurati tvaccaraṇāravindaṃ sa eva dhanyaḥ suralokapūjyaḥ //
analyzed: teṣām hṛdi sphurati tvad caraṇa aravindam saḥ eva dhanyaḥ sura loka pūjyaḥ
translated: that very fortunate one, worshipped by the world of gods, your lotus feet shine in their hearts.

analyzed: gāṅgaiḥ śubhaiḥ kuṅkuma paṅka lepaiḥ mātar tvadīya śaraṇam yadi  bhāva śuddhaiḥ
translated: O Mother, if the wise ones remember, listen to, and roll about in the auspicious and fragrant unguents of the Ganges,

original: smaranti śṛṇunti luṭhanti dhīrāsteṣāṃ jarā naiva bhavedbhavāni //
analyzed: smaranti śṛṇunti luṭhanti dhīrāḥ teṣām jarā nā eva bhavet bhavāni
translated: with pure thoughts, O Mother, they will never have old age, O Goddess.

analyzed: tvadīya jaṅghā śaraṇam surāṇām para aparāṇām paramām prakṛtiḥ
translated: The supreme nature of the gods, the higher and lower ones, is the refuge of your thighs.

original: dine dine devi bhāvyakarasthā kimanyamuccaṃ kathayanti santi //
analyzed: dine dine devi bhāvya kara sthā kim anyam uccam kathayanti santi
translated: O Goddess, day by day, residing in the hand, what else do the wise ones say is higher?

analyzed: kavi indrāṇām darpam kara kamala śobhā paricitam vidhunvan tad jaṅghām etat
translated: O Daughter of the Mountain, shaking off the pride of the great poets, familiar with the beauty of the lotus of the hand,

analyzed: girisute
translated: this is their thigh.

analyzed: atas tu a pāda abjam janani cetasi hitam
translated: Therefore, O Mother, your lotus feet are to be kept in the mind.

analyzed: narībhūtam bhūtam praṇihita padam śaṅkaram api
translated: Even Shankara, who became a woman, with his feet bound,

original: ye te daridrāḥ satataṃ hi mātastvadīyapādaṃ manasā japanti /
analyzed: ye te daridrāḥ satatam hi mātar tvadīya pādam manasā japanti
translated: Those who are poor, O mother, always muttering your feet in their minds,

original: p / devāsurāsiddhavarāśca sarve tava prasādāt satataṃ luṭhanti //
analyzed: deva asura asiddha varāḥ ca sarve tava prasādāt satatam luṭhanti
translated: All the gods, demons, siddhas and the best, always roll in your grace.

original: haristvaṃ pādābjaṃ dhyātvā nikhilajagatāṃ bhūtivabhūtaśivaḥ siddho
analyzed: hariḥ tvam pāda abjam dhyātvā nikhila jagatām siddhaḥ
translated: Meditating on your lotus feet, Hari, the auspicious one for the welfare of all beings, becomes accomplished.

analyzed: bhūyāt kim api paramam tad param
translated: May there be some supreme state beyond that.

analyzed: prajānām nāthaḥ iyam tadanu jagatām sṛṣṭi vihitam
translated: This lord of beings, after that, created the world.

analyzed: kim anyat te na atas tava caraṇa yugalasya phala tā
translated: What else is the fruit of your pair of feet?

original: indrāḥ surāṇāṃ śaraṇaṃ śaraṇye prajāpatiḥ kaśyapa eva nānyaḥ /
analyzed: indrāḥ surāṇām śaraṇam śaraṇye prajāpatiḥ kaśyapaḥ eva na anyaḥ
translated: Indra is the refuge of the gods, the protector, the lord of creatures, none other than Kashyapa himself.

analyzed: girām bhūtiḥ viṣṇu bhavau pareśi pāda abja phalam samastam
translated: The prosperity of speech, Vishnu and Bhava, the supreme lord, the fruit of the lotus feet of all.

original: tvadīyapādārcanatatparo hariḥ sudarśanādhīśvamupālabhet /🔽dharitrī gandharūpeṇa vāsinaṃ tajjalaṃ dhṛtam //
analyzed: tvadīya pāda arcana tatparaḥ hariḥ sudarśana adhīśvam upālabhet  dharitrī gandha rūpeṇa vāsinam tat jalam dhṛtam
translated: Hari, devoted to the worship of your feet, would reproach Sudarshana, the lord of Adhi.🔽The earth, in the form of fragrance, holds the resident, that water is held.

analyzed: tejasā vahni rūpeṇa vāyu puṣpa vapuḥ dhṛtam
translated: By energy, fire is held in the form of light, wind is held in the form of flowers.

analyzed: ākāśam śabda rūpeṇa praṇave brahma rūpdhṛk
translated: Space is held in the form of sound, in the Pranava, Brahman is held in form.

analyzed: mukham mukham candra ākāriḥ tribhuvana padaiḥ mugdha sahitam trinetra ante mātar
translated: O Mother, the face of the three-eyed one, accompanied by the three worlds, with a face like the moon,

analyzed: para hita manobhiḥ saptaṇḍam
translated: is worshipped by those whose minds are devoted to the welfare of others.

original: na siddhiṃ tasyāpi smarati satataṃ viśvamakhilam /
analyzed: na siddhim tasya api smarati satatam viśvam akhilam
translated: He does not remember even the entire universe, which is always accomplished by him.

analyzed: kaṭākṣaiḥ te mātar sakala
translated: O Mother, he plays with the lotus of your sidelong glances.

original: tavasī mantraṃ japataḥ satyaṃ na hi teṣāṃ khalu sādhyatatvam /
analyzed: tavasī mantram japataḥ satyam na hi teṣām khalu
translated: For those who truly recite your mantra, the truth is not accomplished.

original: ye surapāle suratacitte dhanyā tu viśvaratā vidhat te //
analyzed: ye sura pāle surata citte dhanyā tu viśva ratā vidhat te
translated: O Protector of the Gods, O Lover of Love, they are blessed who engage in all worldly pleasures.

original: kratustvaṃhavistvaṃ murāriḥ purā tvaṃ parātvaṃ sadā śrīmuvāre /
analyzed: kratuḥ tvam haviḥ tvam murāriḥ purā tvam parātvam sadā śrī muvāre
translated: You are the sacrifice, you are the oblation, you are Murari, you are the supreme, you are always the lord of Shri.

analyzed: hariḥ tvam tara tvam śivā tvam śivānī
translated: You are Hari, you are Tara, you are Shiva, you are auspicious.

analyzed: gaḍiḥ tvam matiḥ tvam gatiḥ tam bhavānī
translated: You are the axe, you are the mind, you are the path, you are Bhavani.

analyzed: narā tvam naraḥ tvam nārāṇām kriyāyai
translated: You are the man, you are the man, you are the action of men.

original: cayatvaṃ varastvaṃ varaṇye śivāyāḥ /🔽nadastvaṃ nadīstvaṃ gatistvaṃ nidhīnāṃ sutā tvaṃ sutastvaṃ pitā tvaṃ
analyzed: cayatvam varaḥ tvam varaṇye śivāyāḥ  nadaḥ tvam nadīḥ tvam gatiḥ tvam nidhīnām sutā tvam sutaḥ tvam pitā tvam
translated: You are the heap, you are the boon, you are the auspicious one of the forest.

analyzed: gṛhīṇām
translated: You are the river, you are the river, you are the path of the treasures, you are the son, you are the father of the householders.

analyzed: tvadīya muṇḍa ākhya va bhavānī mālām vidhāya ca te padmaja ādayaḥ
translated: Having made a garland of your skulls named Bhavani, the Lotus-born and others,

original: surādhipātvaṃ labhate munīndrāḥ śaraṇyametat kimapīya cānyat //
analyzed: surādhipā tvam labhate muni indrāḥ śaraṇyam etat ca anyat
translated: O Lords of sages, one attains the status of the lord of gods. This is indeed another refuge.

original: narasya muṇḍañca tathā hi khaḍgaṃ bhujadvaye ye manasā japanti /
analyzed: narasya muṇḍam ca tathā hi khaḍgam bhuja dvaye ye manasā japanti
translated: Those who mentally recite the mantra of a man with a shaven head and a sword in both arms,

original: tathetaro devi varābhayañca bhavanti te siddhijanairmunīndrāḥ //
analyzed: tathā itaraḥ devi varābhayañca bhavanti te siddhi janaiḥ muni indrāḥ
translated: And the other, O Goddess, with the boon and protection gestures, they become Lords of sages, born of accomplishment.

original: śavopari tvaṃ hṛdaye nidhāya japanti vidyāñca hitaṃ kadācit /
analyzed: śava upari tvam hṛdaye nidhāya japanti vidyān ca hitam kadācid
translated: If one places you on a corpse and recites the beneficial knowledge mantra,

original: tadā bhavet kāvyarahasya vetta / ante padadvandvamupāśrayet //
analyzed: tadā bhavet kāvya rahasya vetta ante pada dvandvam upāśrayet
translated: Then one will know the secrets of poetry. In the end, one should resort to the two feet.

original: digandhī tvāṃ manasā vicintya jagat parākhyā jatāṃ janitrī /
analyzed: digandhī tvām manasā vicintya jagat parākhyāḥ jatām janitrī
translated: Thinking of you, O Goddess, with the scent of the directions, may the mother of the world be known as the supreme.

original: bhavet parākhye jagatāṃ gatiśca kimāparākhyaṃ śaraṇaṃ bhavāmaḥ //
analyzed: bhavet parākhye jagatām gatiḥ ca kimāpara ākhyam śaraṇam bhavāmaḥ
translated: May she be the goal of the world. What other supreme refuge shall we go to?

original: śivārvairvā pariveṣṭhitāntāṃ vidhāya citte satataṃ japanti bhaveyurddeveśi
analyzed: śiva arvaiḥ vā pariveṣṭhita antām vidhāya citte satatam japanti bhaveyuḥ ddeveśi
translated: O Goddess of gods, those who always visualize you surrounded by the Rudras and mentally recite the mantra,

original: janāpavāde nidhī śatāṃ devi parā vadanti /
analyzed: jana apavāde nidhī śatām devi parāḥ vadanti
translated: They become the abode of hundreds of treasures, O Goddess, and speak of the supreme.

original: tvadīyaśṛṅgārarasaṃ nidhāya japanti mantraṃ yadi vedamukhyāḥ /
analyzed: tvadīya śṛṅgāra rasam nidhāya japanti mantram yadi veda mukhyāḥ
translated: If the foremost of the Vedas recite the mantra, placing the essence of your love,

original: bhavanti te devi janāpavādaṃ kaviḥ kavīnāmapi svajanmā //
analyzed: bhavanti te devi jana apavādam kaviḥ kavīnām api svajanmā
translated: O Goddess, those people become the abode of slander, and the poet is born of the poets themselves.

original: vikīrṇakeśaṃ manasā vidhāya japanti vidyāñcakitaṃ kadācit /
analyzed: vikīrṇa keśam manasā vidhāya japanti vidyān cakitam kadācid
translated: Sometimes, with mind focused on you, hair disheveled, they chant the Vidyā with fear.

original: surādipatyaṃ labhate naraḥ sa kimanta bhūmyāṃ śṛṇu kālakālī //
analyzed: sura ādi patyam labhate naraḥ sa kim anta bhūmyām śṛṇu kālakālī
translated: That man attains lordship over gods and others. What more, O Kālakālī, listen to the earth.

analyzed: tvadīya bīja trayam ābhavet japanti siddhāḥ muktaketuḥ
translated: The Siddhas, chanting the three seed-syllables of yours on the earth, become liberated.

analyzed: tat evam ātar tava pāda yogāḥ bhavanti siddham ca dina traye pi
translated: Thus, O Mother, by the union with your feet, they attain perfection even in three days.

analyzed: tvad īrakūrca dvaya jāpaka tvāt bhavet ca vandyaḥ
translated: By chanting the two Kūrc syllables of yours, he becomes worthy of worship even by gods and demons.

original: dhanitvapāṇḍitya labhanti sarve kimāparaṃ devi parāparādhye //
analyzed: dhani tva pāṇḍitya labhanti sarve kim āparam devi parāparādhye
translated: All attain wealth and scholarship. What more, O Goddess Parāparā, is there to be done?

analyzed: tvadīya lajjā dvaya jāpaka tvāt bhavet maheśāni caturtha siddhiḥ
translated: By chanting the two Lajjā syllables of yours, O Maheśānī, the fourth perfection is attained.

analyzed: tvadīya sambuddhi pada prasādāt narādhipa tvam labhate muni indraḥ
translated: By the grace of the Sambuddhi pada of yours, the Lord of Sages attains kingship.

original: p / punastannāmnaḥ śṛṇu mātare tatphalaṃ caturvargaṃ vadanti santaḥ /
analyzed: punar tad nāmnaḥ śṛṇu mātare tad phalam caturvargam vadanti santaḥ
translated: Again, O Mother, listen to the fruit of that name. The wise speak of the four goals of life.

analyzed: bīja trayam punar api apāsya surāpa tvam muni indraḥ
translated: Having discarded the three seed-syllables again, the Lord of Sages attains the state of a wine-drinker.

original: punastathā kūrcayuge ca mātarnamanti siddhā narasiṃharūpāḥ /
analyzed: punar tathā kūrca yuge ca mātar namanti siddhāḥ narasiṃha rūpāḥ
translated: Again, O Mother, in the same way, the Siddhas, in the form of Narasiṃha, chant the two Kūrc syllables.

original: ato lajjādvayajāpakatvāt labhanti siddhiṃ manasā janāste //
analyzed: atas lajjā dvaya jāpaka tvāt labhanti siddhim manasā janāḥ te
translated: Therefore, because they cause the recitation of the two types of shame, those people attain success in their minds.

analyzed: ananta dam kṣipya vibhāvasoḥ satī tvad mantram udāram idam vadanti
translated: They say this extensive mantra of yours, O Satī, is thrown into the endless sky.

original: tripañcāre pīṭhai janani satataṃ siddhisahitaṃ vicinvan saṃcinvan
analyzed: tri pañcāre janani satatam siddhi sahitam vicinvan saṃcinvan
translated: O Mother, always seeking and collecting the one endowed with accomplishment in the seat of the thirty-five,
The one with the right foot in the form of supreme nectar.

original: sadā kālīṃ dhyātvā vidhipūjāṃ parikarāṃ viśeṣākhyāṃ na khalu
analyzed: sadā kālīm dhyātvā vidhi pūjām parikarām viśeṣa ākhyām na khalu
translated: Always meditating on Kālī, the special outer worship and retinue, indeed,

analyzed: janitrī bhavati vibhūtyai
translated: One is not afraid of the Ganges of existence.🔽In the lotus of the left foot, born from the past blue lotus, she becomes the generator of prosperity.

analyzed: nayati
translated: She who resides in the abode, brings you to the state of being all-pervading, intoxicated.

analyzed: śrīḥ tmi īśvarī kālī karālī vikarālikā
translated: You are Śrī, Tvaṣṭrī, Īśvarī, Kālī, Karālī, Vikarālī,

original: lajjā lakṣmī satī gaurī nityā cintā citipriyā //
translated: Lajjā, Lakṣmī, Satī, Gaurī, Nityā, and Citā, dear to Cit.

original: parā / dyā parīkṣā ca paramā paramāvapuḥ /
analyzed: parā
translated: Supreme, divine, examined, supreme, having a supreme form,

analyzed: yaiḥ ganddhadyaiḥ citte pracaya pada padmaiḥ pada yutaiḥ
translated: By those who place in the mind the lotus of the feet, endowed with words,

original: sadā natvā stutvā japati hṛdi mantraṃ manuvidyā /
analyzed: sadā natvā stutvā japati hṛdi mantram manu vidyā
translated: Always bowing, praising, and muttering the mantra in the heart, knowing the Vidya of Manu,

analyzed: na teṣām saṃsāre vibhava bhaya bhaṅga pramathane
translated: For them, in saṃsāra, there is no destruction of wealth, fear, or sorrow.

original: kṣaṇaṃ cittaṃ devi prabhavati vimārge parikaraḥ /
analyzed: kṣaṇam cittam devi prabhavati vimārge parikaraḥ
translated: O Goddess, the mind is powerful for a moment in the wrong path,

analyzed: trayastriṃśaiḥ ślokaiḥ yadi mantram stuvati ca
translated: If one praises the mantra with the thirty-three verses and the japa,

analyzed: namet cetām etā paramam amṛta kalaśam sura varam
translated: One should bow to this supreme nectar-filled vessel, the best of gods.

analyzed: bhavet siddhi siddhaḥ jagati śirasā tvad pada yugam
translated: May I be accomplished in the world, with my head at your feet.

analyzed: praṇamya prākāmya sura asura janaiḥ pūjya a vihitam
translated: Having bowed, I desire to praise the two, worshipped by the gods and demons.

original: iti viśvasāratantre dakṣiṇakālikā vivaraṇe caturthaḥ paṭalaḥ //
analyzed: iti viśvasāratantre dakṣiṇa kālikā vivaraṇe caturthaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourth chapter in the commentary on the Vishvasara Tantra on Dakshina Kalika.

analyzed: atha durgām aham vakṣye śṛṇuṣva kamalānane
translated: Now I will tell about Durga, listen, O lotus-faced one.

analyzed: yasya prasāda mātreṇa bhavet gaṅgādharaḥ svayam
translated: By whose grace alone one becomes the Ganges-bearer himself.

analyzed: tha anta varṇam samuddhṛtya vāma karṇa samanvitam
translated: Having extracted the last letter, endowed with the left ear,

analyzed: indu bindu samāyuktam bījam durgā manoḥ priye
translated: United with the moon and dot, O beloved, is the seed of Durga's mind.

analyzed: asya api sadṛśī vidyā jagati asmin na vidyate
translated: In this world, there is no knowledge equal to this.

analyzed: kim anyaiḥ asa lāpaiḥ yatra āyuḥ vyaya ktā amiyāt
translated: What is the use of other fruitless endeavors where life is wasted?

analyzed: tat tu durgā manoḥ devi ṣoḍaśa aṃśam labhate
translated: That, O Goddess, obtains a sixteenth part of Durga's mind.

analyzed: ekākṣarī samaḥ na asti vidyām tribhuvane priye
translated: O Beloved, there is no Vidyā equal to the Ekākṣarī in the three worlds.

analyzed: vinā gandhaiḥ vinā puṣpaiḥ vinā homa puraḥsaraiḥ
translated: Without scents, without flowers, without the preliminary offerings of oblations,

analyzed: prāṇāyāmaḥ vinā devi japa mātreṇa siddhi dā
translated: O Goddess, Prāṇāyāma alone, merely by Japa, bestows success.

analyzed: jamadagniḥ bharadvājaḥ bhūṇḍa gautama kaśyapāḥ
translated: Jamadagni, Bharadvāja, Bhūṇḍa, Gautama, Kaśyapa,

analyzed: viśvamitraḥ śiraḥ nandiḥ kaholiḥ tuṇḍikaḥ tathā
translated: Viśvāmitra, Śiro, Nandi, Kahola, and Tuṇḍika -

analyzed: ete ca ṛṣayaḥ proktāḥ durgā mantrasya pārvati
translated: These are said to be the sages, O Pārvatī, of the Durgā mantra.

analyzed: mantrasya ṛṣiḥ ddeveśi nāradaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: O Goddess of the Lord of beings, the sage of the mantra is declared to be Nārada.

analyzed: gāyatrī chandaḥ ākhyā antam tu devatā
translated: The meter is said to be Gāyatrī, and the presiding deity is Durgā.

analyzed: devī sarva tantreṣu saṃsthitā
translated: The Goddess who bestows the four goals of life is present in all the Tantras.

analyzed: yasyāḥ kaṭākṣa mātreṇa bhavet bhūmi purandaraḥ
translated: By merely a sidelong glance of Her, one would become a lord of the earth and Indra.

original: īhaiva dhanino bhūtvā rājānañca vasaṃ nayet /
analyzed: īhā eva dhaninaḥ bhūtvā rājānam ca vasam nayet
translated: Having become wealthy in this very life, one would rule the king.

analyzed: sa bhavet vacasā dhīmān vṛhaspatiḥ iva aparaḥ

Moving as one desires, going as one desires, increasing the passion of love.

analyzed: trisandhya vāsanī sandhyā śubha dā ca śubha pradā

bestowing victory, to be honored with victory, trembling, destroying fever.

analyzed: dāna mānyā dānavī ca ananyā mṛtyu rūpiṇī

The mother of the gods, the body loved by the kings of demons.

analyzed: jitvarā jayamānyā ca jayadā jayavāhanā

analyzed: uccaiḥśravāḥ hayānām hi manuṣyāṇām narādhipaḥ

analyzed: vāsanām amṛtā satyā dhanānām dhana sañcayā

analyzed: vimuthā sumutha veśyā

analyzed: kupaṭā kapaṭā kupyā kupya parvata vāsinī

analyzed: ca su jaḍā jaḍa varjitā

analyzed: aneka nāmnī eka nāmnī sarva nāma vivarjitā

analyzed: jyotiḥ brahma mayī sākṣāt chandaḥ brahma svarūpiṇī

analyzed: sarva sattva akṣara karī sarva sattveṣu saṃsthitā

analyzed: vīṇā vadyavatī veśyā arciḥ ca suruciḥ tathā

analyzed: sunītiḥ ca kayādhuḥ ca hṛtadyutiḥ tatas parā

analyzed: rasāla mātṛkā vānyaḥ vanasthā vanagocarā

Sama Veda lover, boundary, destroyer of the Sama Veda,

analyzed: kauṭumbī ca kaṭumbī ca kumanā nayana ānanā
translated: Kautumbi, Kumbhi, with a bad mind, eyes, and face,

analyzed: abhyantarā vahi sthā ca nānā mālā vidhāriṇī

analyzed: yāminī māsikā mātā pramātā mātṛkāyatiḥ

analyzed: rasānām ca madhu svāduḥ śabdānām praṇavaḥ tathā

analyzed: varṇanām brāhmaṇaḥ sākṣāt dhānyānām śāliḥ uttamā
translated: The Brahmana of letters, the best of grains like rice,

analyzed: śasyānām śālikā nāmā kṣetrāṇām kāśikā tathā
translated: The best of crops is named Shalik, and the fields are named Kashhika,

analyzed: hrdānām sāgarāḥ gaṅgā ratnānām kāñcanam tathā

analyzed: nagānām meruḥ uddiṣṭā parvatānām pituḥ priyā
translated: The Meru mountain is declared, and the beloved of the father among mountains,

analyzed: nadīnām ca bhavet gaṅgā tīrthe puṣkara rūpiṇī

analyzed: pulastasya ālayam proktam āśrameṣu ca pārvatī

analyzed: dhanyānām ca kuberaḥ ca patīnām patatāt patiḥ

analyzed: gatiḥ gatimatām ca eva vinareṣu pramāṣṭikā

To be known as all the darkness, the delight of the nectar of the mouths,
Camphor, the delight of the breath, with the face filled with betel,

analyzed: rakta vastra paridhānā rakta vastra uttarīyanī
translated: Clad in red garments, with a red upper garment,

original: pāttanī pāttanī premnā kopakanyā pramodanī //🔽kāliḥ kālipriyā keliḥ krīḍāthelā ca kurddhikā /
analyzed: pāttanī pāttanī premnā kopakanyā pramodanī

The birthplace, the well-born, the one who resides at the door of birth,

analyzed: nāḍī sandhāna rūpā ca sarva māṃsa priyā tathā
translated: The form of the union of the channels, and also the one who loves all flesh,

analyzed: śṛṅgā rāṅganivāsī ca śṛṅgāra bhāva bhāvikā

analyzed: candrikā candrakāntiḥ ca tatas candrakarī kriyā
translated: The moonlight, the moon's radiance, and then the moon's act of creation,

analyzed: idam sahasranāmāni nāradena ca bhāṣitam
translated: This thousand names was spoken by Narada.

analyzed: tat aham kathitam devi durgā nāma sahasrakam
translated: O Goddess, I have told you that thousand names of Durga.

original: ślokaṃ vā pādamekāmbā yaḥ paṭhet prātareva hi /
analyzed: ślokam vā pādam ekā ambā yaḥ paṭhet prātar eva hi
translated: One who recites even a verse, a quarter of a verse, or half a verse in the morning,

original: sa bhavet pārvatī putraḥ svayaṃ nāradabhāṣitam //
analyzed: sa bhavet pārvatī putraḥ svayam nārada bhāṣitam

original: vandhyā vā kākavandhyā vā mṛtapatyā ca yoṣitām /
analyzed: vandhyā vā kākavandhyā vā mṛta patyā ca yoṣitām

analyzed: paṭhanāt śravaṇāt vā api bhavet putraḥ svayam śivaḥ

analyzed: brahmahatyā surā pānam steyam guru aṅganā āgamaḥ
translated: The sin of killing a Brahmin, drinking alcohol, stealing, or having sex with a guru's wife,
