translated: With the root mantra, one should offer water for washing the feet and respectful offering everywhere.🔽One should worship the secret Kali with great devotion according to the prescribed method.

original: guhyakālyāsanaṃ guhyakālī tathā tathā ṅitaḥ //🔽gṛhna gṛhna padadvandvaṃ mama śatrūn vadet tataḥ /
analyzed: guhyakālī āsanam guhyakālī tathā tathā ṅ itaḥ  gṛhna gṛhna pada dvandvam mama śatrūn vadet tatas
translated: One should say Sadashiva ending with nge, then the word Mahapretasana, Guhyakaliasana, Guhyakali with ta and nga.🔽Then the two words Ghrna Ghrna, then My enemies,

original: nāśaya dvitayaṃ brūyat khādaya dvitayaṃ vadet //
analyzed: nāśaya dvitayam khādaya dvitayam vadet
translated: then the two words Nashaya Nashaya, then the two words Khadhaya Khadhaya,

original: turu turu padadvandvaṃ tat sphurasphureti ca /
analyzed: turu turu pada dvandvam tat sphura sphura iti ca
translated: then the two words Turu Turu, then Sphata Sphata,

original: ca / chindi chindi padadvandvaṃ siddhiṃ dehi padadvayam //
analyzed: ca chindi chindi pada dvandvam siddhim dehi pada dvayam
translated: then the two words Chhindi Chhindi, then the two words Dehi Siddhim,
then the two words Kavachanam, then at the end Vahni Sundari.

original: pañcāśadvitayā rūḍho validhāne nivedayet //🔽gāyatrīṃ prajapet kālyā guhyaśabdasamanvitām /
analyzed: pañcāśat vitayā rūḍhaḥ vali dhāne nivedayet  gāyatrīm prajapet kālyā guhya śabda samanvitām
translated: One should offer fifty-two oblations in the bali offering.🔽One should meditate on the Gayatri mantra of Kali, along with the secret word.

original: kāmarājaṃ samuddhṛtya mantrarājaṃ tathāṅitam //🔽p / vidmahe tatrānantare tu uddhared yatnapūrvakam /
analyzed: kāmarājam samuddhṛtya mantrarājam  vidmahe tatra anantare tu uddharet yatna pūrvakam
translated: Having extracted the Kama Raja mantra, and the mantra king with the same,🔽One should extract with effort the word vidmahe in the next line.

analyzed: vidye puṇye samābhāṣya dhīmahi tad anantaram
translated: Having addressed the auspicious Vidya, one should then say dhimahi.

analyzed: tāmrā padam samābhāṣya tadā devī
translated: Having addressed the word taamra, then the Goddess should be urged.

analyzed: guhyakālyāḥ tathā kālyāḥ gāyatrī kathitā priye
translated: O Beloved, the Gayatri of Guhya Kali and Kali has been told.

original: nātra siddhadadāpekṣā ca na ca mitrādiduṣaṇam /
analyzed: na atra siddhadada apekṣā ca na ca mitra ādi duṣaṇam
translated: Here, there is no need for the grace of the Siddhas, nor any fault of friends etc.

analyzed: na vitta vyaya vāhūlyam kathitam padmayoninā
translated: The Lotus-born One has not spoken of any great expenditure of wealth.

analyzed: yathākāle yathāsthāne yathacāram yajet śivām
translated: One should worship Shiva at the proper time, place, and in the proper manner.

analyzed: gurum santoṣya yatnena japet vidyām an anya dhīḥ
translated: Having pleased the Guru with effort, one should meditate on the Vidya with an undivided mind.

analyzed: guru santoṣataḥ sarvam phala bhāj bhavavati dhruvam
translated: By pleasing the Guru, one certainly becomes a partaker of all fruits.

analyzed: guroḥ ājñām an ādṛtya vidyām prāpya japet naraḥ
translated: A man who disregards the Guru's command and obtains the Vidya, and meditates on it,

analyzed: siddhiḥ na jāyate tasya kalpa koṭi śataiḥ api
translated: Will not attain perfection even in hundreds of crores of Kalpas.

original: śākaiḥ sūpaiśca pūpairvahūlaghanaghṛtairmadyamāṃsaiśca dugdhaiḥ🔽coṣyaiścarvyaśca lehyaiḥ suvahūvahūgalaccholitaiḥ śikyamāṃsaiḥ /🔽grāhaiḥ kūrmaiśca gobhiddalā śivaśarāsukaiśchāgameṣaiḥ
analyzed: śākaiḥ sūpaiḥ ca pūpaiḥ vahūla ghana ghṛtaiḥ madya māṃsaiḥ ca dugdhaiḥ  coṣyaiḥ carvyaḥ ca lehyaiḥ śikya māṃsaiḥ  grāhaiḥ kūrmaiḥ ca śiva śara āsukaiḥ chāga meṣaiḥ
translated: With vegetables, soups, pancakes, plenty of ghee, wine, meat, milk,🔽Suckers, chewers, lickers, with very many hanging meat pieces, with🔽Crocodiles, tortoises, cows, deer, peacocks, goats, sheep,

analyzed: śallyaiḥ godhā viḍālaiḥ nava paśu paśubhiḥ matsya māṃsaiḥ ca dagdhaiḥ
translated: Shalyas, Godha, cats, with new animals and animal meat, and burnt fish,

original: mārgyairmedhaiḥ paramamasṛtaṃ patrapuṣpaiśca piṣṭaiḥ śālyainnaḥ pūjayet
analyzed: mārgyaiḥ medhaiḥ parama masṛtam patra puṣpaiḥ ca piṣṭaiḥ pūjayet
translated: With sacrificial offerings, the highest, with leaves, flowers, ground rice, and rice, one should worship the goddess.

analyzed: tām sakala sura vadhu pūjitām tām namāmi
translated: I bow to her, worshipped by the wives of all the gods.

original: gṛñjaiḥ śaktisamāptā janani janamabhuḥ pūjayitvā vidhānai rātrau cāhri
analyzed: gṛñjaiḥ śakti samāptāḥ janani janam abhuḥ pūjayitvā vidhānaiḥ rātrau
translated: Having worshipped the goddess with brinjals, Shaktis, and other things, in accordance with the rules, at night and in the day,

analyzed: śuciḥ aśucibhiḥ vaijayantyam jayantām
translated: With pure and impure things, may the Vaijayanti be victorious.

original: evaṃ saṃpūjya tāṃ devīṃ guhyakālīṃ mahodayām /
analyzed: evam saṃpūjya tām devīm guhyakālīm mahā udayām
translated: Having thus worshipped the goddess Guhyakali, of great prosperity,

analyzed: stavena anena saṃstutya sādhayet siddhim uttamām
translated: Having praised with this hymn, one should accomplish the highest perfection.

original: ataḥ kālyāṃ stavaṃ vakṣye śṛṇuṣva kamalānane /
analyzed: atas kālyām stavam vakṣye śṛṇuṣva kamala ānane
translated: Henceforth I shall tell the hymn of Kali. Listen, O lotus-faced one,

analyzed: yat prasādāt mahātmānaḥ sarva siddhim avāpnuyuḥ
translated: By whose grace the great souls would attain all perfection.

analyzed: śivaḥ uvāca
translated: Shiva said:

analyzed: oṃkālī ānīnā mahā tejāḥ loka dhātrī mahā yaśā
translated: Om! Kaliyani, Maha Teja, the great sustainer of the world, of great fame,
Sarasvati, Maha Lakshmi, the prosperity of beings, the enhancer of intellect,

analyzed: dhṛti dā puṣṭi dā svāhā kālīm kālī kāmarūpiṇī
translated: The giver of stability, the giver of nourishment, Svaha, Kali, the one who assumes the form of desire,

analyzed: sarva sattva hite yuktā saṃgrāme tāriṇī jayā
translated: Engaged in the welfare of all beings, the savior in battle, the victorious one,

original: indvatī śaṅkhinī purṇā vidyā rājñī priyapradā /🔽candrānanā mahāgaurī kūjitā pitavāsavā //🔽mahāmāyā mahālokā mahāvalaparākramā /
analyzed: indvatī śaṅkhinī purṇā vidyā rājñī priya pradā  candrānanā mahāgaurī kūjitā
translated: The one with the moon, the conch, the full, the queen of knowledge, the giver of what is dear,🔽The one with a face like the moon, the great Gauri, the one who cooed, the one who wears the skin of a goat,🔽The great illusion, the great world, of great strength and valor,
The great fierce one, the greatly wrathful one, the slayer of wicked demons,

original: praśāntā śāntarūpā ca vijayā ca valapradā //🔽vidyunmālī gadī khaḍgī cakrī cāpodātāyudhā /
analyzed: praśāntā śāntarūpā ca vijayā ca valapradā  vidyunmālī gadī khaḍgī cakrī ca apodāta āyudhā
translated: The peaceful one, the one with a peaceful form, the victorious one, the giver of strength,🔽The one with a garland of lightning, the club-bearer, the sword-bearer, the discus-bearer, the bow-bearer, the one with raised weapons,
The yawning one, the paralyzing one, the young one, the night of destruction, the one who roams at night,
The Yakshini, the enchanting one, the dark one, the peaceful one, the one with a peaceful form,

analyzed: brahmāṇī vedamātā ca tuhinācala vāsinī
translated: The Brahmani, the mother of the Vedas, the resident of the Himalayas,
The auspicious one, the consort of Shankara, the gentle one, the one with knowledge of the past and future, the one born of the mind,
The fierce one, the one with great speed, the one accomplished, the one with truth as her valor,
The desert, the one who melts, the red one, the destroyer of the destruction of the lost,
The bestower of boons, the moon, the embodiment of scriptures, and of unmeasured prowess.

original: śavarī yoginī siddhā cāṇḍālī cāmṛtā dhruvā /
translated: The Yogini, the Siddha, the Chandali, the immortal, the eternal,
The meritorious, the blessed, the great joy, the giver of joy, overwhelmed with love.

analyzed: kṛtānta vāsinī bhīmā ugrā ugra mahā tapā
translated: The dweller in the end of creation, the terrible, the fierce, of fierce great austerity,
Devoted to the sole good of the world, the refuge, affectionate towards devotees.

original: vāgīśvarī śivā sūkṣmā sarvā nityā nagātmajā /
analyzed: vāgīśvarī śivā sūkṣmā sarvā nityā nagātmajā
translated: The goddess of speech, the auspicious, the subtle, the all, the eternal, the daughter of the mountain,

original: sarvārthasādhanī bhadrā goṣṭhī dhātrī dhanapradā //🔽p / abhayā gautamī śreṣṭhā niśīkhe ca śrīḥ sarvārthakāmugā /
analyzed: abhayā gautamī śreṣṭhā niśīkhe ca śrīḥ sarva artha kāmugā
translated: The fulfiller of all purposes, the fortunate, the assembly, the nurse, the giver of wealth.🔽The fearless, the best of the Gautamis, and Lakshmi in the middle of the night, fulfilling all desires.

original: abhayā gautamī śreṣṭhā niśīthe ca śrīḥ sarvārthakāmugā //
analyzed: abhayā gautamī śreṣṭhā niśīthe ca śrīḥ sarva artha kāmugā
translated: The fearless, the best of the Gautamis, and Lakshmi in the middle of the night, fulfilling all desires.

analyzed: tārā nāma guṇā sarvā sarva āśā paripūjitā
translated: All the qualities of the star named Tara, all hopes fulfilled.

analyzed: aṣṭottaraśatam nāma kīrtitam hita kāmyayā
translated: The one hundred and eight names have been recited with a desire for welfare.

analyzed: rahasyam adbhutam guhyam devānām api durlabham
translated: The secret, the wonderful, the hidden, difficult to obtain even by the gods,

original: prātaḥkāle niśīthe ca rātrau vā parameśvarī //
analyzed: prātaḥkāle niśīthe ca rātrau vā parameśvarī
translated: The supreme goddess in the morning, at midnight, or at night,

original: yaḥ paṭhet pāṭhayedvapi ṣaṇmāsaṃ pratyahaṃ priye /
analyzed: yaḥ paṭhet ṣaṣ māsam pratyaham priye
translated: One who recites or causes to be recited every day for six months, O beloved,

analyzed: tasya sarva arha siddhiḥ syāt yat yat manasi vartate
translated: He will attain all desired accomplishments, whatever the mind turns to.

analyzed: aṣṭottaraśatam nāma kīrtanam hita kāmyayā
translated: I shall recite one hundred and eight names with a desire for welfare.

analyzed: saubhagya karaṇam jantoḥ sarva pāpa vināśanam
translated: It brings good fortune to beings and destroys all sins.
It alleviates all diseases and brings happiness at all times.

analyzed: tri kālam yaḥ paṭhet dhīmān śuciḥ bhūtvā samāhitaḥ
translated: The wise one who recites this with purity and concentration three times a day,

analyzed: saḥ u acirena eva kālena rājya śriyam avāpnuyāt
translated: Will soon attain the glory of a kingdom.

original: duḥkhito'pi sukhī nityaṃ daridro dhanavān bhavet //
analyzed: duḥkhitaḥ api sukhī nityam daridraḥ dhanavān bhavet
translated: Even the sorrowful one is always happy, and the poor becomes wealthy.

original: yato bhavet mahāprājño medhāvī nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: yatas bhavet mahā prājñaḥ medhāvī na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: From where he becomes very wise and intelligent, there is no doubt about it.

analyzed: vandhanāt mucyate vaddhaḥ vyāvahāre jayī bhavet
translated: The bound one is released from bondage, and in legal disputes, he becomes victorious.

original: sa eva dāsatāṃ yānti śṛṅgiṇaścāpi daṃsṭrīṇaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva dāsa tām yānti śṛṅgiṇaḥ ca api daṃsṭrīṇaḥ
translated: Even the horned and tusked animals become his slaves.

original: saṃgrāme saṅkaṭe durge nābhayaṃ syāt samaṅgale //
analyzed: saṃgrāme saṅkaṭe durge na abhayam syāt sa maṅgale
translated: In battle, danger, and difficult situations, there is no fear without auspiciousness.

analyzed: smṛtvā etāni ca nāmāni sarva pāpam vyapohati
translated: By remembering these names, one destroys all sins.

analyzed: yaḥ tu imām prātar utthāya mānavaḥ kīrtiyiṣyati
translated: The man who, rising in the morning, will recite this,

original: sa dīrghāyurāyuṣmān sa śriyā ca na mucyate /🔽devā yakṣāstathā nāgā gandharvyāḥ kaṭapūtanā //
analyzed: sa dīrgha āyuḥ āyuṣmān sa śriyā ca na mucyate  devāḥ yakṣāḥ tathā nāgāḥ gandharvyāḥ kaṭapūtanā
translated: He will live long, be healthy, and never be separated from prosperity.🔽Gods, Yakshas, Nagas, Gandharvas, Kshpanas,

analyzed: bhūta preta piśācāḥ ca mātaraḥ deva mātaraḥ
translated: Bhutas, Pretas, Pisachas, and the Mothers, the Mothers of the Gods,

original: atra patitam /🔽nitambe kālikā patu kālikā kālanaśinī /
analyzed: atra patitam  nitambe kālikā patu kālikā kālanaśinī
translated: Has fallen here.🔽On the buttocks, let Kali, the thick Kali, the destroyer of time, protect.

original: klīṃ pātu kaṇṭhadeśe ca pārśve klī/ sarvadāvatu //🔽vāmapārśve sadā pātu klī/kārī sarvkāmadā /🔽stanayugme sadāpātu hū/kārī sarvasiddhidā //
analyzed: klīṃ pātu kaṇṭha deśe ca pārśve klī sarvadā avatu  vāma pārśve sadā pātu klīkārī sarvva kāma dā  stana yugme sadā apātu hūkārī sarva siddhi dā
translated: Let Klim always protect the throat region, and Klim the sides.🔽Let Klim always protect the left side, the giver of all desires.🔽Let Humkari always protect the pair of breasts, the giver of all accomplishments.

analyzed: huṅkārī sarvadā pātu skanda deśe maheśvarī
translated: Let Humkari always protect the groin region, the great goddess.

original: drīūṃ pātu nābhau guhye ca sarvaśaktiṣu saṃsthitā /
analyzed: drīūm pātu nābhau guhye ca sarva śaktiṣu saṃsthitā
translated: Let Drim protect the navel and the genitals, established in all powers.

analyzed: svāhā mām pātu sarvatra hastayoḥ vāhū pādayoḥ
translated: Let Svaha always protect me everywhere, in the arms, the back, and the feet.

original: sarvāṅge pātu māṃ devīṃ guhyakālī mahodayā /
analyzed: sarva aṅge pātu mām devīm guhyakālī mahodayā
translated: Let the goddess Guhyakali, the greatly prosperous, always protect all my limbs.

original: pātu māṃ sarvadā kālī kapālī sarvadāvatu //
analyzed: pātu mām sarvadā kālī kapālī sarvadā avatu
translated: Let Kali always protect me, let Kapali always protect me.

analyzed: rājadvāre śaṅkaṭe ca śmaśāne sarvadā avatu
translated: Let her always protect me at the royal gate, in difficult situations, and in the cremation ground.

original: sarvadā pātu māṃ devī durgā sarvasamṛddhidā //
analyzed: sarvadā pātu mām devī durgā sarva samṛddhi dā
translated: Let the goddess Durga, the giver of all prosperity, always protect me.

original: kurukullā sadā pātu āsane sarvakāmadā /🔽vipracittā sadā pātu citāṅgasarvasiddhaye //
analyzed: kurukullā sadā pātu āsane sarva kāma dā  vipracittā sadā pātu citā aṅga sarva siddhaye
translated: Let Kurukulla always protect me on the seat, the giver of all desires.🔽Let Viprachitta always protect me for the accomplishment of all powers in the cremation ground.

analyzed: virodhinī sadā pātu mām sarva siddhi dā
translated: Let Virodhani always protect me, the giver of all accomplishments.

original: parvatemāṃ sadā pātu ugrā devī mahodayā //
analyzed: parvata imām sadā pātu ugrā devī mahodayā
translated: Let the fierce goddess of great prosperity always protect me on the mountain.

original: nadyāṃ pātu deveśī māṃ māyā ugraprabhā sadā /
analyzed: nadyām pātu deveśī mām māyā ugra prabhā sadā
translated: May the Goddess of the river, Maya, always protect me with fierce radiance.

analyzed: rājadvāre sadā pātu dīptā dīpta svarūpiṇī
translated: May the radiant one, in the form of brilliance, always protect at the royal gate.

original: līlā māṃ sarvadā pātu śmaśāne sarvasiddhaye /🔽sudīptā sarvadā pātu gamane vighnanāśinī //
analyzed: līlā mām sarvadā pātu śmaśāne sarva siddhaye  su dīptā sarvadā pātu gamane vighna nāśinī
translated: May Lila always protect me in the cremation ground for the sake of all accomplishments.🔽May the well-radiant one, the destroyer of obstacles in travel, always protect.

analyzed: adīptā sarvadā pātu śayane śatru nāśinī
translated: May the non-radiant one, the destroyer of enemies while sleeping, always protect.

original: vidīptā sarvadā pātu bhojane sarvasiddhidā //🔽sadā nīlā ghanā pātu kārāgāre śivapriyā /
analyzed: vidīptā sarvadā pātu bhojane sarva siddhi dā  sadā nīlā ghanā pātu kārāgāre śiva priyā
translated: May the well-radiant one, the bestower of all accomplishments while eating, always protect.🔽May the dark and dense one, the beloved of Shiva, always protect in the prison.

original: līlā māṃ sarvadā pātu pramattya sthānayogataḥ //
analyzed: līlā mām sarvadā pātu pramattya sthāna yogataḥ
translated: May Lila always protect me from the place of carelessness.

original: mātrā māṃ sarvadā pātu yoṣitāṃ saṅgayogataḥ /
analyzed: mātrā mām sarvadā pātu yoṣitām saṅga yogataḥ
translated: May the mother always protect me from the association with women.

original: pramātrā sarvadā pātu devyāḥ pārśve samāśrayā //
analyzed: pramātrā sarvadā pātu devyāḥ pārśve samāśrayā
translated: May the great measurer always protect by resorting to the side of the Goddess.

analyzed: mātaraḥ sarvadā pāntu subhūṣaṇa bhuṣaṇā
translated: May the mothers always protect with beautiful ornaments.
May the one with the radiance of a great cloud always protect in the north, bestowing all accomplishments.

analyzed: rakta varṇā sadā pātu paścime varuṇālaye
translated: May the red-colored one always protect in the west, in the abode of Varuna.

original: hasanmukhī mahāmāyā vāyavyāṃ parirakṣatu //🔽nāgahāralatāpetā aiśānyāṃ harasundarī /
analyzed: hasat mukhī mahāmāyā vāyavyām parirakṣatu
translated: May the one with a smiling face, the great Maya, protect in the north-west.🔽May the one adorned with a necklace of serpents, the beautiful lady of Hara, protect in the north-east.

analyzed: candra ardha dhāriṇī pātu
translated: May the one who bears the crescent moon, the one who resides above, always protect.

original: sadā ekajaṭā pātu svarge martye rasātale /🔽lelihānā sadā pātu śmaśāne śatrunāśinī //
analyzed: sadā ekajaṭā pātu svarge martye rasātale  lelihānā sadā pātu śmaśāne śatru nāśinī
translated: May Ekajatā always protect in heaven, on earth, and in the netherworld.🔽May Lelīhā always protect in the cremation ground, destroying enemies.

analyzed: śava kāñcī dharā pātu preta sthāne harapriyā
translated: May the one wearing a girdle of corpses protect in the abode of ghosts, dear to Śiva.

analyzed: muṇḍa mālā dharā pātu pātu sarvatra sarvadā
translated: May the wearer of a garland of severed heads always protect everywhere and at all times.

original: tato nāgaphaṇā mūrdhnā pātu māṃ śambhusundarī /
analyzed: tatas nāga phaṇā mūrdhnā pātu mām śambhu sundarī
translated: Then may Śambhu's beautiful lady protect me with the hood of a serpent on her head.

analyzed: śava putra dharā pātu nāga hastā sadā avatu
translated: May the bearer of a corpse-son protect, may the one with serpent hands always protect.
May Goddess Guhyādikālikā protect on the back of a corpse, in the abode of ghosts.

original: tataḥ śavasutā pātu sarvatra sarvasampadā //🔽trinetrā satataṃ pātu kārāgāre śiva priyā /
analyzed: tatas śavasutā pātu sarvatra sarva sampadā  trinetrā satatam pātu kārāgāre śiva priyā
translated: Then may the daughter of a corpse protect everywhere with all wealth.🔽May the three-eyed one, dear to Śiva, always protect in prison.

analyzed: sṛkka vadhaḥ galat raktā śaṅkaṭe sarvadā avatu
translated: May the one with blood dripping from the mouth always protect in danger.

original: aṭṭahāsā mahāmāyā durge māṃ sarvadāvatu /🔽mahāmāyā maheśāni śmaśāne sarvadāvatu //
analyzed: aṭṭahāsā mahāmāyā durge mām sarvadā avatu  mahāmāyā maheśāni śmaśāne sarvadā avatu
translated: May the great illusion in the form of a loud laugh always protect me in the fort.🔽O Great Goddess, may the great illusion always protect in the cremation ground.

original: śmaśānasthā mahāmāyā saṃgrāme sarvadāvatu /🔽śmaśāne prāntare ghore durge nigaḍavandhane //🔽saṅkaṭe giridurge ca nadyāditīrasaṃyute /
analyzed: śmaśāna sthā mahāmāyā saṃgrāme sarvadā avatu  śmaśāne prāntare ghore durge nigaḍa vandhane  saṅkaṭe giri durge ca nadī ādi tīra saṃyute
translated: May the great illusion dwelling in the cremation ground always protect in battle.🔽In the cremation ground, in the terrible wilderness, in the fort, in chains,🔽In danger, in the fort on a mountain, by the banks of rivers,

original: kārāgāre prāntare ca svarge martye rasātale //
analyzed: kārā āgāre prāntare ca svarge martye rasātale
translated: In prison, in the wilderness, in heaven, on earth, in the netherworld,

original: vivāde śatrumadhye ca sabhāyāṃ vāgvāye sadā /
analyzed: vivāde śatru madhye ca sabhāyām vāgvāye sadā
translated: May Kali always protect me in disputes, amidst enemies, in assemblies, and in verbal battles.

original: śatrumadhye tathā nauṣu sadā māṃ kālikāvatu //
analyzed: śatru madhye tathā nauṣu sadā mām kālikā avatu
translated: May she always protect me amidst enemies and in battles.

original: svarge māṃ pātu deveśi brahmāṇī brahmadāyinī /
analyzed: svarge mām pātu deveśi brahmāṇī brahma dāyinī
translated: O Goddess of the gods, may Brahma's wife always protect me in heaven.

analyzed: māheśvarī sadā pātu pṛthivyām parvatātmajā
translated: May Mahesvari, the daughter of the mountain, always protect me on earth.

analyzed: yauvane satatam pātu kaumārī rūpa dhāriṇī
translated: May Kumari, the bearer of beauty, always protect me in youth.

analyzed: vyavahāre sadā pātu vaiṣṇavī viṣṇu vallabhā
translated: May Vaishnavi, the beloved of Vishnu, always protect me in worldly affairs.

analyzed: jana madhye sadā pātu jaya dā jaya varddhinī
translated: May Jayada, the increaser of victory, always protect me in the midst of people.

analyzed: saṃgrāme pātu deveśī indrāṇī vijaya pradā
translated: May Indrani, the goddess of the gods, the giver of victory, always protect me in battle.

analyzed: para rāṣṭre sadā pātu cāmuṇḍā śatru nāśinī
translated: May Chamundi, the destroyer of enemies, always protect me in the enemy's kingdom.

analyzed: lakṣmīḥ mām sarvadā pātu guhye sarva samṛddhi dā
translated: May Lakshmi, the giver of all prosperity, always protect me in secret.

analyzed: yoginī cakra sahitā kokilā
translated: May the Yogini, accompanied by the circle of her attendants, and the Kokila, always protect me.

analyzed: kavaca smaraṇāt devi labhet vā sthitam uttamam
translated: O Goddess, by remembering the Kavacha, one obtains the best position.

analyzed: aśucau vā aśucau vā api kavacam sarva kāma dam
translated: Even in impurity or impurity, the Kavacha grants all desires.

original: haviṣyāśī paṭheddhīmān sadā ca divase sudhīḥ //
analyzed: haviṣya āśī paṭhet dhīmān sadā ca divase sudhīḥ
translated: The wise one, eating sacrificial food, should always recite it during the day.

analyzed: rātrau paṭhet viśeṣeṇa rata aśaktau mahāmatiḥ
translated: The greatly wise one, in the absence of sexual ability, should recite it especially at night.

original: pāṇḍityaṃ sukavitvañca ṣaṇmāsena labhennaraḥ //🔽raṇe dyūte vivāde ca saṃgrāme śatrumadhyataḥ /
analyzed: pāṇḍityam su kavi tvañca ṣaṣ māsena labhet naraḥ  raṇe dyūte vivāde ca saṃgrāme śatru madhyatas
translated: A man can attain learning and good poetry within six months.🔽In battle, gambling, dispute, war, amidst enemies,

original: vāgvāye durgame dhīmān prapaṭhet kavacaṃ sadā //
analyzed: vāgvāye durgame dhīmān prapaṭhet kavacam sadā
translated: in speech, wind, and difficult places, the wise one should always recite the armor.

analyzed: na asādhyam vartate tasya pṛthivyām parvatatmaje
translated: Nothing is unattainable for him on earth, O Daughter of the Mountain.

original: śatravo dāsataṃ yāsti sarveṣāṃ vallabhaḥ sadā //
analyzed: śatravaḥ dāsatam yā asti sarveṣām vallabhaḥ sadā
translated: Enemies become servants, and he is always dear to all.

analyzed: guroḥ prasādam āsādya prapaṭhan kavaca sudhīḥ
translated: The wise one, having obtained the grace of the Guru and reciting the armor,

original: nāsādhyaṃ vartate tasya triṣu lokeṣu pārvati //
analyzed: na asādhyam vartate tasya triṣu lokeṣu pārvati
translated: nothing is unattainable for him in the three worlds, O Parvati.

original: gorocanākuṅkumena likhedvidyāṃ viśeṣataḥ /🔽mastake vā bhuje vāpi dhṛtvā vaśayet sakalaṃ jagat //
analyzed: gorocanā kuṅkumena likhet vidyām viśeṣataḥ  mastake vā bhuje vā api dhṛtvā vaśayet sakalam jagat
translated: One should write the Vidya especially with gorocana and saffron.🔽By wearing it on the head or arm, one can subjugate the entire world.

analyzed: śmaśāne prāntare vā api likhet kavacam uttamam
translated: In a cremation ground or a forest, one should write the excellent armor,

analyzed: raktacandana sinduraiḥ yavakaiḥ ca viśeṣataḥ  vilikhet vidhinā rātrau kavacam sura durlabham
translated: especially with red sandalwood, vermilion, and barley.🔽One should write the armor, difficult to obtain even by the gods, according to the rules at night.

analyzed: siṃha rāśau gate candre karkaṭa sthe divākare
translated: When the moon is in the sign of Leo and the sun is in Cancer,

analyzed: mīna rāśau guru gate likhet yatnena deśikaḥ
translated: and Jupiter is in the sign of Pisces, the teacher should write it carefully.

analyzed: śmaśāne vilikhet vidyām śatrūṇām māraṇe sadā
translated: One should always write the Vidya in a cremation ground for the destruction of enemies.

original: p / citāmbhasi likhed yantraṃ māraṇe śatruvaśyake /
analyzed: likhet
translated: In the water of a funeral pyre, one should draw the yantra for killing and subjugating enemies.

original: uccāṭane likhed yantraṃ gomaye kavacelake //🔽tataḥ svarṇaśalākayā likhed yantramananyadhīḥ /
analyzed: uccāṭane likhet yantram gomaye kavacelake  tatas svarṇa śalākayā likhet yantram ananya dhīḥ
translated: For expulsion, one should draw the yantra on cow dung or a protective amulet.🔽Then, with a golden stylus, one should draw the yantra with an undistracted mind.

analyzed: svarambhu kusumaiḥ śukraiḥ vilikhet vidhinā amunā
translated: With the flowers of the heavenly tree, one should draw the yantra according to this method.

original: māraṇe dveṣaṇe bhumiputre rāhorvāre likhed yataḥ /
analyzed: māraṇe dveṣaṇe bhumi putre rāhoḥ vāre likhet yatas
translated: For killing, enmity, and on the day of Mercury or Rahu, one should draw the yantra, as it is from there.

original: tasya sarvāṇi siddhāni kavacasthā caranti te //
analyzed: tasya sarvāṇi siddhāni kavacasthā caranti te
translated: All his accomplishments are accomplished, and they move in the protective amulet.

analyzed: guruṇā vaiṣṇavaiḥ vā api dhriyate yantram uttamam
translated: The excellent yantra is worn by the preceptor or by the devotees of Vishnu.

analyzed: aṇima ādi mahā siddhiḥ tasya sevya vidhīyate
translated: For him, the great accomplishments like becoming as small as an atom and so on are prescribed to be served.

analyzed: tatas saure japet mantram tathā maṅgalavāsare
translated: Then, one should recite the mantra on a Sunday or on an auspicious day,

analyzed: citāyām vāruṇa mukhe sarva siddhim labhet naraḥ
translated: on a funeral pyre facing the west, a man obtains all accomplishments.

original: aśucau vā śucau vāpi paṭhet kavacamuttamam /
analyzed: aśucau vā śucau vā api paṭhet kavacam uttamam
translated: Whether impure or pure, one should recite this excellent protective amulet.

original: tasya sarvārthasiddhiḥ syāt yad yan manasi vartate //
analyzed: tasya sarva artha siddhiḥ syāt yat yat manasi vartate
translated: For him, all objectives will be accomplished, whatever is in the mind.

original: dhanaṃ dhānyaṃ sutaṃ jāyāṃ haraṃ hastinameva ca /
analyzed: dhanam dhānyam sutam jāyām haram hastinam eva ca
translated: Wealth, grain, sons, wife, Shiva, and even an elephant,

original: kavacasya tu pāṭhādvai jāyate vatsarāt priye //
analyzed: kavacasya tu pāṭhāt vai jāyate vatsarāt priye
translated: are obtained by reciting the protective amulet for a year, O beloved.

original: kavacasya tu māhātmāṃ nāhaṃ śaknomi veditum /
analyzed: kavacasya tu māhātmām na aham śaknomi veditum
translated: But I am not able to know the greatness of the armor.

analyzed: kim maheśāni sarva siddhim labhet naraḥ
translated: O Mahesani, what is the use of many? A man obtains all accomplishments.

analyzed: iti viśvasāratantre guhyakālī kavacam samāptam
translated: Thus ends the Guhyakali Kavacha in the Vishvasara Tantra.

analyzed: krama stavam pravakṣyāmi śṛṇuṣva kamalānane
translated: I will tell the Krama Stotra, listen, O lotus-faced one.

analyzed: brāhmye muhurte utthāya guru devān namaskaret
translated: Rising in the Brahma Muhurta, one should bow to the Guru and the gods.

analyzed: vāruṇīm atham āśritya namaskuryāt upari adhas
translated: Then resorting to Varuni, one should bow above and below.

analyzed: gurubhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam namaḥ tad pādukāya ca
translated: One should always bow to the Gurus and to their sandals.

original: paraṃ parebhyaḥ parātparebhyo'pi namonamaḥ /🔽ādhāraśaktiṃ namaskṛtya kulācāraṃ namaskaret //
analyzed: param parebhyaḥ parātparebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ  ādhāra śaktim namaskṛtya kula ācāram namaskaret
translated: Salutations again and again to the Supreme, to those higher than the highest, and to those higher than the highest.🔽Having bowed to the Adhara Shakti, one should bow to the Kula conduct.

analyzed: dharma karma namaskṛtya kūrma rājāya vai namaḥ
translated: Having bowed to Dharma Karma, one should bow to the King of Tortoises.

original: anastāya namo nityaṃ varāhāya namo namaḥ //
analyzed: an astāya namaḥ nityam varāhāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: One should always bow to the Unset, and again and again bow to the Boar.

original: pṛthivyai ca namo nityaṃ kulācārebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivyai ca namaḥ nityam kula ācārebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: One should always bow to the Earth, and again and again bow to the Kula practices.

original: namo namaḥ samudrebhyo namo nityaṃ ratnairamṛtairjalaiḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ namaḥ samudrebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam ratnaiḥ amṛtaiḥ jalaiḥ
translated: Again and again salutations to the oceans, always salutations to the jewels, ambrosia, and waters.

original: kulavṛkṣebhyo namo nityaṃ kalpavṛkṣāya vai namaḥ /
analyzed: kulavṛkṣebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam kalpavṛkṣāya vai namaḥ
translated: Always salutations to the Kula trees, and salutations to the Kalpa tree.

analyzed: svarṇa siṃhāsanebhyaḥ ca mānavebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: And to the golden lion thrones and to the human beings, salutations again and again.

analyzed: catur dikṣu namasya atha sarva devān namaskaret
translated: Having saluted in the four directions, one should pay homage to all the gods.

original: vedabhyo'pi namo nityaṃ vedārthebhyo namo namaḥ //
analyzed: vedabhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam veda arthebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the Vedas and salutations again and again to the meanings of the Vedas.

original: bhucarebhyo namo nityaṃ khecarebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: bhucarebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam khecarebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the earth-wanderers and salutations again and again to the sky-wanderers.

original: yogebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ yonibhyo'pi namo namaḥ //
analyzed: yogebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam yonibhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the yogas and salutations again and again to the sources.

original: ḍākinībhyo namo nityaṃ rudrebhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: ḍākinībhyaḥ namaḥ nityam rudrebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the Dakinis and salutations again and again to the Rudras.

original: bhutebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ pretebhyopi namo namaḥ //
analyzed: bhutebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam pretebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the goblins and salutations again and again to the ghosts.

original: bhucarebhyo namo nityaṃ yakṣebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ vighnebhyo'pi🔽namo namaḥ /
analyzed: bhucarebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam         yakṣebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam vighnebhyaḥ api  namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the earth-wanderers, salutations always to the Yakshas, salutations again and again to the obstacles.

original: munibhyo'pi namo nityaṃ munīndrebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: munibhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam muni indrebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the sages and salutations again and again to the great sages.

original: rājarṣibhyo namo nityaṃ devarṣibhyo namo namaḥ //🔽haṃsebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ mūrtibhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: rājarṣibhyaḥ namaḥ nityam devarṣibhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ  haṃsebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam mūrtibhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the royal sages and salutations again and again to the divine sages.🔽Salutations always to the swans and salutations again and again to the forms.

original: bhutebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ mahābhutebhyo vai namaḥ //
analyzed: bhutebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam mahā bhutebhyaḥ vai namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the goblins and salutations again and again to the great goblins.

original: ācāryobhyo namo nityaṃ śaṅkarebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: ācāryobhyaḥ namaḥ nityam śaṅkarebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the teachers and salutations again and again to the Shankaras.

original: vaiṣṇavāya namo nityaṃ ye ca māyāvino na hi //🔽p / māyāyai praṇamennityaṃ tattvebhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: vaiṣṇavāya namaḥ nityam ye ca māyāvinaḥ na hi  māyāyai praṇamet nityam tattvebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the devotees of Vishnu, and to those who are not deceitful.🔽One should always bow to Maya, and also to the principles, salutations again and again.

original: bhāvanābhyo namo nityaṃ bhāvaśāstrebhya eva ca //
analyzed: bhāvanābhyaḥ namaḥ nityam bhāva śāstrebhyaḥ eva ca
translated: Salutations always to the contemplations, and also to the scriptures on contemplation.

original: śarīrebhyo namo nityaṃ vyāpakebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: śarīrebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam vyāpakebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the bodies, and to the all-pervading ones, salutations again and again.

original: mantrebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ mantrārthebhayo namo namaḥ //
analyzed: mantrebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the mantras, and salutations again and again to the meanings of the mantras.

analyzed: varṇa ātmikābhyaḥ ca namaḥ tad adhiṣṭhātṛ devate
translated: Salutations to those consisting of letters, and to the presiding deities of those.

original: tatpādebhyo namo nityaṃ tatpādebhyo namo namaḥ //
analyzed: tad pādebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam tad pādebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to their feet, salutations again and again to their feet.

original: bhavanābhyo namo nityaṃ bhāvaśāstrebhya eva ca /
analyzed: bhavanābhyaḥ namaḥ nityam bhāva śāstrebhyaḥ eva ca
translated: Salutations always to the abodes, and also to the scriptures on existence.

analyzed: stavebhyaḥ ca kavacebhyaḥ ca nāmabhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the hymns, to the armours, and also to the names, salutations again and again.

original: āgamebhyo namo nityaṃ tadarthebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: āgamebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam tad arthebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the scriptures, and salutations again and again to their meanings.

original: tat kriyābhyo namo nityaṃ śreṣṭhaśāsteti kīrtyate //
analyzed: tat kriyābhyaḥ namaḥ nityam śreṣṭha śāstā iti kīrtyate
translated: Salutations always to their actions, it is proclaimed as the best scripture.

original: rasebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ gandhebhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: rasebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam gandhebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the tastes, and salutations again and again to the smells.

original: pīṭhbhyo'pi namo nityaṃ tatsthebhyo'pi namo namaḥ //
analyzed: pīṭhbhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam tad sthebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the seats, and salutations again and again to those who are on them.

original: sattvebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ rājasebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: sattvebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam rājasebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the sattva principles, and salutations again and again to the rajas principles.

original: tāmasebhyo namo nityaṃ guṇebhyo'pi namo namaḥ //
analyzed: tāmasebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam guṇebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the tamas qualities, and also salutations to the qualities.

analyzed: sarva vidyā avatarebhyaḥ siddhebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to all the Siddhas who have attained knowledge, and also salutations.

analyzed: ānanda kandāya namaskṛtya sambinnālāya vai namaḥ
translated: Having bowed to the bliss-kanda, salutations to the Sambhinna-ala.

original: sarvatattvāya kamalāya prakṛti patrebhya eva ca /
analyzed: sarvatattvāya kamalāya prakṛti patrebhyaḥ eva ca
translated: To all the tattvas, to Kamala, and to the petals,

analyzed: siddhipīṭhāya saṃnyasya śava rūpa śivāya ca
translated: Having assigned to the seat of accomplishment, to Shiva in the form of a Shava,

original: tripañcārāya cakrāya namo nityaṃ namo namaḥ /
analyzed: tri pañca ārāya cakrāya namaḥ nityam namaḥ namaḥ
translated: To the wheel of fifteen and three, salutations always, again and again.

analyzed: tatrasthāyai kālikāyai guhyāyai kāmarūpiṇyai
translated: To Kalika who resides there, to the secret one who assumes the form of desire,

analyzed: kuru kūnda ādi śaktibhyaḥ kālikāyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: To the powers beginning with Kurukunda, salutations to Kalika again and again.

original: namo namaste'stu parāparakhye namo namaḥ śambhuparākrmāyai /
analyzed: namaḥ namaḥ teḥ tu parāpara khye namaḥ namaḥ śambhu parākrmāyai
translated: Salutations, salutations to you who are known as the supreme and the inferior, salutations, salutations to Shambhu's supreme prowess.

analyzed: viśāla netrām sura saṅghya vanditām sura asura abhyarcita pāda padmām
translated: The one with large eyes, worshipped by the hosts of gods, whose lotus feet are revered by gods and demons,

original: nṛmuṇḍamālāṃ kalitāṃśa arddhaiḥ parātpare te prabhavanti siddhāḥ /
analyzed: nṛ muṇḍa mālām kalita aṃśa arddhaiḥ parātpare te prabhavanti siddhāḥ
translated: Wearing a garland of human skulls, half of which is yours, the supreme Siddhas are born from you.

original: sthuleti kecit pravadanti sūkṣmā sūkṣmeti sarve munayo vadanti //
analyzed: sthulā iti kecid pravadanti sūkṣmā sūkṣmā iti sarve munayaḥ vadanti
translated: Some call you gross, all the sages say you are subtle.

original: tvāmambikāṃ naumi viśālanetre sumaṅgalaṃ dehi madīyagehe /
analyzed: tvām ambikām naumi viśāla netre su maṅgalam dehi madīya gehe
translated: O Ambika with large eyes, I praise you. Grant me auspiciousness in my house.

analyzed: tvadīya pāda ambujam evam etat niṣyvya siddhāḥ prabhavam prayānti
translated: The accomplished ones attain the origin by this very lotus feet of yours.

analyzed: mātar taraya pāpāt sarvān śokān duḥkha jagat jana vaśyān
translated: O Mother, save us all from sin, from grief, from the power of the suffering world.

original: tvannāmnā vi manasi vidhinā sarvaiḥ sakalaphalāptavidhinā //
analyzed: tvad nāmnā vi manasi vidhinā sarvaiḥ sakala phala āpta vidhinā
translated: By the recitation of your name, by the ritual, by all means, by the attainment of all fruits.

analyzed: iti viśvasāratantre guhyakālikāyaḥ krama stavaḥ samāptaḥ
translated: Thus ends the hymn of praise to Guhyakālikā in the Viśvasāra Tantra.

analyzed: iti viśvasāratantre ṣaṣṭhaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixth chapter in the Viśvasāra Tantra.

analyzed: śrī pārvatī uvāca
translated: Śrī Pārvatī said:

analyzed: devadeva mahādeva sarva śāstra viśāradaḥ
translated: O God of gods, Mahādeva, skilled in all scriptures,

analyzed: pañcamī iyā purā proktā vidyātripura pūrvikā
translated: The Vidyā beginning with Tripurā was spoken of earlier on the fifth day.

analyzed: sundarī sarva siddhānām cuḍāmaṇiḥ iti smṛtā
translated: Sundarī is remembered as the crest jewel of all accomplishments.

analyzed: tasyāḥ prabhāva sakalam kathayāmāsa tatvataḥ
translated: He truly spoke of all her power.

analyzed: tasyāḥ tat vacanam śrutvā vihasya jagadīsvaraḥ
translated: Having heard her words, the lord of the world smiled.

analyzed: kathayāmāsa tat sarvam pārvatī uktam vidhānataḥ
translated: He spoke of it all according to the ritual spoken by Pārvatī.

original: śrī īśvara uvāca /🔽na deyaṃ prākṛteloke nāśiṣyāya kathañcana /
analyzed: śrī īśvaraḥ uvāca  na deyam prākṛte loke na a śiṣyāya kathaṃcana
translated: Śrī Īśvara said:🔽It should not be given to ordinary people, nor to a non-disciple at all.

analyzed: na abhaktāya śaṭhāya enām krūrāya haṭha vādine
translated: Not to a non-devotee, a deceitful one, a cruel one, or one who speaks forcefully.

original: nindakāra sucakāya devalāya viśeṣataḥ /🔽paṭṭikākhyāyanāyaināṃ grāmayājānike tathā //
analyzed: sucakāya devalāya viśeṣataḥ  paṭṭikā ākhyāyanāya enām grāmayājānike tathā
translated: To the one who praises, to the one who speaks well, to the god, especially to the one named Pattika,

analyzed: dāridrāra lolupāya audarāya viśeṣataḥ
translated: to the village priest, to the one who is greedy for wealth, to the one who is especially greedy for food,

analyzed: śaṅkarāya na śūdrāya dadyāt vidyām viśeṣataḥ
translated: to the one who is fearful, to the one who is not a Shudra, one should especially give this knowledge.

original: rāja vā rājaputro vā sādhakaḥ parikīrtitaḥ /
analyzed: rāja putraḥ vā sādhakaḥ parikīrtitaḥ
translated: A king or a prince is declared to be a practitioner.

analyzed: abhāvat nyāsinaḥ kecid ye te yoga parāyaṇāḥ
translated: Some ascetics who are not renunciates are devoted to yoga.

analyzed: namāmi mad gurum śāntam pratyakṣam śiva rūpiṇam
translated: I bow to my peaceful guru, who is directly visible in the form of Shiva,

analyzed: śirasā yogapīṭha stham mukti kāma artha siddhaye
translated: seated on the seat of yoga, for the sake of attaining liberation.

analyzed: brahmā ca ādhāra śaktiḥ ca kāla asura purandaraḥ
translated: Brahma, the sustaining power, the demon Kala, Indra the lord of gods,

original: etān saṃyojya purataḥ īśvarī yojayet śivām //
analyzed: etān saṃyojya purataḥ īśvarī yojayet śivām
translated: having united these in front, one should unite the goddess Shiva.
The seed of Chandra is located in Shiva, the seed of Shiva is near it,

analyzed: mādanam śatru bījam ca tad ante bhuvaneśvarī
translated: the seed of Madana is the seed of the enemy, at the end of that is Bhuvaneshvari.

analyzed: śivabījam mādana stham śivabījam tatas param
translated: The seed of Shiva is located in Madana, the seed of Shiva is after that,
the seed of Chandra is the seed of the enemy, at the end of that is Bhuvaneshvari.

analyzed: tuṇḍa akṣaram śiva ādi stham candra bindu samanvitam
translated: The syllable of Tunda is located in Shiva, endowed with the point of Chandra,
The auspicious seed of the earth and the mountain should be combined in one place.

analyzed: śivabījam candra saṃstham kāmabījam tatas param
translated: The seed of Shiva located in the moon, then the seed of desire,

analyzed: śiva candram samuddhṛtya yojayet bhuvaneśvarī
translated: Having extracted Shiva and the moon, one should combine it with Bhuvaneśvarī.

original: sarvamekatra saṃyojya pañcapañcākṣarī bhavet /🔽pañcakūṭātmikā vidyā sarvatantreṣu gopitā //
analyzed: sarvam ekatra saṃyojya pañca pañca akṣarī bhavet  pañca kūṭa ātmikā vidyā sarva tantreṣu gopitā
translated: Having combined everything in one place, it becomes the five-syllabled mantra.🔽The knowledge consisting of five peaks is hidden in all the Tantras.

analyzed: vidyā cūḍāmaṇiḥ devi proktā sarva uttamā priye
translated: O Goddess, the crest-jewel of knowledge, spoken as the most excellent, O Beloved.

original: tava snehānmayākhyātaṃ nākhyeyaṃ yasya kasya te //
analyzed: tava snehāt mayā ākhyātam na ākhyeyam yasya kasya te
translated: It has been told by me out of affection for you, not to be told to just anyone.

analyzed: yā nityā paramā caitanya rūpiṇī
translated: She who is the eternal Supreme Shakti, whose nature is consciousness,

analyzed: tām namāmi mahādevīm pañcamīm ātma rūpiṇīm
translated: I bow to that Great Goddess, the fifth one, who is of the nature of the Self.

analyzed: yasyām sarvam samutpannam yasyām adya api tiṣṭhati
translated: In whom everything has originated and in whom it still exists,

analyzed: jayam eṣyati tām eva pañcamīm praṇamāmi aham
translated: I bow to that very fifth one, who will attain victory.

analyzed: bhūgṛham guṇarekhā ca vedadvārā upi śobhitam
translated: The earthen house, the line of qualities, and the beautifully adorned door of the Vedas,

analyzed: tri vittam ṣoḍaśa dalam tathā aṣṭa kala karṇikam
translated: The three vitta, the sixteen-petaled lotus, and the eight-spoked pericarp,

analyzed: śatru koṇam vasu trikoṇa vaindavam
translated: The enemy corner, the two directions, the eight-sided figure, and the triangular figure of Venus,

analyzed: evam etat mahā cakram mahā śrī tripurālayam
translated: Thus this great wheel is the abode of the great and glorious Tripura.

analyzed: adhas kalpi taroḥ nityam bhavānyāḥ vartma mandire
translated: Below the throne, always in the abode of the path of Bhavānī,

analyzed: ratna siṃhāsane devyāḥ tricakra praṇamāmi aham
translated: On the jeweled lion throne of the Goddess, I bow to the three wheels.

analyzed: indraḥ mām rakṣayet pūrve āgneyyām agni devatā
translated: May Indra protect me in the east, the fire deity in the southeast,

original: yāmye yamaḥ sadā pātu nairṛtyāṃ nirṛtiśca mām //🔽paścime varuṇaḥ pātu vāyavyāṃ vāyudevatā /
analyzed: yāmye yamaḥ sadā pātu nairṛtyām nirṛtiḥ ca mām  paścime varuṇaḥ pātu vāyavyām vāyu devatā
translated: May Yama always protect in the south, and Nirṛti in the southwest.🔽May Varuṇa protect in the west, the wind deity in the northwest,

analyzed: dhanadaḥ ca uttare pātu aiśānyām īśvaraḥ uvatu
translated: May Kubera protect in the north, and Īśvara in the northeast.

analyzed: ūrddham prajāpatiḥ pātu adhas ca ananta devatā
translated: May Prajāpati protect above, and the deity Ananta below,

analyzed: evam daśa diśaḥ rakṣām kurvantu devatā gaṇāḥ
translated: May the groups of gods thus protect in the ten directions.

original: gaṇeśaḥ sarvadā pātu kṣetreśaḥ pātu sarvadā /
analyzed: gaṇeśaḥ sarvadā pātu kṣetreśaḥ pātu sarvadā
translated: May Gaṇeśa always protect, may Kṣetrapāla always protect,

original: gaṇanāthaḥ sadā pātu durgā māṃ parirakṣatu //
analyzed: gaṇanāthaḥ sadā pātu durgā mām parirakṣatu
translated: May Gaṇanātha always protect, may Durgā protect me.

analyzed: vaṭukaḥ bhairavaḥ ca ante kṣetrapālaḥ api rakṣatu
translated: May Vaṭuka and Bhairava at the end, and Kṣetrapāla also protect,

original: saha ratyā sapatyā ca kāmadeveśa sarvadā //
analyzed: saha ratyā sapatyā ca kāmadeva īśa sarvadā
translated: Together with Rati and Śiva, may Kāmadeva always protect.

original: patyā sahavasanto'pi pātu māṃ nandane vane /
analyzed: patyā pātu mām nandane vane
translated: May Vasanta, along with his wife, also protect me in the Nandana forest.

analyzed: cakrasya dvāre bhavanyāḥ ratna mandire
translated: In the western door of the discus, in the jeweled abode of Bhavānī,

analyzed: śaṅkha padmi nidhiḥ rakṣām karotu mama sarvadā
translated: May the treasures of Śaṅkha and Padma always protect me.

analyzed: pātu mām ratna sopānam parama aiśvarya śobhitam
translated: May the jeweled staircase, adorned with supreme prosperity, protect me.

analyzed: rakṣayet dvāram bhavānyāḥ ratna mandire
translated: May Bhavani protect the western door of the jeweled mansion.

original: sarasvatī mahālakṣmīrmahāmāyā durgā vibhutaye //🔽bhadrakālī ca cāmuṇḍā svāhā caiva śubhaṅkarī /
analyzed: sarasvatī mahā lakṣmīḥ mahāmāyā durgā vibhutaye  bhadrakālī ca cāmuṇḍā svāhā ca eva śubhaṅkarī
translated: May Saraswati, Mahalakshmi, Mahamaya, Durga, and the all-pervading Goddess protect me for prosperity.

original: gaurī ca lokadhātrī ca vāgīśvaryādayo mama //
analyzed: gaurī ca lokadhātrī ca vāgīśvarī ādayaḥ mama
translated: May Bhadrakali, Chamunda, Swaha, Shubhankari, Gauri, the world-nurturing goddess, and the goddesses headed by Vageshwari protect me.

original: etāḥ pañcasthitāḥ sarvā rakṣāṃ kurvantu sarvadā /🔽cakrasya dakṣiṇe bhāge śrīmatpātrasya maṇḍale //
analyzed: etāḥ pañca sthitāḥ sarvāḥ rakṣām kurvantu sarvadā  cakrasya dakṣiṇe bhāge śrīmat pātrasya maṇḍale
translated: May all these five goddesses always protect me.🔽In the southern part of the chakra, in the mandala of the glorious vessel,

original: p / vahneśca maṇḍalaṃ pātu kuladevyāśca pūjane /
analyzed: vahneḥ ca maṇḍalam pātu kuladevyāḥ ca pūjane
translated: May the mandala of fire protect in the worship of the family deity.

original: pāṣaṇḍakāriṇo bhūtā bhūmau ye cāntarīkṣagāḥ //🔽divyaloka sthitā ye ca te naśyantu śivājñayā /
analyzed: pāṣaṇḍa kāriṇaḥ bhūtāḥ bhūmau ye ca antarīkṣa gāḥ  divya loka sthitāḥ ye ca te naśyantu śiva ājñayā
translated: May the beings who cause heresy, those on the ground and in the atmosphere,🔽And those who dwell in the divine world, be destroyed by Shiva's command.

original: śivaṃ kurvanta tāḥ sarvā āsane pañcadevatāḥ //
analyzed: śivam kurvanta tāḥ sarvāḥ āsane pañca devatāḥ
translated: May all these goddesses, who bring about auspiciousness, protect in the seat.

analyzed: vāstūnām adhipaḥ brahmā sraṣṭā rakṣatu sarvadā
translated: Brahma, the lord of the worlds, the creator, may he always protect.

analyzed: sūrya agni maṇḍale pūrṇe jvālinī visphuliṅginī
translated: In the full mandala of the sun and fire, with smoke, flame, heat, and blazing flames, with sparks,

original: suśrīḥ surūpā māṃ pātu mama kāmārthasiddhaye //
analyzed: suśrīḥ surūpā mām pātu mama kāma artha siddhaye
translated: May the very prosperous and beautiful goddess protect me for the accomplishment of my desires.

original: tapanī tāpinī dhūmrā marīci jvalinī ruciḥ /
analyzed: tapanī tāpinī dhūmrā marīci jvalinī ruciḥ
translated: Tapani, Tapini, Dhumra, Marichi, Jvalini, Ruci,

original: sunandā bhogadā viśvā vāriṇī dhāriṇī kṣamā //
analyzed: su nandā bhoga dā viśvā vāriṇī dhāriṇī kṣamā
translated: Sunanda, Bhogada, Vishva, Varini, Dharini, Kshama -

analyzed: etāḥ kalāḥ tu sūrya asya sūrya maṇḍala saṃsthitāḥ
translated: These are the Kalas residing in the solar disc.

original: etābhiḥ sahito nityaṃ ādityaḥ kurutāṃ mama //
analyzed: etābhiḥ sahitaḥ nityam ādityaḥ kurutām mama
translated: May the Sun, always accompanied by these, do me good.

analyzed: savituḥ maṇḍale tatra somasya amṛta maṇḍalam
translated: In the solar orb, there is the nectar orb of the Moon.
May it always protect the cause of Bhairava's bliss.

original: amṛtā mādanā pūṣā tuṣṭiḥ puṣṭī ratirdhṛtiḥ /
analyzed: amṛtā mādanā pūṣā tuṣṭiḥ puṣṭiḥ ratiḥ dhṛtiḥ
translated: Amrita, Madana, Pushan, Tushti, Pushti, Rati, Dhriti,
Shashini, Chandrika, Kanti, Jyothsna, Shri, Priti, Angada -

analyzed: pūrṇā pūrṇā amṛtā kāma dāyinyaḥ sura saṃbhavā
translated: The full, full nectar, bestowers of desires, born of the gods,

analyzed: soma maṇḍala madhya sthāḥ rakṣām kurvantu sarvadā
translated: Residing in the lunar orb, may they always protect.

analyzed: raci vedakam āpūrṇe sudhāṃśuḥ pūrṇa maṇḍale
translated: When the full moon is complete in the full orb of the nectar-filled moon,

analyzed: nakṣatra adhipatiḥ rakṣām karotu mama sarvadā
translated: May the lord of the stars always protect me.

analyzed: sūrya agni maṇḍale devi saṃpūrṇe śaśi maṇḍale
translated: O Goddess, when the solar and fiery orbs are full, and the lunar orb is full,

analyzed: ānandabhairavaḥ rakṣām karotu mama sarvadā
translated: May Ananda Bhairava always protect me.

original: tatra pūrṇāmṛte pūrṇe śaktiry vāruṇī kalā /
analyzed: tatra pūrṇa amṛte pūrṇe śaktirī vāruṇī kalā
translated: There, in the full nectar, the full Shakti is the digit of Varuni.

analyzed: ānanda rūpiṇī rakṣām karotu mama sarvadā
translated: May she, who is of the form of bliss, always protect me.
In the support of all the lower mandalas, the all-pervading Rudra, the fire of time,

original: rakṣāṃ karotu me nityaṃ yāmunaḥ prakṛtiḥ sadā //🔽tataścādhāraśakrityā mama rakṣāṃ karotu sā /
analyzed: rakṣām karotu me nityam yāmunaḥ prakṛtiḥ sadā  tatas ca ādhāra śakrityāḥ mama rakṣām karotu sā
translated: May the Yamuna, the primordial nature, always protect me.🔽And may that Adhara Shakiti always protect me.

original: kūrmastu satataṃ pātu ananto rakṣayet sadā //🔽tasya mūrddhni sthite cakre varāhaḥ parirakṣatu /
analyzed: kūrmaḥ tu satatam pātu anantaḥ rakṣayet sadā  tasya mūrddhni sthite cakre varāhaḥ parirakṣatu
translated: May the tortoise always protect me, and Ananta always protect me.🔽May the Varah form of Vishnu, situated on his head, always protect me.

original: dante tasya sthitā pṛthvī pātu nityaṃ vasundharā //🔽sadudraḥ sarvadā pātu suratnairamṛtairjjalaiḥ /
analyzed: dante tasya sthitā pṛthvī pātu nityam vasundharā  sa dudraḥ sarvadā pātu su ratnaiḥ amṛtaiḥ jalaiḥ
translated: May the earth, situated on his tusk, always protect me.🔽May the all-pervading Rudra always protect me with nectar-like jewels and water.

original: ratnadvīpastu me rakṣāṃ karotu svarṇaparvataḥ //🔽pātu māṃ nandanodyānaṃ rakṣantu kalpapādapāḥ /
analyzed: ratnadvīpaḥ tu me rakṣām karotu svarṇa parvataḥ  pātu mām nandana udyānam rakṣantu kalpapādapāḥ
translated: May the Ratna Dvipa, the golden mountain, always protect me.🔽May the Nandana garden always protect me, and the Kalpa trees always protect me.

original: adhasteyāṃ sadā pātu vicitrā ratnabhūmikā //🔽śrīratnamandiraṃ pātu satataṃ patu vedikā /
analyzed: sadā pātu vicitrā ratna bhūmikā  śrī ratna mandiram pātu satatam patu vedikā
translated: May the variegated jeweled ground always protect me from below.🔽May the jeweled mansion always protect me, and the platform always protect me.

analyzed: śvetaputram sadā pātu ratna siṃhāsanam sadā
translated: May the white son always protect me, and the jeweled lion throne always protect me.

analyzed: siṃhāsanasya parśva sthau dharmaḥ jñānañca rakṣatu
translated: May Dharma and Jnana, situated at the sides of the lion throne, always protect me.

analyzed: vairāgyam rakṣayet nityam aiśvaryam rakṣayet sadā
translated: May Vairagya always protect me, and Aishvarya always protect me.

analyzed: adharmaḥ rakṣayet nityam ajñānam parirakṣatu
translated: May Adharma (unrighteousness) always protect me, may ignorance protect me.

analyzed: avairāgyam ca mām pātu anaiśvaryam ca sarvadā
translated: May non-detachment and non-sovereignty always protect me.

analyzed: siṃhāsanasya madhya sthā māyā mām parirakṣatu
translated: May Maya, seated in the middle of the lion throne, always protect me.

original: vidyā māṃ pātu tatraiva pañcanālañca sarvadā //
analyzed: vidyā mām pātu tatra eva pañca nālam ca sarvadā
translated: May Vidyā (knowledge) always protect me there, along with the five nāḍīs (veins).

original: adhaścorddhe sadā pātu tattvarūpā ca kālikā /
analyzed: adhas ca ūrddhe sadā pātu tattva rūpā ca kālikā
translated: May Kālikā, in the form of the tattvas (principles), always protect me above and below.

original: sūryasya maṇḍalaṃ pātu pātu somasya maṇḍalam //🔽vahneśca maṇḍalaṃ pātu sattvañca pātu sarvadā /
analyzed: sūryasya maṇḍalam pātu pātu somasya maṇḍalam  vahneḥ ca maṇḍalam pātu sattvam ca pātu sarvadā
translated: May the orb of the sun protect me, may the orb of the moon protect me.🔽May the orb of fire always protect me, and may the sattva quality always protect me.

original: rajastu pātu māṃ nityaṃ pātu nityaṃ tamoguṇaḥ //
analyzed: rajaḥ tu pātu mām nityam pātu nityam tamaḥ guṇaḥ
translated: May the rajas quality always protect me, and may the tamas quality always protect me.

analyzed: jñāna māyā kalā vidyā tattva ātmane vibhūtaye
translated: To the one whose soul is in the tattvas (principles), to the one with the power of knowledge, to the one with the power of illusion, to the one with the power of arts, to the one with the power of knowledge, to the one with the power of wealth,

analyzed: ratna siṃhāsane devyāḥ rakṣām kurvantu sarvadā
translated: may the jewels and lion throne of the Goddess always protect.

analyzed: brahmā viṣṇuḥ ca rudraḥ ca īśvaraḥ ca sadāśivaḥ
translated: Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Rudra, Īśvara, and Sadāśiva,

original: ete pañca mahāpretā rakṣāṃ kurvantu sarvadā //
analyzed: ete pañca mahāpretāḥ rakṣām kurvantu sarvadā
translated: may these five great pretas always protect.

analyzed: svadhā astu vāsanam pātu pātu preta ambuja āsanam
translated: May Svadhā protect, may the seat of the pretas protect,

original: devyāsanaṃ sadā pātu pātu cakrāsanaṃ sadā //
analyzed: devyāsanam sadā pātu pātu cakrāsanam sadā
translated: may the seat of the Goddess always protect, and may the seat of the discus always protect.

analyzed: sarva mantra āsanam pātu sādhya asiddha samam sadā
translated: May the seat of all mantras always protect, along with the accomplished and unaccomplished goals.

original: īśvarī sundarī caiva vāsinī śrīśca mālinī //
analyzed: īśvarī sundarī ca eva vāsinī śrīḥ ca mālinī
translated: Isvarini, Sundari, Vasini, Shri, and Malini,

analyzed: siddha aiśvarya ādayaḥ sarvāḥ tris ādyāḥ ca pāntu mām
translated: All of them beginning with Siddhesvari, protect me.

original: samasta prakaṭā guptā tathā guptatarāśca yā //
analyzed: samasta prakaṭā guptā tathā guptatarāḥ ca yā
translated: Those who are manifest, hidden, and extremely hidden,

analyzed: sampradāya kulam kaula nirgata ati rahasya gān
translated: The lineage of transmission, the secret teachings of Kaula,

analyzed: para apara rahasya ākhyā ati pūrva rahasya gā
translated: The one known as the supreme and inferior secrets, and the extremely ancient secrets,

original: etāstu satataṃ rakṣāṃ kurvantu yognīgaṇāḥ /🔽aṇimā paścime pātu laghimā cottare sadā //
analyzed: etāḥ tu satatam rakṣām kurvantu yognī gaṇāḥ  aṇimā paścime pātu laghimā ca uttare sadā
translated: May these groups of yogis always protect me.🔽Let Aṇimā always protect from the west, and Laghimā from the north,

original: vasitvā marute pātu prākāmyā pātu īśake /
analyzed: vasitvā marute pātu prākāmyā pātu īśake
translated: Let Prākaṃyā protect me in the wind, and Īśakā in the north-east.

analyzed: bhakti siddhiḥ tathā rakṣām icchā rakṣatu nairṛte
translated: Let the accomplishment of devotion protect in the south-west, and the desire to protect in the north-west.

analyzed: adhas pātu sadā prāptiḥ sarva kāma pradāyinī
translated: Let Prāpti, the bestower of all desires, always protect from below,

analyzed: sarvakāmā sadā pātu ūrddhe ca ūrddha nivāsinī
translated: And Sarvakāmā, residing above, always protect from above.

analyzed: bhairavaḥ ca asitāṅgeyaḥ kāmarūpaḥ pīṭhake
translated: Bhairava, the lord of Aṣṭāṅga, and Kāmarūpa, in the seat,

original: brahmāṇī sahitaḥ pūrve dvāre māṃ parirakṣatu //
analyzed: brahmāṇī sahitaḥ pūrve dvāre mām parirakṣatu
translated: May Brahmāṇī along with him always protect me at the eastern door.

analyzed: saṃsthitaḥ rurubhairavaḥ
translated: Ruru Bhairava, residing in the south-east direction of Malaya,

analyzed: māheśī sahitaḥ pātu kulācarasya siddhaye
translated: May he along with Māheśī protect for the accomplishment of Kula practice.

analyzed: rakṣām kaumārī sahitaḥ yame
translated: May Chandaka, along with Kaumari, protect on the southern mountain,

analyzed: karotu bhairavaḥ nityam pūjakānām ca siddhaye
translated: for the success of the worshippers, may Bhairava always perform the protection.

original: bhairavī sahitaḥ krodhaḥ kulānte pīṭharājake /🔽nairṛtyāṃ sarvadā pātu bhogakāmārthasiddhaye //
analyzed: nairṛtyām sarvadā pātu bhoga kāma artha siddhaye
translated: May Krodha, along with Bhairavi, in the royal seat at the end of Kula,🔽always protect in the southwest for the accomplishment of the desire for enjoyment.
May Unmatta, along with Varahi, always protect in the western door,

original: unmatto bhairavo rakṣāṃ karotu sarvadā mama //
analyzed: unmattaḥ bhairavaḥ rakṣām karotu sarvadā mama
translated: may Bhairava always perform the protection for me.

analyzed: jālāndare mahā pīṭhe kapālī bhairavaḥ sadā
translated: May Kapali Bhairava always, in the great seat in the Jalandhara door,

original: indrāṇī bhairavī rakṣāṃ vāyavyāṃ prakarotu me //
analyzed: indrāṇī bhairavī rakṣām vāyavyām prakarotu me
translated: may Bhairavi Indrani perform the protection for me in the northwest.

analyzed: uḍḍīyāna uttare pīṭhe cāmuṇḍā sahitā sadā
translated: May Chamundi, along with Bhairava, always protect in the seat in the northern door,
