translated: One without a son obtains a son, and a poor person obtains wealth.

original: asādhyaṃ sādhayet sarvaṃ durlabhaṃ labhate dhruvam //
analyzed: asādhyam sādhayet sarvam durlabham labhate dhruvam
translated: He will accomplish all that is impossible to accomplish, and will certainly obtain what is difficult to obtain.

analyzed: ati duḥkha ālaye bhīte nigaḍa vandhane
translated: If one is terrified by terrible fetters in a house of extreme misery,

original: tatrā astvaṃ paṭhenbhaktya dhruvaṃ mucyet vandhanāt //
analyzed: paṭhet bhaktya dhruvam mucyet vandhanāt
translated: If one recites this with devotion, one will certainly be freed from bondage.

original: atānta rogayukto vā yadi devīṃ prapūjayet /
analyzed: atānta roga yuktaḥ vā yadi devīm prapūjayet
translated: If one is afflicted with incurable disease, if one worships the Goddess,

original: samyag vā ślokayekaṃ vā sadyorogāt pramucyate //
analyzed: samyak vā vā sadyas rogāt pramucyate
translated: By reciting this hymn properly even once, one is immediately freed from disease.

analyzed: mohana stambhana ākarṇaṇa maraṇa uccāṭanam tathā
translated: Enchantment, paralysis, eavesdropping, killing, and expulsion,

analyzed: kalpanāt eva jāyante sarva siddhim upālabhet
translated: All accomplishments are obtained by mere imagination.

analyzed: idam tripura suryā stava rājam manoharam
translated: This charming collection of hymns to Tripura-sundari,

original: rakṣāmantrastu śubhadaṃ śivena parikīrtitam //🔽chatraṃ mūrddhni sahasrapatrakamalaṃa raktaṃ sudhāvarṣaṇaṃ🔽divyastrīparicāryamāṇamaniśaṃcātmānamevaṃ sadā /
analyzed: rakṣā mantraḥ tu śubha dam śivena parikīrtitam  chatram mūrddhni raktam sudhā varṣaṇam  divya strī paricāryamāṇam aniśam ca ātmānam evam sadā
translated: The protective mantra, which bestows auspiciousness, has been proclaimed by Shiva.🔽One should always meditate on oneself as being under the parasol, the thousand-petaled lotus on the head, the red rain of nectar,

analyzed: dhyāyet mānasa paṅkaje bhagavatīm saḥ ham yaḥ tu
translated: Being served by divine women, in the lotus of the mind, filled with red lotuses,

analyzed: labhate rakṣā āspadam bhu tale
translated: I am that person who obtains all the rays, the place of protection on earth.

original: ākāśe suprakaśe sakalaguṇamayīṃ sundarīṃ rakta netrāṃ
analyzed: ākāśe su prakaśe sakala guṇa mayīm sundarīm rakta netrām
translated: In the clear sky, the beautiful one full of all good qualities, with red eyes,

analyzed: raktā padma sana sthām taruṇa ravi nibhām raktacandana prabhāvām
translated: She is seated on a red lotus, resembling the rising sun, with the radiance of red sandalwood,

original: ātmānaṃ sarvabhāvaiḥ sakalaguṇayutāṃ sarvadā yo hi paśyet /
analyzed: ātmānam sarva bhāvaiḥ sakala guṇa yutām sarvadā yaḥ hi paśyet
translated: He who always sees himself with all emotions, endowed with all good qualities,

original: sākṣād devaḥ śivo vā madanadahanakṛt khecaro jāyate saḥ //
analyzed: sākṣāt devaḥ śivaḥ vā madana dahana kṛt khecaraḥ jāyate saḥ
translated: He becomes the god Shiva himself, the destroyer of the god of love, and a sky-walker.

analyzed: iti śrī viśvasāratantre pañcamīstavarājaḥ samāptaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fifth hymn-king in the Tantra of the Essence of the Universe.

analyzed: atha dhyānam pravakṣyāmi śṛṇuṣva kamalānane
translated: Now I will tell you about meditation, listen, O lotus-faced one.

original: yasyāḥ prabhāvamātreṇa sākṣād devo bhavet sadā //
analyzed: yasyāḥ prabhāva mātreṇa sākṣāt devaḥ bhavet sadā
translated: By the mere power of which one becomes the god himself always.

analyzed: hṛd padma madhye deveśīm sundarīm cintayet sadā
translated: One should always contemplate the Goddess of the Lord of gods, Sundari, in the middle of the lotus of the heart.

analyzed: ānanda kanda saṃbhutam sambinnāla ātmakam tathā
translated: Arisen from the bulb of bliss, and likewise consisting of the stem of Sambhinna,

analyzed: rajaḥ sattva tamaḥ rekhā saṃyutam yoni maṇḍalam
translated: The Yoni-maṇḍala endowed with the lines of rajas, sattva, and tamas,

analyzed: ṣoḍaśa āra mahā padmam sarva tattva guṇa anvitam
translated: The great lotus of sixteen petals, endowed with the qualities of all principles,

analyzed: tad madhya iṣṭa dalam padmam sarva tattva guṇa anvitam
translated: In the middle of that, the lotus of eight petals, endowed with the qualities of all principles,

analyzed: tri pañca āram ca tad madhye nava koṇam tatas
translated: In the middle of that, the fifteen-spoked wheel, then the nine-angled one,

analyzed: ṣaṭkoṇam bindu nāda samanvitam
translated: The six-angled one, situated in the three-angled one, endowed with the bindu and nada,
One should always contemplate Sundari in the yantra consisting of Narayana.

analyzed: devīm dānava koṭi ghnīm surya koṭi sama prabham  rakta vastra parīdhānām nānā alaṅkāra bhūṣitām
translated: The Goddess who destroys crores of demons, who has a luster equal to crores of suns,🔽Who is clad in red garments, adorned with various ornaments,

analyzed: anargha ratna ghaṭitam mukuṭam
translated: Wearing on her head a crown studded with priceless gems,

analyzed: surya koṭi samam teje vibhatīm nayana trayam
translated: Having three eyes that shine with a brilliance equal to crores of suns,

analyzed: śava rūpa mahādeva hṛdaya upari saṃsthitām
translated: Residing on the heart of Mahadeva in the form of Shiva,

analyzed: pratyālīḍha padām ghorāḥ muktakeśīm digambarām
translated: Standing in the Pratyalidha posture, fierce, with loose hair, naked,

analyzed: śṛṅgāra rasa saṃyuktām hāva bhāva samanvitām  pāśa aṅkuśa vara abhītam vibhratīm su manoharām
translated: Endowed with the sentiment of love, accompanied by gestures and emotions,🔽Charming, holding a noose, goad, boon, and abhaya mudra,

analyzed: anaṅga ādyāḥ mahā śaktim sevitām bhava sundarīm
translated: Served by the great Shaktis beginning with Ananga, the beautiful Bhava-sundari (beautiful form of Bhava),

original: evaṃ dhyātvā yajed devīṃ sundarīṃ sumanoharām //
analyzed: evam dhyātvā yajet devīm sundarīm su manoharām
translated: Having meditated thus, one should worship the beautiful and charming Sundari Devi,

analyzed: madyaiḥ māṃsaiḥ ca śukraiḥ ca trimadhutraya saṃyutaiḥ
translated: With liquor, meat, semen, along with the three sweet substances,

analyzed: dagdha bhraṣṭa ādi dravyaiḥ madhumada viśet kāminībhiḥ ca nityam  śoṇḍaiḥ gobhiḥ nakula gavayaiḥ śūkavaiḥ muyika ādyaiḥ
translated: And with burnt and fallen substances, one should always drink with the wine and the women.🔽With elephants, cows, mongooses, buffaloes, porcupines, and other animals,

analyzed: mārjara iśikya dravaiḥ nava paśu paśubhiḥ ādrakaiḥ vā āśu gatyaiḥ
translated: With cats, dogs, and the liquid of the new animal, or with the swift-moving birds.

original: yada datsthāne vihitamanunā madyamāṃsādiśikyai rātrau pūjā /🔽niyatabhavane kīrtitā kīrtimadbhiḥ //
analyzed: vihita manunā madya māṃsa ādi śikyaiḥ rātrau pūjā  niyata bhavane kīrtitā kīrtimadbhiḥ
translated: The worship at night is prescribed in the place of wine, meat, and so on.🔽It is praised by the famous ones in a fixed abode.

analyzed: nānā yogaiḥ yuvatībhiḥ sadā bhutiḥ yāgaiḥ viśeṣaiḥ
translated: The worship with various yogas, young women, and special sacrifices is always for prosperity.

analyzed: rātrau ahniḥ prajapati sadā tatra yonau samādhau
translated: The fire is always in the womb there in meditation at night.

original: evaṃ yaḥ pujayed devīṃ sundarīṃ bhavasundarīm /
analyzed: evam yaḥ pujayet devīm sundarīm bhava sundarīm
translated: Thus, he who worships the goddess Sundari, the beautiful one of the world,

original: tasya haste bhaved devīṃ aṇimādyā guṇākarā //
analyzed: tasya haste bhavet devīm aṇima ādyā guṇa ākarā
translated: in his hand, the goddess will be the source of qualities such as the power to become small at will and so on.

original: vinā madyairvinā māṃsairvinā yonau yajet śivām /
analyzed: vinā madyaiḥ vinā māṃsaiḥ vinā yonau yajet śivām
translated: Without wine, without meat, without the womb, one should worship Shiva.

analyzed: siddhiḥ na jāyate tatra kalpa koṭi śataiḥ api
translated: Accomplishment will not arise there even in hundreds of millions of kalpas.

analyzed: māṃsa asthi majjā carvaṇyaḥ yoginyaḥ sarva kālatas
translated: The yoginis are to be chewed with meat, bones, and marrow at all times.

original: tasya hānirbhaved devi pratyahaṃ cāpareṇa kim //
analyzed: tasya hāniḥ bhavet devi pratyaham ca apareṇa kim
translated: O Goddess, there will be a loss for him every day, and what else?

analyzed: athavā tad kṣaṇāt tasya bhavet mṛtyuḥ na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Or else, there is no doubt that he will die at that very moment.

original: yatirvā bhupatirvā so'dhikārī prakīrtitaḥ //🔽vināmarairyajed devīṃ sundarīṃ yadi sādhakaḥ /
analyzed: yatiḥ vā bhu patiḥ vā saḥ ūdhikārī prakīrtitaḥ  vinā amaraiḥ yajet devīm sundarīm yadi sādhakaḥ
translated: A mendicant or a king is declared to be eligible.🔽If a practitioner worships the nameless goddess Sundari,

original: bhrātaraṃ vā tathā putraṃ khādayed tavasundarīm //
analyzed: bhrātaram vā tathā putram khādayet tavasundarīm
translated: he should make his brother or son eat the beautiful goddess.

analyzed: krama stavam pravakṣyāmi śṛṇuṣva kamalānane
translated: I will tell you the Krama Stotra, listen, O lotus-faced one.

analyzed: om gurubhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam idyā ādi
translated: Om, salutations always to the Gurus, from today onwards.

analyzed: śrī pārvatī uvāca
translated: Shri Parvati said:

analyzed: devadeva mahādeva sarva śāstra viśārada
translated: O God of gods, Mahadeva, skilled in all scriptures,

analyzed: kṛpām kuru jagannātha sarvajñaḥ asi mahāmate
translated: Show mercy, O Lord of the world, you are omniscient, O greatly wise one.

analyzed: tasyāḥ ca kavacam dravyam kathayāmāsa tattvataḥ
translated: And told her the essence of its armor truthfully.

analyzed: tasyāḥ ca vacanam śrutvā vihasya jagat īśvaraḥ
translated: Hearing her words, the Lord of the world smiled,

analyzed: kathayāmāsa tat sarvam kavacam divya rūpiṇam
translated: And told her the entire armor, which has a divine form.

analyzed: śrī īśvaraḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Ishvara said:

analyzed: kathayiṣye mahāvidyām kavacam sura durlabham
translated: I will tell the great knowledge, the armor difficult to obtain for the gods.

analyzed: tat śṛṇuṣva atra vidhinā su gopyam bhuvanatraye
translated: Listen to that here with the method, well-guarded in the three worlds.

analyzed: tasyāḥ prabhāvāt sakalam vibhāti bhuvanatrayam
translated: By her power, the entire triad of worlds shines.

analyzed: yasyāḥ sarvam samudbhūtam yasyām adya api tiṣṭhati
translated: From whom everything originated, and still exists.
The mother, the father, the mother of the world, the protector of the world in form,

analyzed: siddhi dā siddhi jantūnām asiddhāḥ duṣṭa jantavaḥ
translated: The giver of accomplishments to beings seeking accomplishments, and unsuccessful to wicked beings.

analyzed: sarva bhuta karī devi sarva bhuta svarūpiṇī
translated: The creator of all beings, O Goddess, and the embodiment of all beings,

analyzed: kakāre devī kāminī kāma dāyinī
translated: May the Goddess who is the embodiment of the letter ka protect me, the lover, the giver of desires.

analyzed: ekāre pātu mām devī mulādhāra svarūpiṇī
translated: May the Goddess in the form of the Muladhara Chakra protect me in the letter E.

original: īkāre pātu māṃ devī ratiḥ sarvasukhapradā //🔽nakāre mātu māṃ indrāṇī haravallabhā /
analyzed: īkāre pātu mām devī ratiḥ sarva sukha pradā  nakāre mātu mām indrāṇī hara vallabhā
translated: May the Goddess Rati, the bestower of all happiness, protect me in the letter I.🔽May the Goddess Indrani, the beloved of Shiva, protect me in the letter N.

original: hrīṅkāre pātu māṃ devī sarvatra śambhusudarī //
analyzed: hrīṅkāre pātu mām devī sarvatra śambhusudarī
translated: May the Goddess, the consort of Shiva, protect me everywhere in the letter H.

original: etairvarṇairmahāmāyā vāgbhavaṃ pātu mastake /🔽hakāre pātu māṃ devī śivānī haragehinī //
analyzed: etaiḥ varṇaiḥ mahāmāyā vāc bhavam pātu mastake  hakāre pātu mām devī śivānī hara gehinī
translated: May the Great Goddess in the form of Vagbhava protect me on my head with these letters.🔽May the Goddess Shivani, the consort of Shiva, protect me in the letter H.

analyzed: sakāre pātu mām devī sarva pāpa praṇāśinī
translated: May the Goddess, the destroyer of all sins, protect me in the letter S.

original: p / kakāre pātu māṃ devī kāmarūpakalā sadā //🔽lakāre pātu māṃ devī dharādharaṇirūpadhṛk /
analyzed: pātu           lakāre pātu mām devī dharā dharaṇi rūpa dhṛk
translated: May the Goddess, the embodiment of the art of love, always protect me in the letter K.🔽May the Goddess, the bearer of the form of the earth and its support, protect me in the letter L.

analyzed: hrīṅkāre pātu mām devī śaṅkara ardha śarīriṇī
translated: May the Goddess, half of the body of Shankara, protect me in the letter H.

analyzed: etaiḥ varṇaiḥ mahāmāyā pātu śakti svarūpiṇī
translated: May the Great Goddess in the form of Shakti protect me with these letters.

original: sakāre pātu māṃ devī sāvitrī śarmadāyinī /🔽kakāre pātu sarvatra kalāḥ svarasvarūpiṇī //
analyzed: sakāre pātu mām devī sāvitrī śarma dāyinī  kakāre pātu sarvatra kalāḥ svara svarūpiṇī
translated: May the Goddess Savitri, the bestower of peace, protect me in the letter S.🔽May the Goddess, the embodiment of the vowels, protect me everywhere in the letter K.

original: kakāre pātu māṃ devī lakṣmīḥ sarvalakṣaṇā /
analyzed: kakāre pātu mām devī lakṣmīḥ sarva lakṣaṇā
translated: May the Goddess Lakshmi, endowed with all auspicious marks, protect me in the letter K.

analyzed: hrīṅkāre pātu sarvatra devī tribhuvana īśvarī
translated: May the Goddess, the ruler of the three worlds, protect me everywhere in the letter H.

analyzed: etaiḥ varṇaiḥ mahāmāyā pātu śakti svarūpiṇī
translated: May the Great Goddess in the form of Shakti protect me with these letters.

analyzed: vāc bhavam mastake pātu vadane kāmarājikā
translated: May Vāgbhava protect my head, and Kāmārājikā my mouth.

original: śaktisvarūpiṇī pātu hṛdaye mantrasiddhaye /🔽sundarī sarvadā pātu sundarī parirakṣatu //
analyzed: śakti svarūpiṇī pātu hṛdaye mantra siddhaye  sundarī sarvadā pātu sundarī parirakṣatu
translated: May the one in the form of Śakti protect my heart for the accomplishment of the mantra.🔽May Sundarī always protect me, may Sundarī always guard me.

original: raktavarṇā sadā pātu sundarī sarvadā śarmadāyinī /
analyzed: rakta varṇā sadā pātu sundarī sarvadā śarma dāyinī
translated: May the red-colored Sundarī always protect me, may Sundarī always grant me bliss.

analyzed: sarva aṅga sundarī pātu sarvatra śiva dā śivā
translated: May the beautiful one of all limbs protect me everywhere, may the auspicious and benevolent Śivā always protect me.

analyzed: nānā alaṅkāra saṃyuktā sundarī pātu sarvadā
translated: May Sundarī, endowed with various ornaments, always protect me.

original: jagadāhladajananī sarvatra pātu māṃ sadā //🔽sarvamantramayī pātu sarvasaubhāgyadāyinī /
analyzed: jagat āhlada jananī sarvatra pātu mām sadā  sarva mantra mayī pātu sarva saubhāgya dāyinī
translated: May the mother who delights the world always protect me everywhere.🔽May the one full of all mantras, the bestower of all good fortune, always protect me.

analyzed: sarva lakṣmī mayī pātu paramānanda rūpiṇī
translated: May the one full of all prosperity, having the form of supreme bliss, always protect me.

original: pātu māṃ sarvadā devī nāmnā śaṅkhanidhipriyā /
analyzed: pātu mām sarvadā devī nāmnā śaṅkhanidhipriyā
translated: May the goddess always protect me, who is known as the beloved of the treasure of conch shells.

original: tataḥ padmanidhī devī śivānī śarmadāyinī //🔽dakṣiṇāmūrtirmāṃ pātu ṛṣiḥ sarvatra mastake /
analyzed: tatas padmanidhī devī śivānī śarma dāyinī  dakṣiṇāmūrtiḥ mām pātu ṛṣiḥ sarvatra mastake
translated: Then may the goddess, the treasure of lotuses, Śivānī, the bestower of bliss,🔽May the sage Dakṣiṇāmūrti always protect me on my head.

original: paṃktichandaḥ svarūpā māṃ mukhe pātu sureśvarī //
analyzed: paṃkti chandaḥ sva rūpā mām mukhe pātu sureśvarī
translated: May the goddess of gods, in the form of the Paṅkti meter, always protect my face.

analyzed: gāddhāra svara ātmikā pātu hṛdaye śaṅkarī sadā
translated: May Śaṅkarī, in the form of the Gāndhāra note, always protect my heart.

analyzed: sarva sammohinī pātu saṃkṣobhinī sadā avatu
translated: May the one who enchants all protect me, may the one who agitates always protect me.

original: sarva drāviṇī pātu sarvākarṣaṇarūpiṇī /🔽pātu sarvāhlādakarī sarvasaṃkṣobhinī sadā //
analyzed: sarva drāviṇī pātu sarva ākarṣaṇa rūpiṇī  pātu sarva āhlāda karī sarva saṃkṣobhinī sadā
translated: May Sarvadraviṇī protect, having the form of attracting all.🔽May the delighter of all always protect, and the agitator of all.

analyzed: sarva siddhi pradā pātu sarva ākarṣaṇa rūpiṇī
translated: May the bestower of all accomplishments always protect, having the form of attracting all.

original: kṣobhinī sarvadā pātu vasinī māṃ sadāvatu //
analyzed: kṣobhinī sarvadā pātu vasinī mām sadā avatu
translated: May the agitator always protect, and Vāsinī always protect me.

analyzed: ākartiṇī sadā pātu sammohinī sadā avatu
translated: May Ākarṣiṇī always protect, and Sammohinī always protect.

original: ratī devī sadā pātu bhagā māṃ sarvadāvatu //
analyzed: ratī devī sadā pātu bhagā mām sarvadā avatu
translated: May Goddess Rati always protect, and Bhaga always protect me.

analyzed: bhagāyai sarvadā pātu bhaga mālā sadā avatu
translated: May Bhaga always protect, and Bhagamālā always protect.

analyzed: bhaga sarpiṇī sadā pātu tripurā sarvadā avatu
translated: May Bhagasarpiṇī always protect, and Tripurā always protect.

original: tripurāmālinī pātu vālā māṃ sarvadāvatu /🔽māheśvarī sadā pātu kaumārī sarvadāvatu //
analyzed: tripurā mālinī pātu vālā mām sarvadā avatu  māheśvarī sadā pātu kaumārī sarvadā avatu
translated: May Tripurāmālinī protect, and Vālā always protect me.🔽May Māheśvarī always protect, and Kaumārī always protect.

analyzed: vāsinī sarvadā pātu mahāsiddhiḥ madā sadā
translated: May Vāsinī always protect, and Mahāsiddhi always protect.

analyzed: sarva vidrāviṇī pātu gaṇanāthaḥ sadā avatu
translated: May Sarva-vidrāviṇī protect, and Gaṇanātha always protect.

original: durgā devī sadā pātu vaṭukaṃ sarvadāvatu /
analyzed: durgā devī sadā pātu vaṭukam sarvadā avatu
translated: May Goddess Durgā always protect, and Vaṭuka always protect.

analyzed: kṣetrapālam sadā pātu pātu ādhāra śaktikā
translated: May Kṣetrapāla always protect, and the supporting Śakti always protect.

analyzed: anantaḥ sarvadā pātu varāhaḥ sarvadā avatu
translated: May Ananta always protect, and Varāha always protect.

analyzed: pṛthivī sarvadā pātu svarṇa siṃhāsanam tathā
translated: May the earth always protect, and the golden throne likewise.

original: raktāmṛtāmbudhisatataṃ pātu māṃ sarvakālataḥ /🔽sudhāśuvāhanaṃ pātu kalpavṛkṣa sadāvatu //
analyzed: rakta amṛta ambudhi satatam pātu mām sarva kālatas  sudhā āśu vāhanam pātu kalpavṛkṣa sadā avatu
translated: May the red nectar-water always protect me at all times.🔽May the excellent vehicle of nectar protect me, may the wish-fulfilling tree always protect me.

analyzed: śvetacchatram sadā pātu ratna dvīpaḥ sadā avatu
translated: May the white umbrella always protect me, may the jewel island always protect me.

analyzed: nandana udyāna sahitam pātu mām sarva siddhaye
translated: May the Nandana garden along with the wish-fulfilling tree protect me for the attainment of all accomplishments.

original: dikpālāḥ sarvadā pāntu indrādyāḥ kamalānane /🔽vāhanāni sadā pāntu astrāṇi pāntu sarvadā //
analyzed: dikpālāḥ sarvadā pāntu indra ādyāḥ kamalānane  vāhanāni sadā pāntu astrāṇi pāntu sarvadā
translated: May the guardians of the directions, Indra and others, always protect, O lotus-faced one.🔽May the vehicles always protect, may the weapons always protect.

analyzed: astrāṇi sarvadā pāntu yoginyaḥ pāntu sarvadā  siddhaḥ pāntu sadā devī sarva siddhi pradā avatu

original: jalamadhye maheśānī vārāhī pātu māṃ sadā //
analyzed: jala madhye maheśānī vārāhī pātu mām sadā
translated: May Mahesani, Varahi, always protect me in the water.

original: indrāṇī pātu māṃ devī devānāṃ bhayanāśinī /🔽cāmuṇḍā pātu māṃ devī araṇye bhayanāśinī //🔽aruṇā bhairavī devī gṛhe rakṣatu māṃ sadā /
analyzed: indrāṇī pātu mām devī devānām bhaya nāśinī  cāmuṇḍā pātu mām devī araṇye bhaya nāśinī  aruṇā bhairavī devī gṛhe rakṣatu mām sadā
translated: May Goddess Indrani, the destroyer of the fear of gods, protect me.🔽May Goddess Chamundi, the destroyer of fear, protect me in the forest.🔽May Goddess Aruna Bhairavi always protect me in the house.

original: muṇḍamālā dharā devī kṣudhāyāṃ pātu sarvadā //
analyzed: muṇḍa mālā dharā devī kṣudhāyām pātu sarvadā
translated: May Goddess Mundamala, the bearer of garlands of severed heads, always protect me from hunger.

original: caturbhujā mahāmāyā pātāle pātu māṃ sadā /
analyzed: caturbhujā mahāmāyā pātāle pātu mām sadā
translated: May the four-armed, great Maya always protect me in the netherworld.

original: trinetrā māṃ sadā pātu vahnimadhye bhayāpahā //
analyzed: trinetrā mām sadā pātu vahni madhye bhaya apahā
translated: May the three-eyed one, the remover of fear, always protect me amidst fire.

analyzed: nānā alaṅkāra saṃyuktā pātu sarva bhaya apahā
translated: May she, endowed with various ornaments, the remover of all fears, always protect me.

original: śavarūpamahādevahṛdayasthā sadāvatu //🔽sarvāṅgaṃ sundarī pātu sarvāṅge tripurātmikā /
analyzed: śava rūpa mahādeva hṛdaya sthā sadā avatu  sarva aṅgam sundarī pātu sarva aṅge tripura ātmikā
translated: May she, residing in the heart of Mahadeva in the form of a Shava (corpse), always protect me.🔽May Sundari always protect all my limbs, and Tripura always reside in all my limbs.

analyzed: tripurā sarvadā pātu bhairavī sarvadā avatu
translated: May Tripura always protect me, and Bhairavi always protect me.

original: iti te kathitaṃ divyaṃ kavacaṃ sarvakāmadam /
analyzed: iti te kathitam divyam kavacam sarva kāma dam
translated: Thus, I have told you the divine armor that fulfills all desires.

analyzed: bhūti karam bhīti haram mṛtyu haram śānti karam
translated: It brings prosperity, removes fear, conquers death, and brings peace.

analyzed: bhava bhañjanam siddhi karam vṛddhi karam artha karam
translated: It destroys worldly existence, brings success, growth, and wealth.

analyzed: kavacasya tu māhātmyam na aham varṣa śataiḥ api
translated: Even in hundreds of years, I cannot describe the greatness of the armor.

original: śaknomi tu maheśāni vaktuṃ tasya phalañca yat /
analyzed: śaknomi tu maheśāni vaktum tasya phalañca yat
translated: O Mahesani, I cannot tell the fruits it yields.

analyzed: pujā japa stuti phalam kavacena labhet naraḥ
translated: A man obtains the fruits of worship, japa, and praise by the armor.

analyzed: śaṭhāya bhakti hīnāya nindakāya maheśvarī
translated: O Mahesvari, it should not be shown to a deceiver, one lacking devotion, or a critic.

original: unāṅge vyatiriktāṅge trure mithyābhibhāṣaṇe //🔽na stavaṃ darśayed divyaṃ sandarśā śivahā bhavet /
analyzed: u na aṅge vyatirikta aṅge trure mithyā abhibhāṣaṇe  na stavam darśayet divyam sandarśā śiva hā bhavet
translated: If shown to one with incomplete limbs, extra limbs, or one who speaks falsely,🔽one should not show the divine praise, as showing it would lead to Shiva's destruction.

original: yatra tatra na vaktavyaṃ kavacaṃ devarūpiṇam //
analyzed: yatra tatra na vaktavyam kavacam deva rūpiṇam
translated: The armor, which is in the form of a god, should not be spoken of anywhere.

analyzed: aśucau śucau vā api sarvakālam paṭhet naraḥ
translated: A man should recite it at all times, whether in purity or impurity.

analyzed: aṇima ādi mahā siddhiḥ stasya sevā vidhīyate
translated: The great accomplishments like lightness and others are to be served by him.

analyzed: bhūri a patre maheśvari
translated: O Mahesvari, having written it with gorocana and saffron on a birch leaf,

analyzed: yāvakaiḥ raktacandanaiḥ svarambhu kusumaiḥ api
translated: with barley, red sandalwood, or self-arisen flowers,

analyzed: likhitvā svarṇa śalākayā mastake vā bhūjedhare
translated: with a golden stylus, on the head or arm,

analyzed: vartula ākāra rūpeṇa tasya siddhiḥ acañcalā
translated: In the form of a circular shape, his accomplishment is unwavering.

original: mastake vāpi savye vā dakṣiṇe vā bhūjedhare /
analyzed: mastake vā api savye vā dakṣiṇe vā bhūjedhare
translated: On the head, or on the left or right arm,

analyzed: sa snānāt sarva tīrtheṣu sarva yajñeṣu dīkṣitaḥ
translated: He is bathed in all the holy places and initiated in all the sacrifices.

analyzed: kavacam yasya dehi iyam tasya siddhi vat urataḥ
translated: For whom this armor is given, his accomplishment is near.

original: ni'sāyām vilikhed yastu śūnyāvāse tathā gṛhe //
analyzed: nisāyām vilikhet yaḥ tu śūnya āvāse tathā gṛhe
translated: One who writes it at night in an empty dwelling or house,

analyzed: niśā bhāge likhet yantram śuciḥ bhūtvā maheśvarī
translated: The one who writes the yantra at night, having become pure, O Mahesvari,
On the auspicious day of the beginning, when Jupiter and Venus are in the ascendant, O Mahesvari,

original: dhyāyed guruṇā yantraṃ sarvasampat karaṃ śubham /
analyzed: dhyāyet guruṇā yantram sarva sampad karam śubham
translated: One should meditate on the yantra, which is auspicious and brings all prosperity, by the guru.

original: aṣṭamyāṃ vā navamyāṃ vā caturdaśyāmathāpi vā //
analyzed: aṣṭamyām vā navamyām vā caturdaśyām atha api vā
translated: On the eighth, ninth, or fourteenth day,

analyzed: niśāyām tu likhet yantram tasya siddhiḥ acañcalā
translated: One should write the yantra at night, his accomplishment is unwavering.

original: daśamyāñcāpi ṣaṣtyāṃ vā likhed yatnena deśikaḥ //🔽siṃharāśau gate candre karkaṭasthe divākare /
analyzed: daśamyām ca api ṣaṣtyām vā likhet yatnena deśikaḥ  siṃha rāśau gate candre karkaṭa sthe divākare
translated: And on the tenth or sixth day, the teacher should write it carefully.🔽When the moon is in the sign of Leo, and the sun is in Cancer,

analyzed: mīna rāśau gura gate vṛścika sthe śaniḥ care
translated: When Jupiter is in Pisces, and Saturn is in Scorpio,

analyzed: likhitvā dhārayet yantram uttara abhimukhī bhavān
translated: Having written the yantra, one should wear it, facing north.

analyzed: śmaśāne prāntare vā api śūnya āvāse prayatnataḥ
translated: In a cremation ground, a forest, or an empty dwelling, with effort,

analyzed: niśāyān tu likhet yantram tasya siddhiḥ acañcalā
translated: But if one writes the yantra at night, his success is unsteady.

original: vādī mukobhaved dṛṣṭvā rājācāraḥ samārabhet //🔽garvī kharvo bhavatova sarvabījjaḍatāmiyāt /
analyzed: vādī mukaḥ bhavet dṛṣṭvā rāja ācāraḥ samārabhet  garvī kharvaḥ sarva bīja jaḍa tām iyāt
translated: The speaker becomes mute upon seeing it, and the king's conduct begins.🔽The proud one becomes humble, and all seeds become inert.

analyzed: vaiśyānaraḥ bhavet śītaḥ sarvatra jaya tām iyāt
translated: The Brahmin becomes cool, and everywhere he becomes victorious.

original: kavacasya ca māhātmyaṃ nahi śaknomi veditum /
analyzed: kavacasya ca māhātmyam nahi śaknomi veditum
translated: I am not able to know the greatness of the armor.

analyzed: stava pūjā japa phalam kavace gaditam mayā
translated: The fruit of praise, worship, and japa is told in the armor by me.

analyzed: tasmāt sarvam prayatneta kavacam prapaṭhet naraḥ
translated: Therefore, a man should recite the armor with all effort.

analyzed: acirāt vāñchitam prāpya khecaraḥ bhavati dhruvam
translated: Having attained the desired object in a short time, he certainly becomes a sky-wanderer.

original: paṭhati ya iha martyo nitāmārdrāstarātmā japaphalamanume yaṃ lapsate'sau
analyzed: paṭhati yaḥ iha martyaḥ nitāma ārdra astara ātmā japa phalam anume yam lapsate au
translated: He who recites this here, with a mind moistened by devotion, obtains the fruit of japa as told.

analyzed: vidheyam
translated: That should be done.

original: sa bhavati padamuccaiḥ saṃpadāṃ pādamāśu kṣitipadamukuṭa
analyzed: sa bhavati padam uccais saṃpadām pādam āśu kṣiti pada mukuṭa
translated: He becomes of high status, the foot of wealth, the foot of the king, the crown

analyzed: lakṣmīḥ lakṣmīvān sa cira āyuḥ
translated: The glory of Lakshmi, he is prosperous and long-lived.

original: iti śāntikavacaṃ stotraṃ śaṅkareṇa ca bhāṣitam /🔽nātaḥparatarā vidyā nātaḥ parataro manuḥ //
analyzed: iti śānti kavacam stotram śaṅkareṇa ca bhāṣitam  na atas paratarā vidyā na atas parataraḥ manuḥ
translated: Thus, the peace-armor hymn was spoken by Shankara.🔽There is no knowledge higher than this, no mantra higher than this.

original: nātaḥ paratarā vidyā tīrthaṃ nātaḥ paraṃ taram /
analyzed: na atas paratarā vidyā tīrtham na atas param taram
translated: There is no knowledge higher than this, no sacred place higher than this.

analyzed: yasyāḥ sarvam samutpannam yasyām adya api tiṣṭhati
translated: From whom everything has originated and in whom it still exists,

analyzed: layam eṣyati tat sarvam laya kāme maheśvarī
translated: To whom everything will return, O Mahesvari, when it desires dissolution.

analyzed: namāmi tripurām devīm bhairavīm bhava mocanīm
translated: I bow to Goddess Tripura, Bhairavi, the liberator from worldly existence.
The bestower of all accomplishments, the direct destroyer of great sins.

analyzed: asya śrī tripurā nāma bhairavī sahasranāma stotrasya bhagavān śivaḥ ṛṣiḥ
translated: Of this thousand names of Sri Tripura Bhairavi, Lord Shiva is the rishi,

original: paṃktiścanda ādyā śaktirbhagavatī tripurabhairavī devatā sarvasamṛddhisiddhaye
analyzed: paṃktiḥ candaḥ ādyā śaktiḥ bhagavatī tripurabhairavī devatā sarva samṛddhi siddhaye
translated: The meter is Pankti, the deity is Goddess Tripura Bhairavi, for the attainment of all prosperity.

analyzed: vidi yogaḥ
translated: The yoga is as follows:

analyzed: om tripurā bhairavī īśānī yoga siddhi nivāsinī
translated: Om, the goddess of Tripura Bhairavi, the abode of yogic accomplishments,

analyzed: sarva mantra mayī devī sarva śakti phala pradā
translated: The goddess full of all mantras, the bestower of the fruits of all powers.

original: sarvādhāramayī devī sarvasampat pradā śubhā /🔽yoginī yogamātā ca yogasiddhipravartinī //
analyzed: sarva ādhāra mayī devī sarva sampad pradā śubhā
translated: The goddess who is the support of all, the auspicious bestower of all wealth,🔽The yogini, the mother of yoga, the promoter of yogic accomplishments.

original: yogadhyeyā yogamātā yogāyogavilāsinī /🔽līlā helā tathā krīḍā kālarūpapravartinī //🔽kālamātā kālarātriḥ kālī kamalavāsinī /
translated: The mother of yoga, meditated upon in yoga, the enjoyer of yoga and non-yoga,🔽Play, sport, and the promoter of the form of time.🔽The mother of time, the night of time, Kali, the abode of lotuses,
Lotus, the form of beauty, the queen of Kama Raja, action.

analyzed: kuhūḥ kapaṭa rūpā ca kapaṭā kapaṭa ākṛtiḥ
translated: Kuhu, of deceptive form, deceit, of deceptive appearance,

original: kumadā carcikā kāntā kālarātriḥ priyā sadā //🔽ghorarāvā ghorarūpā raṇadā ca ghṛṇā kṛpā /
analyzed: ghorarāvā ghorarūpā raṇadā ca ghṛṇā kṛpā
translated: Kumuda, Charcika, the beloved, the night of death, always dear,🔽Terrible sound, of terrible form, giver of battle, compassion, pity,

original: ghargharā ghoriṇī ghurṇā ghoranādapriyā sadā //🔽ghorākārā ca bhāvāḍhyā bhāvyā gharghapradā matiḥ /
analyzed: ghora ākārā ca bhāva āḍhyā bhāvyā ghargha pradā matiḥ
translated: Gharghara, terrible, whirling, always fond of terrible sounds,🔽Of terrible appearance, full of emotions, to be cherished, giver of the sound of Gharghara, the mind,

analyzed: ghaṇṭā gharghara nādā ca ghaṇṭā nāda priyā sadā
translated: A bell, with the sound of Gharghara, always fond of the sound of bells,

original: sukṣmā sukṣmatarā sthulā atisthulā mahāmatiḥ /🔽kṣāmā bhāvā tathā bhīmā bhīmanādapravartinī //
analyzed: sukṣmā sukṣmatarā sthulā atisthulā mahāmatiḥ  kṣāmā bhāvā tathā bhīmā bhīma nāda pravartinī
translated: Subtle, subtler, gross, very gross, of great intellect,🔽Emaciated, emotional, terrible, setting forth terrible sounds,
Of the form of a bee, removing fear, giving fear, destroying fear,

analyzed: śmaśāna vāsinī devī śmaśāna ālaya vāsinī
translated: The goddess dwelling in cremation grounds, dwelling in the abode of cremation grounds,

analyzed: śava āsanā śava āhārā śava dehā śiva aśivā
translated: Lying on a corpse, consuming corpses, with a corpse for a body, auspicious and inauspicious,

original: kaṇṭhadeśe śavāhārā śavakaṅkaṇamohinī //🔽danturā sudatī satyā'satyā śaṅketavāsinī /
analyzed: kaṇṭha deśe śava āhārā śava kaṅkaṇa mohinī  danturā sudatī satyā asatyā śaṅketa vāsinī
translated: Consuming corpses in the throat, enchanting with corpse bracelets,🔽Gap-toothed, with beautiful teeth, true, false, dwelling in doubt,
With a true body, taking away the true, destroying truthful speech,

analyzed: satya āśayā satya saṃjñā saṅga asaṅga vihāriṇī
translated: With true intentions, of true perception, dwelling in association and non-association,

analyzed: asaṅgā asaṅga rahitā suṣumnā saṅga mohinī
translated: Free from association and non-association, Susumna, enchanting with union,
O Maya, O mother, O great Maya, O you who revel in great intoxication,
O you who drink wine, O you who are devoted to intoxication, O you who destroy the condemners of wine,

analyzed: galat rudhira mālā ca sukka dvaya nivāsinī
translated: O you who wear a garland of dripping blood, O you who reside in two white places,

analyzed: sadā nadya māṃsapāśī mahāmadyā sumāṃsakā
translated: O you who always eat meat and drink, O you of great intoxication, O you of good flesh,

analyzed: māṃsa harā māṃsa dharā māṃsa āśī māṃsa bhakṣaṇā
translated: O you who take away flesh, O you who hold flesh, O you who eat flesh, O you who devour flesh,

original: raktapānā raktarucī raktāsyā raktalocanā //🔽raktaharā raktapriyā raktanindakanāśinī /
analyzed: rakta pānā rakta ruciḥ rakta āsyā rakta locanā
translated: O you who drink blood, O you who delight in blood, O you who have a red face, O you who have red eyes,🔽O you who take away blood, O you who love blood, O you who destroy the condemners of blood,
O you who drink blood, O you who delight in blood, O you who have a red body, O you who are very red,

O you who are pure with the flowers of the self-arisen one, O you who are very fond of the flowers of the self-arisen one,🔽O you who subsist on the flowers of the self-arisen one, O you who destroy the condemnation of the self-arisen one,🔽O you who are delighted by the flowers of the self-arisen one, O you who are born from the self-arisen one,

O you who take away the flowers of the self-arisen one, O you who destroy the condemners of the self-arisen one,🔽O you who have a garland of red flowers, O you who have red flowers, O you who have flowers of red flowers,

original: raktacandanasiktāṅgī raktacandanavandakā //🔽matsyā matsyapriyā mālā matsyabhakṣā mahodayā /
translated: O you whose limbs are moistened with red sandalwood, O you who pay homage with red sandalwood,🔽O fish, O you who love fish, O garland, O you who eat fish, O you of great prosperity,
O you who subsist on fish, O you who desire fish, O you who destroy the condemners of fish,

original: kiṅkarākṣī tathā krūrā krūrāsatyavināśinī /🔽krūrāntā kuliśāṅgī ca vajrāṅgī vajrasambhavā //
translated: The servant of the cruel one, the cruel one, the destroyer of untruth,🔽The one with a cruel end, the one with a thunderbolt body, the one with a vajra body, the one born from a vajra,
The one with a vajra body, the one with a vajra laugh, the one dwelling in a vajra skeleton,🔽The one with a deep navel, the one who grants fear, the one who removes fear,

original: bhayapradā bhayābhīmā subhīmā bhīmanādinī /🔽sundarīśobhanā satyā kṣemā kṣemaṅkarī tathā //🔽sindūrāñjitasīmantā sindūrasadṛśākṛtiḥ /
translated: The one who grants fear, the one who is fearful, the very fearful one, the one who roars fearfully,🔽The beautiful one, the splendid one, the truthful one, the safe one, the one who brings safety,🔽The one with vermilion-colored hair parting, the one with a form resembling vermilion,

original: muktārañjitanāsā ca sunāsā nimnanāsikā //🔽svarā lambodarī dīrghā dīrghaghoṇā mahotkaṭā /
analyzed: muktā rañjita nāsā ca su nāsā nimna nāsikā  svarā lambodarī dīrghā dīrghaghoṇā mahotkaṭā
translated: The one with a nose adorned with pearls, the one with a good nose, the one with a deep nose,🔽The one with a long belly, the tall one, the one with a long nose, the one with a large appearance,
The crooked one, the one with beautiful thighs, the fierce one, the one with a fierce navel, the fierce goddess,

original: aticaṇḍā pracaṇḍā ca mahācaṇḍā caṇḍaveginī /🔽caṇḍālī caṇḍikā cāṭuḥ śabdarūpā calācamu //
analyzed: aticaṇḍā pracaṇḍā ca mahācaṇḍā caṇḍaveginī  caṇḍālī caṇḍikā cāṭuḥ śabdarūpā calā camu
translated: The extremely fierce one, the very fierce one, the greatly fierce one, the one with fierce speed,🔽The caṇḍālī, the fierce one, the flatterer, the one with sound and form, the fickle one, the unmoving one,

original: campā campāvatī caukṣnā tīkṣṇapriyā kṣitiḥ /🔽jaladā jagadā yogā jagadānandakāriṇī //
translated: The one from Campā, the prosperous one, the pure one, the one fond of sharpness, the earth,🔽The cloud, the world, the one engaged in yoga, the one who brings joy to the world,
The one worshipped by the world, the mother of the world, the earth, the one who forgives the world,

original: jayo jayā janitrī ca jayanī jayadā tathā //
analyzed: jayaḥ jayā janitrī ca jayanī jayadā tathā
translated: The victory, the victorious one, the one who gives birth, the one who conquers, the one who grants victory,

original: jananī ca jagaddhātrī jayākhyā jayarūpiṇī /🔽jaganmātā jaganmānyā jayā śrījayakāriṇī //
analyzed: ca
translated: The mother of the world, the protectress of the world, known as Jaya, having the form of victory,🔽The mother of the world, worthy of the world's respect, Jaya, the bestower of victory and glory,

original: jayanī jayamātā ca jayā ca vijayā janā /🔽khḍginī khaḍgarūpā ca sukhaḍgā khaḍgadhāriṇī //
analyzed: jayanī jayamātā ca jayā ca vijayā janā  khḍginī khaḍga rūpā ca su khaḍgā khaḍga dhāriṇī
translated: The conqueror, the mother of victory, Jaya, the victorious one,🔽The wielder of the sword, having the form of the sword, with an excellent sword, holding the sword,

original: khaḍgarūpā khaḍgadharā khaḍgāṅgī khaḍgavallabhā /🔽khaḍgadā khaḍgamāyā ca khaḍgadehasamudbhavā //
translated: Having the form of the sword, holding the sword, having a sword-like body, fond of the sword,🔽The giver of the sword, having the illusion of the sword, born of a sword-like body,
The sword, holding the sword, playful, having a sword, having a sword-like crest,

original: śaṅkhinī cāpinī devī vajriṇī suṣaṇī matiḥ //🔽rāgiṇī bhindipālā ca pāśī ca aṅkuśī śavī /🔽dhanuṣī ṭaṅkinī carmī dantī ca karpamālikā //
analyzed: śaṅkhinī cāpinī devī vajriṇī suṣaṇī matiḥ  rāgiṇī bhindipālā ca pāśī ca aṅkuśī śavī
translated: The goddess holding a conch, a bow, a thunderbolt, and having good thoughts,🔽Passionate, the protector of the blind, holding a noose, holding a goad, holding a corpse,🔽Holding a bow, holding a stick, holding a shield, holding a tusk, wearing a garland of skulls,

original: mudgarī hallarūpā ca tūṇī raṇanivāsinī /🔽tṛṇālayā tṛṇaharā tṛṇasambhavarūpiṇī //
analyzed: mudgarī hallarūpā ca tūṇī raṇanivāsinī
translated: Holding a mace, having the form of a plough, having a quiver, dwelling in battle,🔽Dwelling in grass, removing grass, having the form of a heap of grass,

analyzed: atṛṇā tṛṇarūpā ca tūlāṅgī tūlavallabhā
translated: Not having grass, having the form of grass, having cotton-like limbs, fond of cotton,

original: nānāstradhāriṇī devī nānā astrasamudbhavā //🔽lakṣālakṣaharā lābhā lābhadā lābhavāsinī /
analyzed: nānā astra dhāriṇī devī nānā astra samudbhavā
translated: The goddess holding various weapons, born of various weapons,🔽Destroyer of lakhs and lakhs, beneficial, the giver of benefits, dwelling in benefits,
The bringer of benefits, the bestower of benefits, having benefits, having the form of benefits,

original: dharitrī dhanadā dhanyā dhanyarūpā dharā dhanuḥ /🔽dhanvinī dhanuḥśabdā ca dhanurmānī dhanīdhunā //

analyzed: anuloma vilomena mantra varṇān nyaset sadā

analyzed: sapta vāram nyaset mantram paścima abhimukhībhavan

analyzed: paṭhet sahasranāma ākhyam stotram mokṣasya sādhanam

original: śmaśāne prāntare vāpi śūnye vāse tathālaye /

original: paṭhitvā kavacaṃ tatra japenmantrasahasraṣaṭ //🔽kukkuṭaṃ mūṣikaṃ meṣaṃ mahiṣaṃ narameva ca /

translated: Having offered a Bali of a cock, a rat, a ram, a buffalo, and a man, smeared with blood, one should perform the Japa of the Mantra with undivided attention.

translated: Having addressed one's enemies, one should recite the two words grahṇa grahṇa (seize, seize), the two words khādaya khādaya (eat, eat), and again the two words nāśaya nāśaya (destroy, destroy).

analyzed: siddhim dehi pada dvandvam dviṭha antam tatas  tadā mantram japet dhīmān yāvat bhītiḥ na jāyate
translated: Then one should utter the concluding syllable dvitīya (second).🔽Then the wise one should recite the mantra as long as fear does not arise.

analyzed: anima ādiḥ mahāsiddhiḥ bhavet tasya vaset tadā  dagdha mīnam dagdha māṃsam rakta sākam divāniśam

analyzed: śmaśāne prāntare da tvā vidhinā prajapet manum
translated: in the cremation ground or in the forest, one should recite the mantra according to the prescribed procedure.

analyzed: ṣaṣ māsena bhavet vāgmī maheśaḥ ca eva ca aparaḥ
translated: Within six months, he would become eloquent and another one would become Mahesha (great lord).

original: svayambhu kusumaiḥ śukraiḥ pūjayenmarddhinīṃ sadā /🔽ākheṭakamupākhyānaṃ sadā kuryād dinatrayam //

analyzed: puraścaraṇa kāle tu purā kuryāt dina trayam
translated: At the time of the preliminary practice, one should do it for three days in the beginning.

analyzed: nityakarma sadā kuryāt manu mukhe

translated: He alone is fortunate, he is a Vaishnava, and he is also a Shakta.

analyzed: niśāyām prajapet mantram niśāyām valim ārabhet
translated: One should recite the mantra at night and start the offering at night.

analyzed: śmaśāne prāntare śūnya ālaye mantram divāniśam

analyzed: prajapet bhaktyā yāvat siddhiḥ bhavet manuḥ
translated: One should recite the mantra with devotion until the mantra becomes successful.

analyzed: aputraḥ labhate putram adhanī dhanavān bhavet
translated: One who is sonless will obtain a son, and one who is not wealthy will become wealthy.

original: arogī valavāṃścaiva jāyate nātra saṃśayaḥ //🔽māsamekaṃ paṭhet stotraṃ bhraṣṭarājyamavāpnuyāt /
analyzed: arogī valavān ca eva jāyate na atra saṃśayaḥ  māsam ekam paṭhet stotram bhraṣṭa rājyam avāpnuyāt
translated: There is no doubt that one will become healthy and strong.🔽One who recites this hymn for one month will regain a lost kingdom.

analyzed: māsa dvayam paṭhet yaḥ tu sa bhavet bhupurandvaraḥ

analyzed: saptamam paṭhate dhīmān sa bhavet putravān sukhī

analyzed: raktacandana dūrvābhiḥ kuṅkumena vidhānataḥ

analyzed: dadyāt arghyam mahādevyai trisandhyam pratyaham sadā

analyzed: sarva pāpa praśamanam sarva duḥkha vināśanam

analyzed: pūrṇa candra mukhī śyāmā su smitā cakra kuṇḍalā
translated: Having a face like the full moon, dark, with a beautiful smile, wearing earrings in the shape of a discus,

original: masī ca lekhanī lekhyā sulekhyā lekhakapriyā /
analyzed: masī ca lekhanī lekhyā sulekhyā lekhakapriyā
translated: Ink, pen, writing, well-written, dear to the writer,

analyzed: śaṅkhinī śaṅkha hastā ca jala hastā jala devatā
translated: Conch-bearing, conch-handed, water-handed, water deity,
Kuruksetra garland, Kashi, Mathura, Kanchi, Avantika,
Ayodhya, Dvaraka, Maya, the best of holy places, the giver of the plough,

analyzed: tripuṣkarā prameyā ca svarūpā rūpavarddhinī
translated: The three holy places, the one to be measured, the one with its own form, the one that increases beauty,

analyzed: tejasvinī su tīkṣṇā ca bala dā bala dāyinī
translated: The radiant one, the very sharp one, the giver of strength, the giver of power,

original: avyaktā vyaktarūpā ca devavidyā ca śāmbhavī /
analyzed: avyaktā vyaktarūpā ca devavidyā ca śāmbhavī
translated: The unmanifest one, the one with manifest form, the divine knowledge, the one belonging to Shambhu,

analyzed: śambhu kalyāṇinī kanyā manu kanyā ca santatiḥ
translated: The auspicious maiden of Shambhu, the daughter of Manu, the progeny,
The earth, water, fire, air, space, Mahat, time, direction, the one with a garment,

analyzed: sarva kāla mayī śaktiḥ sarva śravaṇa gocarā
translated: The power that exists in all times, the one that is within the range of all hearing,

analyzed: jāgratiḥ ca suṣuptiḥ ca svapna avasthā turīyakā
translated: The one full of all knowledge, the one who fulfills all desires, the one who enlightens half of all truths,🔽The state of waking, the state of deep sleep, the state of dreaming, and the fourth state,

analyzed: tvarā manda gatiḥ mandā mandira āmoda modinī
translated: The one with haste, the slow-moving one, the slow one, the one who delights in slowness, the one who delights in fragrance,

analyzed: pāna bhūmiḥ pāna pātrā pāna bhojanakā udyatā
translated: The drinking ground, the drinking vessel, the one who is ready for drinking and eating,

analyzed: aghurṇa aruṇa netrā ca kiñcid avyakta bhāṣiṇī
translated: The one with slightly unfocused red eyes, the one who speaks slightly indistinct words,

original: āśāpurī ca dīkṣā ca dakṣā dīkṣitapūjitā //
analyzed: āśāpurī ca dīkṣā ca dakṣā dīkṣita pūjitā
translated: The city of hopes, the initiation, the skillful one, worshipped by the initiated,
The wife of the serpent, the daughter of the serpent, the enjoyer, the beloved of the serpent,

original: sarvaśāstramayī vidyā susmṛtirddharmacāriṇī //🔽śrutiḥ smṛtiśca medhā ca śreṣṭhā pātālavāsinī /
analyzed: sarva śāstra mayī vidyā su smṛtiḥ dharma cāriṇī  śrutiḥ smṛtiḥ ca medhā ca śreṣṭhā pātāla vāsinī
translated: The knowledge full of all scriptures, the good memory, the follower of dharma,🔽The heard, the remembered, the intellect, the best, the dweller in the nether world,

analyzed: mīmāṃsakā tarkavidyā ca subhaktiḥ bhakta vatsalā
translated: The Mimamsa philosophy, the knowledge of logic, the good devotion, the affectionate towards the devotees,

original: p / anābhijātanā jātirgambhīrā bhāvavarjitā /🔽nāgapāśadharā mūrtirnāgadhā nāgakuṇḍalā //
analyzed: nāgapāśa dharā mūrtiḥ nāgadhā nāga kuṇḍalā
translated: The one born of the unmanifest, the unmanifest, the profound, devoid of existence,🔽The form holding the serpent noose, the serpent rider, the serpent-eared,
The very bright, residing in the middle of the moon, dwelling in the corners of the discus,

analyzed: sarva mantra mayī vidyā sarva mantra akṣara aparā
translated: The knowledge full of all mantras, the other one with the syllables of all mantras,
The one with the sweet fame, the one flowing, the humming bee, the abode of the bee,

analyzed: mātṛ kuṇḍalam adhasthā mātṛ maṇḍala vāsinī
translated: Residing below the ear-ornaments of the mothers, dwelling in the circle of the mothers,

analyzed: sarva mantra mayī vidyā sumukhī svaranāsinī
translated: The knowledge full of all mantras, the one with a good face, the destroyer of the vowels,

original: atītā vidyamānā ca bhavānī prītimañjarī //🔽sarvasaukhyavatī śaktirāhāraparināśinī /
analyzed: atītā vidyamānā ca bhavānī prītimañjarī  sarva saukhyavatī śaktiḥ āhāra parināśinī
translated: The past, the present, the future, the one with affection, the heap of joy,🔽The one full of all happiness, the power, the destroyer of food,

analyzed: nidānam puṇya bhūtānām bhaga sāgara tāriṇī
translated: The source of meritorious beings, the one who delivers from the ocean of worldly existence,

analyzed: akrūrā ca grahavatī vigrahā graha rāja tā
translated: The non-cruel, the one with the planets, the one with the bodies, the king of the planets,

analyzed: rohiṇī dutagarbhā ca kālabhuḥ kālavartinī
translated: Rohini, having two wombs, and Kala-bhu, Kala-varti,
Free from blemishes, Kali, designated as four and eight,

original: jīrṇā ca jīrṇavarṇā ca nūtanā varavallabhā //
analyzed: jīrṇā ca jīrṇa varṇā ca nūtanā vara vallabhā
translated: Old, having an old complexion, new, the most beloved,

analyzed: ajā ca ati prītā rati rāga vivarddhinī
translated: Unborn, extremely delighted, increasing passion and attachment,🔽Five nights, five snakes, five joints, remover of fear,

original: pañcapiṇḍavatī paṃktiḥ pañcasthānanivāsinī /🔽udakyā ca vṛṣasyantī vahiḥ prasuriṇī vahiḥ //
analyzed: pañca piṇḍavatī paṃktiḥ pañca sthāna nivāsinī  udakyā ca vṛṣasyantī vahis prasuriṇī vahis
translated: Having five lumps, a row, dwelling in five places,🔽A menstruating woman, copulating with a bull, flowing externally, flowing externally,

analyzed: rajaḥ śukrayatīḥ śaktiḥ jarāyuḥ garbha dhāriṇī
translated: Shakti, the power, carrying the embryo in the amnion,
Knowing the three times, of three times, having three forms, dwelling in the city,

original: arogā śivatatvā ca kāmatatvā ca rāgiṇī /
analyzed: arogā ca kāma tatvā ca rāgiṇī
translated: Free from disease, of auspicious essence, of passionate essence, passionate,

original: prācyaprācī pratīcī ca digudīcī vidik tathā //
analyzed: prācī aprācī pratīcī ca diś udīcī vidiś tathā
translated: The eastern direction, the eastern eastern direction, the western direction, the northern direction, and the intermediate directions,

analyzed: ahaṅkṛtiḥ ahaṅkārā balajāyā balapriyā
translated: Ego, having ego, born from strength, fond of strength,

original: kṛṣakā kāmadhenī ca suśraddhaśraddhadevatā //🔽mātrāmātā mahī tṛptiḥ piturmātā pitāmahī /
analyzed: kṛṣakā kāmadhenī ca su śraddha śraddha devatā  mātrāmātā mahī tṛptiḥ pituḥ mātā pitāmahī
translated: A farmer, a wish-fulfilling cow, having great faith, the deity of faith,🔽Mother, earth, satisfaction, the mother of the father, the paternal grandmother,

original: snūyā / dauhitrinī putrī naptā pautrī śiśupriyā //
analyzed: dauhitrinī putrī naptā pautrī śiśu priyā
translated: The daughter of the son's wife, the daughter of the daughter's son, the daughter's son, the son's son, fond of children,

analyzed: stanācyā stanadhārā ca viśvayoniḥ stanandhayī
translated: The one with breasts, the one with breast milk, the universal source, the one who drinks milk from the breast,

original: śiśṛtsaṅgadharā dolā dolotkrīḍābhinandinī //🔽urvaśī kadalī kekā viśalyā śikhinartinī /🔽khaṭṭāṅgadhāriṇī khaṭṭā vāṇapuṅkhānuvartinī //
analyzed: urvaśī kadalī kekā viśalyā śikhinartinī
translated: The swing that delights in the play of swinging,🔽Urvashi, the plantain, the peacock, the thornless plant, the dancing peacock,🔽Bearing the Khatvanga staff, the Khatva, following the tail-feathers of the arrow,

original: vartinī supathā cārā parikhā ca khanirgatiḥ /
analyzed: vartinī supathā cārā parikhā ca khaniḥ gatiḥ
translated: The path, the path of good conduct, the moat, the mine, the course,

analyzed: prakāra valayā velā maryādā ca mahā udadhau
translated: The embankment, the boundary, and the great ocean,

analyzed: poṣiṇī śoṣiṇī saktiḥ dīrghakeśī su locanā
translated: The nourisher, the withdrawer, the attachment, the long-haired, the beautiful-eyed,
The graceful, the fleshy, the slender, the bearer of the Vedas and Vedangas,

analyzed: nara asṛj pāna mattā ca nara muṇḍa asthi bhūṣaṇā
translated: Intoxicated by drinking human blood, adorned with human skulls and bones,

original: akṣakrīḍā ratiḥ sārā śārikā sukhabhāṣiṇī //🔽śāmbhavī gāruḍī vidyā vāruṇī varuṇārcitā /
translated: Delighting in dice, the essence of love, the she-parrot, speaking pleasantly,🔽The Shambhavi knowledge, the Garuda knowledge, the Varuni knowledge, worshipped by Varuna,

original: vārāhī muṇḍahastā ca daṃṣṭroddhṛtavasundharā //🔽bhīmamūrtirvadānyā ca pratimā pratimāśrayā /
analyzed: vārāhī muṇḍa hastā ca daṃṣṭra uddhṛta vasundharā  bhīma mūrtiḥ vadānyā ca pratimā pratimā āśrayā
translated: The Varahi, holding a skull, the earth raised up with the tusk,🔽The terrible form, the generous, the image, the support of the image,

analyzed: sumūrtiḥ nidhi rūpā ca śālagrāma śilā śuciḥ
translated: The beautiful form, the form of the treasure, the pure Shalagrama stone,

analyzed: smṛtiḥ saṃskāra rūpā ca su saṃskāra saṃskṛtiḥ
translated: The memory, the form of purification, the well-purified refinement,

analyzed: prākṛtiḥ deśa bhāṣā ca gāthā gītiḥ prahelikā
translated: The Prakrit language, the local language, the song, the melody, the riddle,

original: iḍā ca piṅgalā caiva suṣumnā sūryarūpiṇī /
analyzed: iḍā ca piṅgalā ca eva suṣumnā sūrya rūpiṇī
translated: Ida, Pingala, and Susumna, having the form of the sun,

analyzed: śaśisūryā ca bhānusthā hrādinī mṛta rūpiṇī
translated: The moon and sun are in the sky, the roaring one is in the form of nectar.

analyzed: anurūpā vṛhat rūpā laghu rūpā guru sthitā
translated: The one with a suitable form, a large form, a light form, abiding in the heavy,

analyzed: sthāvarā jaṅgamā devī kṛta karma phala pradā
translated: The goddess who is immobile and mobile, the bestower of the fruits of actions performed.

analyzed: viṣayā krānta deha sthā nirviśeṣā jita indriyā
translated: The one with a body that has transcended the senses, without distinctions, with senses under control,
The one whose nature is consciousness, blissful consciousness, having the nature of the supreme Brahman.

analyzed: nirvikārā ca nirvairā viratiḥ satya vādinī
translated: The one without change, without enmity, dispassionate, truthful,

analyzed: puruṣa jñāna bhinnā ca khyātiḥ kaivalya dāyinī
translated: The one distinguished by the knowledge of the Purusha, famous, the bestower of liberation.

original: viviktā yoginī prājñā jantā ca vahūśrutā /
analyzed: viviktā yoginī prājñā jantā ca vahūśrutā
translated: The detached Yogini, the wise one, the one with many births, the one with much learning,

analyzed: nirīhā ca ca saraloka eka pūjitā
translated: The one without effort, the complete one, the sole worshipper of the world.
The one who serves, the one who loves service, the one who is to be served, the one who increases the fruits of service,
The one endowed with all happiness, the one auspicious in all auspicious things.

analyzed: iti sahasranāmā idam bhavānyā bhava bhāṣitam
translated: Thus, this thousand names of Bhavani, spoken by the Lord,

analyzed: yaḥ paṭhet prātar utthāya śuciḥ bhutvā samāhitaḥ
translated: One who rises in the morning, being pure and composed, and recites this,

analyzed: yaḥ ca api śṛṇuyāt nityam naraḥ niścala mānasaḥ
translated: And one who listens to this daily with a steady mind,

analyzed: eka kālam dvi kālam vā tri kālam śraddhayā anvitam
translated: Either once, twice or thrice a day, with faith,

analyzed: sarva duḥkha vinirmuktaḥ lobha krodha vivarjitaḥ
translated: He becomes free from all sorrows, devoid of greed and anger,

analyzed: yaśasvī kīrtimān dhanyaḥ sutannaḥ loka pūjitaḥ
translated: Renowned, famous, blessed, with good children, and worshipped by the world.

analyzed: rūpavān guṇa sampannaḥ prabhā vīrya samanvitaḥ
translated: Handsome, endowed with virtues, powerful and valorous,

original: śreyāṃ sa labhate nityaṃ niścalāñca śubhāṃ priyām //
analyzed: sa labhate nityam niścalām ca śubhām priyām
translated: He always attains the best, the unwavering and auspicious beloved.

analyzed: sarva pāpa vinirmuktaḥ labhate dala vṛddha tām  nityam vandhu sukṛt dārā putra pautra mahā utsavaḥ
translated: Free from all sins, he attains the increase of leaves.🔽Always having kinsmen, good wife, and great festivities of sons and grandsons,

analyzed: nanditaḥ sevitaḥ bhṛtyaiḥ vahūbhiḥ śuddha mānasaiḥ
translated: Rejoiced and served by many servants with pure minds,

original: vidyānāṃ pārago vipraḥ kṣatriyo vijayī raṇe //
analyzed: vidyānām pāragaḥ vipraḥ kṣatriyaḥ vijayī raṇe
translated: The Brahmin becomes proficient in the Vedas, the Kshatriya becomes victorious in battle,

analyzed: vaiśyaḥ ca dhana lobha āḍhyaḥ śūdraḥ ca sukham āpnuyāt
translated: The Vaishya becomes rich with wealth, and the Shudra attains happiness.

original: putrārthī labhate putraṃ dhanārthī labhate dhanam //
analyzed: putra arthī labhate putram dhana arthī labhate dhanam
translated: One desiring sons obtains sons, one desiring wealth obtains wealth,

analyzed: icchā kāmantu kāma arthī dharma arthī dharmam akṣayam
translated: One desiring sensual pleasures obtains sensual pleasures, one desiring Dharma obtains inexhaustible Dharma,

analyzed: kanyā arthī labhate kanyām rūpa śīla samanvitām
translated: One desiring a daughter obtains a daughter endowed with beauty and good character,

analyzed: kṣetram ca vahu śasyam syāt gāvaḥ ca vahu dugdha dāḥ
translated: And the field becomes very fruitful, and the cows yield much milk.

analyzed: na aśubham na āpadaḥ tasya na bhayam nṛpa śatrutaḥ
translated: He has no inauspiciousness, no calamities, no fear from the king or enemies.

analyzed: jāyate na aśubhā buddhiḥ labhate kula dhūrya tām
translated: An inauspicious thought does not arise, and one attains the status of the foremost in the family.

analyzed: na bādhante mahāntasya rakṣāṃsi manucara ādayaḥ
translated: The Rakshasas, human beings, and others do not afflict that great one.

original: na piśācā na ḍākinyo bhūtabhavyantu jambhakāḥ /🔽bālagrahābhibhūtānāṃ bālānāṃ śāntikārakam //
analyzed: na piśācāḥ na ḍākinyaḥ jambhakāḥ  bālagraha abhibhūtānām bālānām śānti kārakam
translated: Nor do the flesh-eaters, the Dakinis, the Bhutas, the Bhavyas, or the Jambhakas.🔽It brings peace to children afflicted by the Grahas of childhood.

analyzed: vahūnām prīti bhede ca maitrīkaraṇam uttamam
translated: And in the case of the separation of many friends, it is an excellent means of reconciliation.

analyzed: lauha pāśaiḥ dṛḍhaiḥ vaddhaḥ nandī veśmani durgame
translated: Bound by strong iron fetters in the inaccessible abode of Nandi,

original: tiṣṭhan śṛṇvan paṭhan martyo mucyate nātra saṃśayaḥ /🔽na dārāṇāṃ na putrāṇā na vadhūnāñca vipriyam //
analyzed: tiṣṭhan śṛṇvan paṭhan martyaḥ mucyate na atra saṃśayaḥ  na dārāṇām na putrāṇām na vadhūnām ca vipriyam
translated: A mortal who stands, listens, and reads is freed. There is no doubt about this.🔽They do not see any displeasure of wives, sons, or daughters-in-law. They do not experience sorrow.

original: paśyanti na hi te śokaṃ nṛpapūjyā bhavanti hi /
analyzed: paśyanti na hi te śokam nṛpa pūjyāḥ bhavanti hi
translated: They become worthy of worship by kings.

analyzed: andhaḥ tu labhate dṛṣṭim cakṣu rogaiḥ na vyādhyate
translated: The blind one obtains sight and is not afflicted by eye diseases.

original: vadhiraḥ śrutimāpnoti mūko vācāṃ śubhāṃ naraḥ /
analyzed: vadhiraḥ śrutim āpnoti mūkaḥ vācām śubhām naraḥ
translated: The deaf one obtains hearing, and a dumb man obtains auspicious speech.

original: patadgarbhā ca yā nārī sthiragarbhā ca jāyate //
analyzed: patat garbhā ca yā nārī sthira garbhā ca jāyate
translated: A woman who has had miscarriages gives birth to stable fetuses.

analyzed: śrāvaṇī vahūbharbhā ca svayam eva pramucyate
translated: A pregnant woman is delivered easily.

analyzed: kurṣṭhinam śīrṇa dehāḥ ye gata keśa nakha tvacaḥ
translated: Those whose bodies are emaciated, whose hair, nails, and skin are gone,

analyzed: paṭhanāt ca asya mantrasya divya kāyāḥ bhavanti te
translated: By reciting this mantra, they attain divine bodies.

analyzed: ye paṭhanti śatāvartam śucimantaḥ jita indriyaḥ
translated: Those who recite the Shatavartamantra, being pure and self-controlled,

analyzed: aputrāḥ prāpnuyuḥ putrān śṛṇuyāt na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: will obtain sons if they are sonless. Listen, there is no doubt about this.

original: mahāvyādhiparigrastā stāpayet dvividhairjvaraiḥ //🔽śrutigrasthadharo vālo divyavādī karīśvaraḥ /
analyzed: mahā vyādhi parigrastāḥ stāpayet dvividhaiḥ jvaraiḥ  vālaḥ divya vādī kari īśvaraḥ
translated: Those afflicted with great diseases, or with the two types of fever,🔽will become bearers of the Vedas, young, eloquent in divine speech, and masters of the senses.

analyzed: paṭhanāt śravaṇāt ca asya divya kāyāḥ bhavanti te
translated: By reciting and listening to this, they attain divine bodies.

analyzed: aṣṭamyām ca navamyām ca caturdaśyām viśeṣataḥ
translated: On the eighth, ninth, and especially the fourteenth day,

original: ye paṭhanti sadā martyā na te vai duḥkhabhāginaḥ //
analyzed: ye paṭhanti sadā martyāḥ na te vai duḥkha bhāginaḥ
translated: those mortals who always recite this will not suffer from misery.

analyzed: nava rātram yata āhāraḥ dṛḍha bhaktiḥ jita indriyaḥ
translated: For nine nights, with controlled diet, firm devotion, and conquered senses,
the learned one, pure, in the abode of Chandika, in the presence of her image,

analyzed: ekādaśī śata āvṛttam paṭhet dhīraḥ tu nirbhayaḥ
translated: should recite the Ekadasha Shatavartamantra, being fearless and resolute.

analyzed: sākṣāt bhagavatī tasmai prayacchet īpsitam varam
translated: The Blessed Goddess herself will grant him the desired boon.

analyzed: siddha pīṭha girau ramye siddha kṣetra surālaye
translated: On the beautiful mountain of Siddhapeetha, the abode of the gods in the sacred field of the Siddhas,

analyzed: paṭhanāt śravaṇāt ca eva siddhiḥ bhavati nā anyathā
translated: by reciting and listening to this, one attains perfection, not otherwise.

analyzed: śata āvṛttim paṭhet yaḥ tu bhūmi śāyī jita indriyaḥ
translated: He who recites it a hundred times, lying on the ground, with controlled senses,

original: svapne mūrtimayīṃ devīṃ varadāṃ so'pi paśyati //
analyzed: svapne mūrti mayīm devīm vara dām saḥ upi paśyati
translated: He too sees the goddess in his dream, in a form bestowing boons.

original: āvartanasahasrairye paṭhanti puruṣottamāḥ /🔽p / kavitvasaṃskṛte teṣāṃ śāstrāṇāṃ vyākṛtau kṛtā //
analyzed: āvartana sahasraiḥ ye paṭhanti puruṣa uttamāḥ  kavi tva saṃskṛte teṣām śāstrāṇām vyākṛtau kṛtā
translated: Those best of men who recite it with thousands of repetitions,🔽They are blessed with the power of composition and eloquence in the exposition of scriptures.

analyzed: śaktiḥ pronmīlyate teṣām anadhītā ipi pārvati
translated: O Parvati, even without studying, they possess the power of knowledge.

analyzed: nakha rāga śiraḥ ratna dviguṇīkṛta vigrahaḥ
translated: With the color of nails, the head jewel, and the body doubled,

original: prāyaścittaśca tān sarvān sevante tān maheśvarāḥ /
analyzed: prāyaścittaḥ ca tān sarvān sevante tān maheśvarāḥ
translated: All those who serve them, those great lords,

analyzed: rocanā likhitam kuṅkumena śubhe dine
translated: On an auspicious day, one should wear a birch bark inscribed with rocanā and saffron,

analyzed: dhārayet yantrite deve pūjayitvā kumārikāḥ
translated: Having worshipped the maidens, with the god restrained,

analyzed: kṣīra khaṇḍaiḥ ca bhojyaiḥ ca bhojayitvā vabhukṣitān
translated: Having fed the hungry with milk and sweetmeats,

analyzed: vadhnanti nṛpa pūjyāḥ te kīrti bhājaḥ yaśasvinaḥ
translated: They are worshipped by kings, famous and glorious.

original: śatruto na bhayaṃ tasya durjanebhyo narādhipaḥ //
analyzed: śatrutaḥ na bhayam tasya durjanebhyaḥ narādhipaḥ
translated: He has no fear from enemies, from wicked people, O king.

analyzed: rati rāga viśuddhāḥ ca vikalāḥ kāma pīḍitāḥ
translated: Pure with passion and love, incomplete, afflicted by desire,

analyzed: yauvana ākrānta deha sthā śrūyante vāma locanāḥ
translated: The left-eyed maidens are heard to be dwelling in bodies overwhelmed by youth.

original: likhitvā mūddhni kaṇṭhe vā dhārayed yo naraḥ śuciḥ /
analyzed: likhitvā mūddhni kaṇṭhe vā dhārayet yaḥ naraḥ śuciḥ
translated: The person who, being pure, writes this on his forehead or neck and wears it,

analyzed: śatadhā āyuṣyam āmantam pratiyodhaḥ na paśyati

analyzed: bhūpuram guṇa rekhā āḍhyam vajra śūla samanvitam
translated: The boundary line with three lines and endowed with thunderbolt and trident.

analyzed: nava śakti yute pīṭhe pūjayet viṣṇu vallabhām
translated: In the pedestal endowed with nine powers, one should worship the beloved of Viṣṇu.

analyzed: asyāḥ caturākṣarī śambhuvanitāyāḥ kavacasya śrī sadāśiva
translated: The author of this four-syllabled armor of the wife of Shambhu is the illustrious Sadashiva.

original: ṛṣiranaṣṭupchando vāgbhavīdevatā vāgbhavaṃ bījaṃ lajjāśaktī🔽ramākīlakaṃ kāmarājātmakaṃ kavacaṃ mama mantrakavitvapāṇḍitya
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ anaṣṭubh chandaḥ vāgbhavī devatā vāgbhavam bījam lajjā śaktī  ramā kīlakam kāmarāja ātmakam kavacam mama mantra kavi tva pāṇḍitya
translated: The sage is Anashva, the meter is Anustup, the deity is Vagbhava, the seed is Vagbhava, the Shakti is Lajja,

analyzed: sarva siddhi samṛddhaye viniyogaḥ
translated: the Kilaka is Rama, the armor is of the nature of Kama Raja, for the prosperity of all accomplishments, the application is for me.

analyzed: oṃkāraḥ mastake pātu vāgbhavī sarva siddhi dā
translated: Let Om protect my head, Vagbhava, the bestower of all accomplishments.

original: ai/ pātu cakṣuṣormadhye cakṣuryugme ca śaṅkarī //
analyzed: ai pātu cakṣuṣoḥ madhye cakṣuḥ yugme ca śaṅkarī
translated: Let Ai protect the middle of the eyes and the pair of eyes, Shankari.

original: vijayā pātu bhavane jayā pātu sadā mama /
analyzed: vijayā pātu bhavane jayā pātu sadā mama
translated: Let Vijaya protect in the abode, let Jaya always protect me.

original: śivadūtī sadā pātu sundarī pātu sarvadā //
analyzed: śivadūtī sadā pātu sundarī pātu sarvadā
translated: Let Shiva-Duti always protect, let Sundari always protect.

original: bhairavī pātu sarvatra bheruṇḍā pātu sarvadā /
analyzed: bhairavī pātu sarvatra bheruṇḍā pātu sarvadā
translated: Let Bhairavi protect everywhere, let Bherunda always protect.

original: pātu māṃ kālikā nityaṃ kālarātriḥ sadāvatu //
analyzed: pātu mām kālikā nityam kālarātriḥ sadā avatu
translated: Let Kalika always protect me, let Kalaratri always protect.

analyzed: nava durgā sadā pātu kāma ākhyā sarvadā avatu
translated: Let the nine Durga always protect, let Kamakhya always protect.

original: yoginyaḥ sarvadā pāntu mudrā pāntu sadā mama //
analyzed: yoginyaḥ sarvadā pāntu mudrā pāntu sadā mama
translated: Let the Yoginis always protect, let the Mudras always protect me.

analyzed: mātrā pāntu sadā devyaḥ cakra sthāḥ yoginī gaṇāḥ
translated: Let the Matras always protect, let the groups of Yoginis residing in the Chakras.

analyzed: sarvadā sarva kāryeṣu sarva karmasu sarvadā
translated: Always in all tasks, in all actions always.

original: pātu māṃ devadevī ca lakṣmīḥ sarvasamṛddhaye /
analyzed: pātu mām devadevī ca lakṣmīḥ sarva samṛddhaye
translated: May the Goddess of the gods, Lakshmi, protect me for all prosperity.

original: iti te kathitaṃ devi kavacaṃ sarvakāmadam //
analyzed: iti te kathitam devi kavacam sarva kāma dam
translated: Thus, O Goddess, the Kavacha that fulfills all desires has been told to you.

original: yatra tatra na vaktavyaṃ yadicchedātmano hitam /
analyzed: yatra tatra na vaktavyam yat icchet ātmanaḥ hitam
translated: It should not be spoken anywhere if one desires one's own welfare.

analyzed: śaṭhāya bhakti hīnāya nindakāya maheśvari
translated: To a deceitful person, one devoid of devotion, and a critic, O Mahesvari.

analyzed: unā aṅga itirikta aṅge darśayet na kadācana
translated: One should never show it to one with deficient limbs or surplus limbs.

original: na stavaṃ darśayed devi sandarśya śivahā bhavet //
analyzed: na stavam darśayet devi sandarśya śiva hā bhavet
translated: One should not show the hymn, O Goddess, by showing it one becomes the slayer of Shiva.

analyzed: kulīnāya mahā utsāya durgā bhakti parāya ca
translated: To one of noble birth, one devoted to great joy, one devoted to Durga,

analyzed: vaiṣṇavāya viśuddhāya dadyāt kavacam uttamam
translated: To a Vaishnava, to a pure person, one should give the excellent Kavacha.

analyzed: nija śiṣyāya bhaktyāya śāntāya dhanine tathā
translated: To one's own disciple, to one devoted, to one peaceful, and to one wealthy,

analyzed: dadyāt kavacam iti uktam sarva tantra samanvitam
translated: One should give the Kavacha said to be in accordance with all Tantras.

analyzed: śanau maṅgalavāre ca raktacandanake tathā
translated: On a Saturday, on a Tuesday, and on a day when red sandalwood is available,

analyzed: likhet
translated: One should write the Yantra in accordance with all Tantras using barley grains.

analyzed: vilikhet kavacam divyam svayambhu kusumaiḥ śubhaiḥ
translated: One should write the divine Kavacha with auspicious self-arisen flowers,

analyzed: sva śuktraiḥ para śukraiḥ ca nānā gandha samanvitaiḥ
translated: With one's own semen, with the semen of others, and with various fragrances.

analyzed: gorocanā kuṅkumena vā
translated: With gorocana, with saffron, or with red sandalwood.

analyzed: su tithau śubha yoge ca śravaṇāyām raveḥ dine
translated: On an auspicious lunar day, in a benefic yoga, in the constellation of Shravana, on a Sunday,

analyzed: aśvinyām kṛttikāyām vā phalguṇyām ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: In the constellation of Ashvini, Krittika, or especially in the constellation of Pushya,

original: indrayoge śubhayoge śukrayoge tathaiva ca //🔽kaulave vavake caiva vanije naiva sattamaḥ /
analyzed: indra yoge śubha yoge śukra yoge tathā eva ca  kaulave ca eva vanije nā eva sattamaḥ
translated: In Indra yoga, benefic yoga, and likewise in Shukra yoga,🔽In the constellation of Krittika, in the constellation of Rohini, and in the constellation of Hasta,

original: śūnyāvāse śmaśāne candra / vijane ca viśeṣataḥ //
analyzed: śūnya āvāse śmaśāne candra vijane ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: In an empty dwelling, in a cremation ground, in a solitary place, especially,

original: likhitvā ca paṭhitvā ca vaśayedakhilaṃ jagat /
analyzed: likhitvā ca paṭhitvā ca vaśayet akhilam jagat
translated: Having written and recited, one should bring the entire world under control.

original: mastake vā bhuje vāpi dhārayet vidhināmunā //🔽p / raktacandanadūrvābhiḥ kuṅkumena viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: mastake vā bhuje vā api dhārayet vidhinā amunā  raktacandana dūrvābhiḥ kuṅkumena viśeṣataḥ
translated: One should wear it on the head or arm according to this procedure.🔽With red sandalwood, durva grass, and especially with saffron,

original: sugandhikusumairgandhaiḥ pūjayitvā vidhānataḥ //🔽kumārīṃ pūjayitvā ca yajed devīṃ sanātanīm /
analyzed: sugandhi kusumaiḥ gandhaiḥ pūjayitvā vidhānataḥ  kumārīm pūjayitvā ca yajet devīm sanātanīm
translated: Having worshipped according to the prescribed method with fragrant flowers and scents,

analyzed: matsyaiḥ māṃsaiḥ kāka śūkaiḥ pūjayet para devatām
translated: Having worshipped the eternal goddess, one should worship the supreme deity with fish, meat, and kakashuka.

analyzed: ghṛta ādyaiḥ su upakaraṇaiḥ su papūpaiḥ viśeṣataḥ
translated: With ghee and other excellent offerings, especially with excellent cakes,

analyzed: brāhmaṇān bhojayitvā ca pūjayet parameśvarīm
translated: Having fed the Brahmins, one should worship the supreme goddess.

analyzed: ākheṭakam upākhyānam tatra kuryāt dina trayam
translated: One should perform the story of the hunt there for three days.

analyzed: tadā bhavet mahārakṣām śaṅkareṇa ca bhāṣitam
translated: Then there will be great protection, spoken by Shankara.

analyzed: māraṇāt dūṣaṇa ādīni labhante na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: By killing, defiling, and so on, they attain (the fruits of their actions) without a doubt.

analyzed: sa bhavet pārvatīputram sarva śāstra purastatas
translated: He becomes the son of Parvati, and then of all the scriptures.

original: gurudevaḥ śivaḥ sākṣāt patnī tasya harapriyā /
analyzed: guru devaḥ śivaḥ sākṣāt patnī tasya harapriyā
translated: The Guru is Shiva himself, and his wife is Parvati, the beloved of Shiva.

analyzed: abhedena yajet devīm tasya siddhiḥ adūrataḥ
translated: Without distinction, one should worship the Goddess, and his success is not far away.

original: paṭhati ya iha martyā nityamātrāstarātmā japaphalamanumeyaṃ prāpsyate
analyzed: paṭhati yaḥ iha martyāḥ japa phalam anumeyam prāpsyate
translated: The fruits of japa are to be inferred by those mortals who recite this daily with a pure mind.

analyzed: sauvidheyam  sa bhavati padam uccais sampad āpad amasra kṣitipa mukuṭa lakṣmīḥ lakṣaṇānām
translated: The Sauvidheya.

analyzed: cirāyūḥ
translated: He becomes of high rank, the glory of the crowns of prosperous kings, and the sign of longevity.

original: iti śrīviśvasāratantre sarasvatyāḥ kavacaṃ samāptam //🔽iti ḍhākāvibhāgera antaḥpātī māṇikagañja upavibhāgera adhīna
analyzed: iti śrī viśvasāratantre sarasvatyāḥ kavacam samāptam  iti
translated: Thus ends the Kavacha of Saraswati in the Vishvasara Tantra.

original: butunīgrāmanivāsī / ānandamohanacaṭṭopādhyāyera putra śrīrasikamohana🔽caṭṭopādhyāya kartṛka saṅkalita / sampādita o prakāśita tantrasārādi
analyzed: butunī grāma nivāsī putra śrī rasikamohana  caṭṭa upādhyāya kartṛka saṅkalita sampādita o prakāśita tantrasāra ādi
translated: Thus ends the Mahakavya Vishvasara composed by the great poet Anandamohana Chattopadhyay, the son of the great scholar and poet Rasikmohan Chattopadhyay, who was born in the village of Butuni in the Manikganj subdivision of the Dhaka district.

analyzed: vividha mūla tantra saṃgrahe viśvasāra nāma mahā tantra
translated: The great Tantra named Vishvasara is completed in the collection of various root Tantras such as Tantra Sara etc. compiled, edited and published by him.
